We skirted the coastlines of several islands, sailing south by west until we reached a small peninsula cut off from the main island by a massive stone wall. We were well received by the people of Tanaroa, the small village that guards this wall. The villagers have no name for the large island other than the Isle of Dread.

—Rory Barbarosa, Log of the Gallivant

Plesiosaurus.name: 蛇颈龙
Plesiosaurus.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmPlesiosaurus00 statblock caption=false cite=true]

我以前就在湖里游来游去，吃吃鱼，直到给我这份馈赠的那个人类对我说，我必须尽我所能去帮助冰霜少女。现在我吓跑渔民什么的，这样我就不用再做一只愚蠢的野兽了。

—梅尔杜尔登湖的怪物，启蒙蛇颈龙。

Appendix A.name: 附录 A
Appendix A.text:
Fantastic Animals

The following stat blocks in this appendix represent fantastical versions of real-world animals:

@UUID[.FJ5occovKENUe5Oq]{Blood Hawk}: Excessively aggressive hawklike avians known for stealing gems

@UUID[.IO3FQv6plccdlyiN]{Flying Snake}: Winged, venomous snakes often trained to serve as messengers

@UUID[.elcWGQGyU3lvuU5z]{Giant Eagle}: Mighty eagles that aid heroes

@UUID[.neFAvivqaFHAKD49]{Giant Elk}: Mystical guardians of the forest

@UUID[.4pciwmCodavbh37k]{Giant Fire Beetle}: Glowing, cave-dwelling beetles

@UUID[.445bqbUoIKHvwBlJ]{Giant Owl}: Avian sages and soothsayers

@UUID[.Uv5sBiJUmczYDNTf]{Giant Vulture}: Vicious vultures that serve villains

This appendix provides stat blocks for animals of the Beast type—along with many of their gigantic or mythologized kin—in alphabetical order. Most represent versions of animals that exist (or existed) in the real world. You can find descriptions of these creatures in dictionaries or other educational sources, or you might create new roles for them in your D&D worlds.

Use these stat blocks to represent the creatures they’re named for or other similar creatures. For example, the Panther stat block can also represent a mountain lion, while the Giant Goat stat block might represent a buffalo. Any of these stat blocks might also serve as fantastical animals with distinctive names and cosmetic details unique to your D&D adventures.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.bNVLyJe2MXY4EIqR classes="three right top-frame"]

Appendix B.name: 附录B
Appendix B.text:
This appendix provides conversions for stat blocks that have changed between the 2014 Monster Manual and this book, as well as lists of monsters organized by habitat, creature type, group, and Challenge Rating.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.oPPj03t60doMt1IX caption=false classes="three center"]

Monster Conversions.name: 怪物转换
Monster Conversions.text:
2014 版《怪物图鉴》里的每个怪物要么出现在这本册子里，要么有与挑战等级相匹配的替代品。如果您使用的是本册子出版之前所发布的材料，而在此处找不到数据卡，那么请查阅“数据卡转换”表，以找到您应当使用的等效数据卡。

Aarakocra.name: 鸟羽人
Aarakocra.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.e06DyDS6SacJxt2f caption=false classes="right two top-frame lift-1"]

Winged Guardians of the Sky

Habitat: Mountain, Planar (Elemental Plane of Air); Treasure: Implements, Individual

Aarakocra are birdlike folk who soar the skies of countless worlds and the endless expanses of the Elemental Plane of Air. They often resemble avians common to the lands where they dwell; some resemble hawks or condors, while others appear similar to hummingbirds or archaeopteryxes. In many lands, aarakocra tell of their ancient heroics resisting the wicked Queen of Chaos alongside the mysterious Wind Dukes of Aaqa.

Aarakocra Aeromancer.name: 鸟羽人风舞术师
Aarakocra Aeromancer.text: 鸟羽人风舞术师掌握着魔法之风，其源头乃是风之元素位面中的无尽风暴之力。

Aarakocra Skirmisher.name: 鸟羽人翔空士
Aarakocra Skirmisher.text: 鸟羽人翔空士精于在云间和飞行敌人作战。它们在攻击陆地上的威胁时常常使用从天而降的俯冲袭击。

Aboleth.name: 底栖魔鱼
Aboleth.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.9rzbJzo2uraYvE55 classes="top-frame"]

不老的异界阴谋家

栖息地： 幽暗地域，水下；宝藏：遗物

在水底深渊之中，底栖魔鱼追忆着已陨落的帝国，编织着跨越时代的阴谋大计。这些行踪不定的两栖不朽者会同时从肉体和精神上击垮他们的受害者，然后使用它们滑腻的畸变侵蚀改造这些生物，将其他生物转变为在波涛之下为他们服务的仆从。

“所谓理性只是一种脆弱的谎言，在时间长河的河岸之上，它显得赤裸又易碎。但在古老恐惧的梦境秘库中，翻涌着骇人的真理之海。现世不过孤岛，而原初潮去，正昭示着冥河潮来。”

—艾伐，全视蠕虫之叹息

底栖魔鱼拥有令人恐惧的智慧和异质的思维。它们承载着对原初世界和多元宇宙伊始时的神秘领域的完美记忆。它们隐藏的秘密数不胜数，不可测度。底栖魔鱼蛰伏于充满原初秘藏的地点：沉没帝国的遗迹、隐秘的魔法节点、或是位面间的薄弱之处。在这些巢穴中，底栖魔鱼追思过去的纪元，统御成群的心灵奴仆，吞噬着失去知觉的受害者的神智，为重夺大全做着准备。

底栖魔鱼的异界目标与手段常令其他生物难以理解。掷一次底栖魔鱼阴谋表，或从中选择一个结果来作为其阴谋的灵感来源。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmAbolethSchemes rollable classes="caption-top"]

Aboleth Lairs.name: 底栖魔鱼巢穴
Aboleth Lairs.text:
Aboleths usually dwell in submerged ruins and caverns. They keep air-filled spaces for their terrestrial servants and to hold treasures that would be damaged by water.

The region containing an aboleth’s lair is warped by it, creating the following effects:

Foul Water. Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally fouled. Creatures other than the aboleth and its allies that drink such water must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the Poisoned condition for 1 hour.

Psionic Projection. While in its lair, the aboleth can cast Project Image, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16). When casting the spell this way, the spell’s range is 1 mile, and the aboleth can use its telepathy as if it were in the illusion’s space.

If the aboleth dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Air Elemental.name: 气元素
Air Elemental.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Ex2o7zlOHRjos5Ui caption=false classes="top-frame"]

原初之风暴精魂

栖息地： 荒漠，山地，异界（气元素位面）； 宝藏：无

何物能抵御风暴之咆哮？招架雷霆之利矛？抚平美妙呼吸之渴求？气乃至强元素——敬畏它的威能吧。

—胡萨姆，微风之子，气巨灵领主

气元素是来自气元素位面的活跃精魂，它们不断变换的躯体由云雾与气流凝聚而成，还拥有模糊的肢体与朦胧面容。在它们的原生位面之外，这些元素可能会为召唤他们的魔法使用者服务，也可能聚集在不受约束的位面能量节点周围，比如狂风肆虐的山峰或无休止的风暴。在战斗中，气元素会以强劲的狂风猛击敌人或是化为旋风将对手抛飞。

气元素通常会有独特的构成方式，掷一次气元素构成表，或从中选择一个结果，以此来为气元素的外形提供灵感。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmAirElementalCo rollable classes="caption-top"]

Animal Lord.name: 兽主
Animal Lord.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Ysq9b1rDKDynLSci caption=false classes="right two"]

Immortal Regent of the Wild

Habitat: Planar (Beastlands); Treasure: Relics

Animal lords are the immortal spirits of legendary animals. They serve as the divine protectors of animals of their kind, and they appear as hybrids of humanoids and the animals they defend. They frequently change into giant, idealized versions of the animals they’re associated with—albeit with glowing eyes. When contending with people, they sometimes appear as humanlike beings with subtle, animal-like features. No matter their appearance, animal lords exhibit the instincts and predilections of the animals they represent, tempered by their intellect and experience.

Most animal lords make their homes in the Beastlands, but they occasionally journey to the Feywild or other idyllic realms. They rarely travel to the Material Plane, making exceptions only when a world faces environmental disaster or droves of animals are otherwise in jeopardy.

While I don’t deny the compliment, I assure you, I’m more akin to a god than a “pretty kitty.”

—Brother of Shadows, cat lord

You call yourself hunter, but your fear makes you smell like prey.

—Wind and Moon, wolf lord

Among the best-known animal lords are those that represent cats, hawks, lizards, and wolves, but animal lords exist for beasts of all types. Some animal lords even embody creatures that are rare or extinct on Material Plane worlds, like megafauna or dinosaurs. Using their divine might, animal lords can summon spectral animals, channel spiritual energy, and exhibit powers associated with one of three broad groups: foragers, hunters, or sages. These powers are tied to an animal lord’s personality and traits associated with the creature it resembles. Roll on or choose results from the relevant Animal Lord Appearances table to inspire what creature an animal lord resembles.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmForagerAnimalL rollable classes="caption-top"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmHunterAnimalLo rollable classes="caption-top"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmSageAnimalLord rollable classes="caption-top"]

Animated Objects.name: 活化物件
Animated Objects.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.y4bbErwCxFE2ojOy caption=false classes="top-frame"]

获得生命的平凡物件

栖息地： 城市；宝藏： 无

魔法可以操纵寻常物件，使其执行简单的任务。这些被活化的物件或许是不起眼的工具与装饰，却能忠诚地守护其创造者。这些物件听从创造它们的力量或魔法使的简单指令。如若无人看管，它们可能会长久守护某地，或是重复执行某项工作，直至损耗殆尽。

掷一次活化物件启灵表格，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定是何种魔法激发这件道具的行动能力。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmAnimatedObject rollable classes="caption-top"]

Animated Armor.name: 活化盔甲
Animated Armor.text: 活化盔甲的移动可能稳重审慎，也可能脚步笨拙。它们通常由板甲制成，很容易被误认为士兵或恐怖铠甲。其他类型的护甲，甚至金属雕像也可能成为活化盔甲。

Animated Broom.name: 活化扫帚
Animated Broom.text: 活化扫帚能保持周围环境整洁，并在必要时保卫周围环境。这些扫帚在空中四处飞舞，从意想不到的角度攻击敌人。其他飞行物件，如活化工具或法杖，也可以使用这个数据卡。

Animated Flying Sword.name: 活化凌空剑
Animated Flying Sword.text:
箱子旁躺着的正是嘲刃船长的骸骨，手上还紧握着他那把生锈的剑。你能想到当我看到那把剑从那副骨架子上飞起来时有多惊讶！那条疤现在还留着呢。

—莱芙缇·轻针，游荡者 Levity Quickstitch, Rogue

活化凌空剑就像由看不见的武者挥舞着一样。无论活化凌空剑是崭新锻造的，还是残缺不全的，其行为都一样。《玩家手册》中的其他武器也可以被活化，并使用与此处类似的游戏数据。

Animated Rug of Smothering.name: 活化闷人毯
Animated Rug of Smothering.text: 活化闷人毯可能会攻击踩在其上的任何生物，也可能被当作看起来相似的魔法物品（如飞毯Carpets of Flying），攻击说出所谓命令语的人。那些能致人于死地的挂毯、毛皮和类似物件也会使用这种数据卡。

Ankheg.name: 掘地虫
Ankheg.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.jFbOxJDngxHXAeQW caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Burrowing Insectile Predator

Habitat: Forest, Grassland; Treasure: None

Though they feed on things under the soil, ankhegs prefer live meat—your cattle, your dogs, or you.

—Feil Jenkins, sage of Kirwak

Oversize insects, ankhegs burrow close to the surface, creating sprawling underground labyrinths. From these tunnels, they burst forth to dissolve and devour smaller creatures using their acid-dripping mandibles and sprays of digestive enzymes.

Ankhegs are the bane of farmers whose grazing livestock are easy prey for these monsters. Many ankhegs hunt alone, but those in places with ample food might collect in nests of several dozen and threaten whole towns. Ankheg nests can be challenging to wipe out unless the monsters’ tunnels are cleared out and their eggs destroyed.

Ankheg tunnels are roughly cylindrical and are often littered with the remains of ankhegs’ meals and subterranean treasures. Roll on or choose a result from the Ankheg Tunnel Discoveries table to inspire what might be found in an ankheg’s tunnel.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmAnkhegTunnelDi rollable classes="caption-top clear-both"]

Arcanaloth.name: 奥法罗斯魔
Arcanaloth.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.saJxpepVsPa06B7g caption=false classes="right top-frame two lift-50"]

Yugoloth of Magical Manipulation

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes); Treasure: Arcana

While all yugoloths are fiendish manifestations of wickedness and greed, arcanaloths bend their considerable intellects toward hoarding and exploiting secrets. They then deploy these secrets to ensnare countless victims and lesser villains, beguiling foes with false promises and powerful magic.

Arcanaloths possess considerable spellcasting prowess and frequently disguise themselves with magic. While they prefer to let magical servants or other yugoloths do their fighting for them, arcanaloths can defend themselves with arcane might, banishing opponents into the pages of their magic tomes.

Arch-hag.name: 大鬼婆
Arch-hag.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ekgXrE0H9OxpH4RG caption=false classes="top-frame"]

禁忌秘密和恶毒魔法之鬼婆

栖息地： 任意；宝藏： 奥秘

大鬼婆永生不朽且难以预料，它们囤积秘密，进行魔法交易，扭曲命运以满足自己的突发奇想。这些永恒的阴谋家探寻着多元宇宙的秘密，并在追寻这神秘莫测的目标的道路上编织着奇诡的魔法。

嗬！知道太多的人会变得更老。问我你的问题吧，但你得知道，每个秘密都有价格。

—芭芭雅嘎，众巫之母

大鬼婆反复无常、自私自利、贪得无厌且装模作样，却还有着古怪的魅力。尽管如此，它们常常通过交易来推进自己的阴谋。这些鬼婆是秘密知识的源泉，尤为熟知那些关于禁忌魔法和多元宇宙秘密的学识。鬼婆可能会分享这些知识，但聆听它们的秘密总有代价。若想要换取这些秘密，大鬼婆可能会要求一项特别的差事、一件贵重的魔法物品或者非物质的货币，如某人的记忆、一年的生命或哭泣的能力，作为交换。大部分大鬼婆都会避免战斗，但如果不得不打，大鬼婆就会释放危险的魔法，比如幽魂利爪、弧状闪电、以及各种扭曲心智的法术。大鬼婆可以诅咒其他魔法使，让施法者无法念出准确的咒语，迫使施法者说出和自己原意相反的话。即使落了下风，鬼婆事先的准备也会让其以魔法溜之大吉，并开始策划复仇。

每一位大鬼婆都有一个独特的弱点，这和鬼婆过去一次影响命运的遭遇，或是某件和其魔法相对的事物有关。鬼婆会不遗余力地保守这个弱点的秘密。尽管鬼婆不会因为弱点而受到物理意义上的伤害，但只有弱点在其附近时，鬼婆才能被彻底杀死。掷一次大鬼婆克星表，或从中选择一个结果，以此作为灵感来决定一位大鬼婆有什么样的弱点。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmArchhagAnathem rollable classes="caption-top"]

Arch-hag Lairs.name: 大鬼婆巢穴
Arch-hag Lairs.text:
Each arch-hag creates a magical home, such as a hidden demiplane, a mansion atop a storm cloud, or—in the case of the arch-hag Baba Yaga—a hut atop giant chicken legs. The interiors of these lairs frequently change or exhibit bewildering features.

The region containing an arch-hag’s lair is altered by its presence, creating the following effects:

Lapsus Linguae. Creatures (excluding the hag and its allies) within 1 mile of the lair subtract 1d10 from any ability checks they make when they take the Influence action.

Meddlesome Magic. Whenever a creature other than the hag or its allies finishes a Long Rest while within 1 mile of the lair, the next time that creature casts a spell using a spell slot, it also casts Confusion centered on itself. The spell uses the creature’s spellcasting ability and doesn’t require Concentration.

If the arch-hag is destroyed or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Assassin.name: 刺客
Assassin.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.MnH1zfzozfNDhl45 caption=false classes="hike-3 top-frame"]

一手收钱，一手夺命

栖息地：任意； 宝藏： 器具，个体

刺客是专业的杀手，它们擅长悄悄接近受害者，在不被发现的情况下发动攻击。大多数刺客杀人都是有目的性的——有的是因为有人出钱买受害者的命，有的是为了自己的邪恶大业。刺客们擅使毒药以及其它杀人利器，并携带能助其潜入安全区域或避免抓捕的道具。

许多刺客都遵守某种职业准则，或是表现出某种标志性的怪癖。掷一次刺客作案风格表，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定这名刺客有什么独特的习惯。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmAssassinModusO rollable classes="caption-top"]

Awakened Plants.name: 启蒙植物
Awakened Plants.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.wyCZWeHDivGkORO1 caption=false classes="right lift-1 three top-frame"]

Vegetation Given Magical Life

Habitat: Forest; Treasure: None

Magic can invest plants with mobility, sapience, and even a voice. Spells such as Awaken or the influence of other planes of existence might bring mundane vegetation to life, while other remarkable plants might naturally have these features.

Just because we protect the forest doesn’t mean it’s defenseless.

—Rivergleam, pixie

Awakened Shrub.name: 启蒙灌木
Awakened Shrub.text: 启蒙灌木可以是任何种类的小型植物，比如森林里丛生的灌木和盛开的花朵。他们经常出没于启蒙树木周边或者是一个充斥着原初魔力的区域。一些启蒙灌木的外貌无比奇特或者有着用枝叶组成的大致面部形象，另一些则像是生物造型的活化园艺植物.

Awakened Tree.name: 启蒙大树
Awakened Tree.text: 一些启蒙大树长时间地处于静止、冥想的状态，以此让他人误认为自己是普通植物，而另一些则会在复盖着自然之力的地区巡逻。有些启蒙大树受妖精荒野的影响而诞生，它们外表鲜艳且常年繁盛；有些因堕影冥界的能量而诞生，它们长有怪诞的树瘤，或是看上去如同朽木。

Axe Beaks.name: 斧嘴鸟
Axe Beaks.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.YfapgsndlLNMhyr5 caption=false classes="right three lift-50"]

Flightless Avian Predators

Habitat: Arctic, Grassland, Hill; Treasure: None

Axe beaks are flightless, birdlike creatures with distinctive axe-shaped beaks. Swift predators, they chase down prey and use their beaks to hack through foliage protecting their quarry. Axe beaks live in varied environments. Colorfully plumed axe beaks race across tropical plains, while axe beaks with snowy feathers hunt the tundra.

Axe beaks are difficult to train, but those hatched and raised in captivity can become reliable mounts.

Axe Beak.name: 斧嘴鸟
Axe Beak.text: 斧嘴鸟独行或结小群游猎以供养族群。斧嘴鸟在协作时会采用简单的战术：一部分引开威胁，其余的袭敌要害或护送幼雏脱险。

Giant Axe Beak.name: 巨斧嘴鸟
Giant Axe Beak.text:
这玩意脸长得像斧头，其他部分瞅着像生气的大公鸡——我当然想骑它！

—巴特利·夏足，冒险者

巨斧嘴鸟常栖于孤立岛屿或地底荒野等避世原初之境。它们经常与恐龙等巨兽争抢领地。

Azers.name: 火矮人
Azers.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.n8Wl7PjhL3OpTTgv caption=false classes="right two lift-50 corner-frame"]

Fiery Smiths of Living Metal

Habitat: Mountain, Planar (Elemental Plane of Fire); Treasure: Armaments, Individual

Azers are living bronze folk who work the primal elements of creation to craft weapons and magical wonders among the multiverse’s mightiest infernos.

Azer Pyromancer.name: 火矮人烈炎术师
Azer Pyromancer.text: 火矮人烈炎术士咒唤火之元素位面的滔天怒焰，卫戍自身，点燃魔法铸炉。

Azer Sentinel.name: 火矮人哨兵
Azer Sentinel.text: 火矮人哨兵是卫戍着社群的铁匠，它们引导火炎之力，令其手中的武器身缠烈火。

Balor.name: 炎魔
Balor.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.hy9x34x6CFwcB23B caption=false cite=false classes="balor-cut corner-frame"]

无尽狂怒的恶魔

栖息地： 异界（无底深渊）；宝藏：武备

炎魔是恶魔滔天狂怒与仇恨的化身。这些高耸的带翼灾厄满腔怒火，将怒意以热浪与一对恶毒武器的形式喷发：一把是噼啪作响的闪电剑，另一把则是火舌飞舞的长鞭。炎魔的狂怒将会一直持续到其终结，并在那时爆炸——对那些杀死它的人进行最后一次报复。恶魔领主与邪恶神祇们利用炎魔的狂怒，并让其作为军队的指挥官或秘藏的守护者。

Bandits.name: 匪徒
Bandits.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.KwYpLhsvsc1NDTSn caption=false classes="top-frame"]

法外狂徒，恶名远扬

栖息地： 任意； 宝藏： 个体

知道吗？我生来就是世界的统治者。只需要循序渐进……

—贾拉索

匪徒们蛮取豪夺。帮派成员、亡命之徒、非法佣兵等各类罪犯都可算作匪徒。然而，并不是所有匪徒都是出于贪婪而犯罪。有些匪徒是因为不公的法律、深陷绝望、甚至是受人胁迫才不得已踏入罪恶之道。

掷一次匪徒动机表，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定是什么驱使匪徒们不断犯下罪行。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmBanditMotivati rollable classes="caption-top"]

Bandit.name: 匪徒
Bandit.text: 匪徒是缺乏经验的新手菜鸟，通常听命于匪帮中更高级的成员。

Bandit Captain.name: 匪帮队长
Bandit Captain.text: 匪帮队长指挥着恶徒们结成的帮派，它们亦可能充当更高级的罪犯手下的警卫与打手。

Bandit Deceiver.name: 匪帮欺诈师
Bandit Deceiver.text: 匪徒欺诈师使用魔法来掩盖团队的活动痕迹，或是搞出夸张的闪光，转移它人注意。

Bandit Crime Lord.name: 匪帮祸首
Bandit Crime Lord.text: 匪徒祸首操纵着阴影中的组织，然而在关键时刻，无论是其组织还是阴谋，都不能凌驾于祸首本人的性命安危之上。

Banshee.name: 报丧妖
Banshee.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.QfrJL3K1ZB1r9CKu caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Wailing Harbinger of Death

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Relics

Heralds of doom and plagues on the living, banshees are spirits obsessed by unresolved bitterness or sorrow. These storied phantoms slay any who glimpse them or hear their baleful wails. Although any tormented soul can arise as a banshee, some elven communities particularly fear them and believe that those who hoard or destroy beauty—natural or otherwise—risk returning as a banshee.

All manner of torments might give rise to a banshee. Roll on or a choose a result from the Banshee Sorrows table to inspire what tragedy brought a banshee into being.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmBansheeSorrows rollable classes="caption-top"]

Barbed Devil.name: 猬魔
Barbed Devil.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.1wUnkAI5fv9ack9o caption=false classes="top-frame"]

贪婪与痴迷之魔鬼

栖息地： 异界（九层地狱）；宝藏：任意

身为地狱中的收藏家，猬魔狂热地守护着自己的宝库，并在诸位面中四处搜刮宝藏以充实宝库。在九狱的阶级体系中，猬魔也被称为哈玛魔Hamatulas。这些魔鬼将喜欢在自己长有倒刺的外皮上披挂不同的宝藏，其中一些是它们拥有的最珍贵的宝物，另一些则是它们从试图盗窃宝库并惨遭失败的生物那里得到的战利品。猬魔在受到威胁时会使用自己带刺的手臂进行反击，并能投射地狱烈焰用于攻击。

猬魔通常会给冰魔将军、深狱炼魔军阀、大魔鬼、或是类似的强大反派充当守卫和会计；作为回报，它们自己的财产也能得到妥善的保护。许多猬魔还会建立一个由小魔鬼组成的情报网，派遣小魔鬼去搜寻不同位面的宝物并寻找可为自己所用的利欲熏心的凡人。

猬魔很少会收集类似宝石或钱币的庸俗凡物。正相反，它们为自己收集着某种特定的东西而感到自豪——典型例子是来自稀有血脉的物品或是权力的象征物。猬魔拒绝通过偷窃得到自己所觊觎的东西，而是会利用交易来同时取得宝物和凡人的灵魂。

Barlgura.name: 恶猿魔
Barlgura.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.LoMy9zzSUGYhK6WQ caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Demon of Instinct and Primal Violence

Habitat: Planar (Abyss); Treasure: Any

Barlguras are demons that embody brutality and killer instincts. They ruthlessly hunt creatures that enter their territories, whether such places are Abyssal wildernesses or locations where these demons have been conjured by wicked magic-users. Barlguras litter their territories with fiendish icons and terrifying evidence of their kills.

Barlguras cooperate with other demons, particularly other barlguras, so long as they have ample prey. Should a region be depleted of creatures to slaughter, these demons turn on one another in frays that can devastate vast expanses.

Barlguras vary in appearance, but all have powerful frames and hands capable of climbing swiftly and delivering crushing blows. If brute force isn’t enough to overwhelm their foes, barlguras can use demonic magic to conjure terrifying illusions and grasping vines. Most barlguras resemble nightmarish apes, and some bear exaggerated versions of features of predators common to the lands the barlguras inhabit. Many embed trophies from past hunts in their demonic bodies.

Basilisk.name: 石化蜥蜴
Basilisk.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.XtKanqqzWfGQ1nnK caption=false classes="float-right size-two lift-50 top-frame"]

拥有石化凝视的爬行类护卫魔

栖息地: 山脉, 幽暗地域; 宝藏: 任意

石化蜥蜴是行动迟缓的掠食者, 长有八只带爪的腿, 水晶般的脊刺和强有力的下颚。它们不使用追逐的方式捕猎, 而是利用其超自然的凝视将生物变为石头, 然后悠闲地享用这些受害者。虽然石化蜥蜴最舒适的环境是地下巢穴, 但许多会被不择手段的人捕获并饲养, 用以看守他们的财宝。

规则4: 没人会雕刻恐慌武者的雕像。如果你看到一个, 闭上你的眼睛, 竖起你的耳朵。

—神秘者X的《地城求生规则》

石化生物的残骸散落在石化蜥蜴狩猎的区域。这些可能是普通生物, 也可能是与石化蜥蜴有过致命遭遇的更不寻常的存在。投掷或从石化蜥蜴受害者表中选择一个结果, 以激发可能出现在石化蜥蜴猎场中的雕像灵感。这些雕像有50%的几率缺失肢体或碎裂成块。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmPetrifiedBasil rollable classes="caption-top"]

Bearded Devil.name: 须魔
Bearded Devil.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.StEYwQye8HQ9YxQk caption=false classes="right three lift-50"]

Devil of Force and Intimidation

Habitat: Planar (Nine Hells); Treasure: Armaments

Bearded devils, also known as barbazus, fill the legions of the Nine Hells. These cruel soldiers follow the orders of diabolical generals as they defend infernal realms, invade Material Plane worlds, and clash against demons in planes-spanning conflicts.

Left to their own devices, bearded devils encourage mortals to act callously and abuse their power, inflating their egos and inspiring petty tyrannies. Villains aligned with the Nine Hells call on bearded devils to serve as guardians, enforce their will, or fight in wicked armies.

Bearded devils’ eponymous beards consist of grotesque, tentacle-like growths. These squirming, barb-riddled beards carry poison capable of preventing magical healing. Bearded devils are also known for their distinctive glaives, through which they channel hellish energy. Those struck by these unnatural weapons suffer infernal wounds that grow worse until stanched or magically healed.

Behir.name: 青足龙蛇
Behir.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.rcHEyx8s3Si1vXwt caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Lightning-Spewing Glutton

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Any

Twelve-legged, reptilian predators, behirs endlessly hunt for their next meal. Their short legs propel them quickly across floors and walls. Any prey that behirs can’t chase down, they blast with breaths of powerful lightning.

Legends claim the first behirs were magically created by storm giants during an ancient, multiversal conflict between giants and dragons. The giants used their mastery of weather to alter the essence of blue dragons. The results were the first behirs, which served as hunters with a particular taste for dragon eggs.

Behirs live in sprawling cave systems and elaborate ruins where they can make the most of their exceptional mobility. They are mindful of areas where dragons dwell, as most dragons view behirs as dangerous abominations and attack them on sight. Nevertheless, behirs occasionally hunt for dragon lairs in the hope of finding and devouring unhatched dragon eggs.

You wouldn’t believe all the great stuff I’ve swallowed! Now just climb on in here, and you can keep whatever you find.

—Lludd, behir

Beholder.name: 眼魔
Beholder.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.BakAzucP8sPariyh caption=false classes="top-frame"]

恶名昭彰的多眼暴君

栖息地： 幽暗地域；宝藏： 奥秘

眼魔（亦称作巨眼暴君）是幽暗地域内最为声名狼藉的住民之一。在多元宇宙中鲜有生物能如这些狂暴恐怖的怪物般受人厌恶和畏惧。

一张巨口和一只位于中央的巨眼主宰着眼魔独特的球状躯体。十条末端长有小眼的触须环绕在其躯体顶部。这十一只眼睛中的任意一只都可以被眼魔用以施放不同的魔法能力。中央的主眼可以压制魔法，而其它的小眼则可以射出能够造成不同致命影响的射线——例如石化生物，解离生物，对生物造成即死效果，或是其他效应。

眼魔拥有完全异质的思维方式。大多数眼魔都拥有偏执、自恋和自大的倾向，而且其行为逻辑往往超越人类的理性范畴。它们中的一部分会选择离群索居，另一部分则会奴役弱小的生物为它们服务。更有甚者怀揣着巨大的野心，它们会利用自己的仆役建立网络来操纵各个集团，聚居地，以及幽暗地域中的一整个国家，有时甚至会触及地表世界。

　最痛恨眼魔的生物往往也是眼魔。每个眼魔都自诩为同族中肉体和思想层面的顶尖者。对它们来说，其他所有眼魔都是必须征服或摧毁的异类对手。眼魔之间的争斗可以持续数十年之久，而这也会导致大面积的地下疆域化为废土。

眼魔对冒险者来说特别构成威胁，因为二者都会被一些神秘废墟和魔法地点所吸引。许多眼魔会收集魔法物品并石化它们击败的英雄的遗体，将它们视作自己的勋章。

Beholder Lairs.name: 眼魔巢穴
Beholder Lairs.text:
Beholders lurk in cavern complexes they’ve carved using their eye rays deep in the Underdark or in lairs created for them by their servants.

The region containing a beholder’s lair is twisted by its presence, creating the following effects:

Scopophobia. Creatures within 1 mile of the lair feel as if they’re being watched. Any creature (excluding the beholder and its allies) that finishes a Short Rest while within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or gain no benefit from that rest.

Warping Terrain. Minor warps in reality occur near the lair; any creature (excluding the beholder) within 1 mile of the lair that makes a D20 Test and rolls a 1 has the Prone condition.

If the beholder dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Berserkers.name: 狂战士
Berserkers.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.cvtEgTpsTOv2oN1c caption=false classes="right three top-frame lift-1"]

Raging Invaders and Impassioned Warriors

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Armaments, Individual

Gripped by the adrenaline of battle, berserkers are reckless invaders, pit fighters, and other ferocious warriors.

Berserker Commander.name: 狂战将
Berserker Commander.text: 久经沙场的狂战将身披过往战斗中留下的伤痕，依靠其致命的狂热率领麾下各部。这些战将甚至能依靠原初魔法之力增强其武力。

Berserker.name: 狂战士
Berserker.text: 狂战士们为各自的荣耀而战。它们亦能因共同目标结成一股不容小觑的势力，或是结成咆哮着的部落战帮。

Black Dragons.name: 黑龙
Black Dragons.text:
朽坏与绝望之龙

栖息地： 沼泽；宝藏： 圣物

黑龙乐于观赏痛苦与毁灭。其它色彩龙族常竞逐权力与财富，然而黑龙却会试图摧毁所见的一切事物——并统治那些幸存下来的。

黑龙相貌可怖，生着一对弯曲双角以及枯槁面容，其形象恍若邪魔的颅骨。它们通常居住在死水腐沼、坍圮废墟、以及被魔法或环境所腐化之地。黑龙的强酸吐息在其领地上留下无数疤痕，蚀毁古老的雕像，令自然世界溃烂流脓。

黑龙囤积着早已褪色的希望之证和倾颓帝国的遗物。越是世人渴求之物，黑龙便越珍视——尤其是自己亲爪夺走的那些。

Black Dragon Wyrmling.name: 黑龙雏龙
Black Dragon Wyrmling.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.s5CPzWj0OOdoFMgZ classes="right three lift-1 top-frame" caption=false]

Black dragon wyrmlings lurk in bogs and polluted waterways, hunting for prey and weaker creatures to overpower. While older wyrmlings eventually seek their own territories, recently hatched ones might hunt one another, seeking dominance over their clutch and slaying rivals they can’t subjugate.

Young Black Dragon.name: 青年黑龙
Young Black Dragon.text: 大多数青年黑龙都占据了一处隐秘的巢穴——通常是需要穿过致命的废墟或危险的泽地才能进入的阴暗之所。青年黑龙乐于驱使可怖手下，用它们胁迫小型社群；黑龙亦能控制一群狗头人或穴蜥人为其服务。一些青年黑龙会与强大的亡灵合作，例如死亡骑士和吸血鬼；有的黑龙甚至会与异怪合作——例如底栖魔鱼或寇涛。

Adult Black Dragon.name: 成年黑龙
Adult Black Dragon.text:
成年后的黑龙堪称其所宣占的领土上最恐怖的存在之一。在成年黑龙的影响下，枯朽破败的沼泽与怪物频出的废墟变得愈发阴郁，甚至开始扩张。病态的邪教徒和末日论者聚集在黑龙麾下，为巨龙带来恐怖的亡灵仆从，助其将毁灭泼洒向其周边守护着美好与和平的堡垒。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.v1xO9PUmlC2aznYD classes="top-frame"]

Ancient Black Dragon.name: 远古黑龙
Ancient Black Dragon.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.FCxXySa15GPZaZAe classes="top-frame"]

远古黑龙编织着颠覆整片国度的阴谋。它们寻求腐化土地的魔法，制造亡灵，誓缚邪魔，并重现魔法灾难。远古黑龙意欲创造大片的死亡之域，唯有黑龙能够屹立其中。

Black Dragon Lairs.name: 黑龙巢穴
Black Dragon Lairs.text:
Black dragons lurk in dismal ruins, polluted bogs, or other sites gripped by decay.

The region containing an adult or ancient black dragon’s lair is warped by its presence, creating the following effects:

Acrid Haze. Odorous and stifling fog covers the area within 1 mile of the lair, rendering that area Lightly Obscured. Travel for creatures other than the dragon and its allies takes twice the usual time in that area.

Foul Water. Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally fouled. A creature that drinks such water must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the Poisoned condition for 1 hour.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Black Pudding.name: 黑布丁
Black Pudding.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.I1UtEXMc7C2xWHsx caption=false classes="right three lift-1 right-corner-frame"]

Divisible, Corrosive Blob

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: None

Black puddings are shapeless masses of predatory cells. Once a pudding detects organic matter, it oozes toward its prey, dissolving living matter and various objects. If a black pudding is split by lightning or slashing attacks, it divides into two smaller, independent puddings.

Various supernatural conditions might bring black puddings into being. Roll on or choose a result from the Black Pudding Sources table to inspire a pudding’s origins.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmBlackPuddingSo rollable classes="caption-top"]

Blights.name: 枯萎怪
Blights.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.gbL1Ow16gt6o88JF classes="top-frame"]

于邪恶中萌芽的植物

栖息地： 森林；宝藏：无

虽然它看起来死了，但其实它活着。很久很久以前，正是在这个地点，有人将一个吸血鬼钉死在大地上。吸血鬼那邪恶的原初威能在这里回荡，于是，甘提亚斯树诞生了。

—流放者贝拉克，暮光林地的德鲁伊

枯萎怪是从根深蒂固的邪恶中涌现的恶意植物。它们扭曲的形态有着令人恐惧的特征，仿佛人类的四肢和凶残的巨口。枯萎怪潜伏在常见的植被中伺机而动，然后痛击非同类的生物。虽然枯萎怪可以独立行动，但它们通常受催生它们的邪恶力量或者被那些有掌控自然能力的邪恶生物所驱使。创造枯萎怪的魔法往往也会波及其他植物，导致荆棘、藤蔓和扭曲的树木淹没道路和田野，堵塞水井和溪流，迫使动物离开它们原本的栖息地。这或许意味着枯萎怪是即将到来的腐化狂潮的第一个征兆。

Twig Blight.name: 枯枝怪
Twig Blight.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.r90nnqC4oKMMWJuD caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Resembling bundles of sticks or dead brush, twig blights easily blend in among deadwood, flotsam, and the wood piles common in many rural settings. Groups of them are often found near river crossings, forgotten wells, or natural campsites, where they ambush those who let down their guard.

Needle Blight.name: 枯针怪
Needle Blight.text: 枯针怪长出了大致的两足形态，主体畸形且可怕，无论是不自然地静止不动，还是用笨拙的步态前行，这些枯针怪都不会被看成是普通植物或着穿梭林地的旅者。一旦它们发现敌人，枯针怪就会用它们长满棘刺的爪子或迅速生长并投掷出锯齿状的针状发射物进行攻击。

Vine Blight.name: 枯藤怪
Vine Blight.text:
枯藤怪长得就像一个被其生长地区的藤蔓，比如充满毛刺的常春藤或者开花的葛蔓，包裹着的人类。它们可以使周围地面上的植物暴起，并缠住附近的敌人。

与大多数其他枯萎怪不同，枯藤怪会说话。不过他们很少这样做，通常他们的话语只是为了传达主人的信息，或者用刺耳的声音重复受害者的话。

Tree Blight.name: 枯树怪
Tree Blight.text: 枯树怪长得就像一颗古老的、有着扭曲枝干和裂开空洞的朽木。它们以活物为食，具有强烈的嗜血欲望。它们过去进食的残留往往混杂在它们的树枝和根部之中。枯树怪会与其他枯萎怪合作，但当它们遇到其他树状生物，比如启蒙树木和树人时，它们也会发动攻击。

Gulthias Blight.name: 甘提亚斯枯殖巨树
Gulthias Blight.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.LVbjo1A3xAYjxQg7 caption=false classes="right two lift-1 top-frame"]

Ancient plants twisted by evil, Gulthias blights feed on blood and despoil the surrounding land, often giving rise to subservient blights. These cursed plants take their name from the story of their creation; the first of their kind was a tree that grew from the stake piercing the heart of the vampire Gulthias. These blights consider all creatures either servants or fertilizer for the blights’ corruption.

Blink Dog.name: 闪现犬
Blink Dog.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.mdbTdyqEIiX1zznV caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Elusive Feywild Canine

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Feywild); Treasure: None

Blink dogs glimmer with a magic that allows them to teleport, “blinking” from one spot to another. These dogs use this power to chase prey, baffle foes, and express joy. They’re frequently found among Feywild folk, such as centaurs and pixies—often as members of rollicking hunts between worlds.

Blob of Annihilation.name: 吞世黏浆
Blob of Annihilation.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.hFWFOpYafiDeBkQA caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-corner-frame"]

All-Consuming Cosmic Entropy Unleashed

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Any

The blob of annihilation is a coagulation of cosmic entropy conjoined to the remains of dead gods. This malicious entity drifts through Wildspace and multiversal expanses inimical to life—vast regions where the chance of encountering it is low.

The blob poses the greatest threat when disasters or nihilistic magic-users summon it to inhabited realms. Once unleashed, the blob of annihilation rolls across the land in vast, cosmic gyres, with fragments of the blob splitting off to engulf targets. The blob consumes anything it encounters, sweeping forests, villages, and fortresses into its mass. Within the blob is an expanse without air or gravity where entropic forces destroy whatever they engulf. Nothing can survive within for long.

Honey, I’ve seen horrors that would make you shit your drawers and reach for the nearest drink. And then there’s the blob of annihilation. If you see it, run. And if you can’t get away from it, just hope you dissolve fast.

—Vi, Artificer of Eberron

Only magic items and the corpses of gods and titans can endure inside the blob. Because of that fact, treasure hunters and theologians sometimes give themselves the deadly task of trying to retrieve something from within the blob. This quest usually ends in annihilation, but occasionally it results in the find of a lifetime.

When the blob appears, roll on or choose a result from the Blob of Annihilation Contents table to inspire what extraordinary thing remains within its goop.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmBlobOfAnnihila rollable classes="caption-top"]

Blue Dragons.name: 蓝龙
Blue Dragons.text:
风雷与暴政之龙

栖息地： 海岸，荒漠；宝藏：圣物

骄矜孤傲的蓝龙乃色彩龙族的一支。它们会像其它龙族渴望搜刮宝藏那般渴求收服并掌控追随者。蓝龙会试图将其领土淬炼为令世间诸国慑服惊诧的恐怖帝国。

蓝龙的外形十分“锋利”，如直挺而出的长角、以及流转着蓝宝石到暴风云霭的各色鳞片。蓝龙栖息于沙漠与恶地，尤其是那些能够傲视周边数里之外的平地尖峰之顶。其巢穴往往临近象征着权力的场所，例如被遗弃的巨人要塞、失落帝国所遗留下的巨神兵Colossi、甚至是其追随者为其修建的纪念丰碑。

蓝龙的宝山中堆砌着帝王冠冕与艺术珍品。蓝龙对寻常和有瑕的宝藏不感兴趣，它们更钟爱独一无二的宝石、已覆灭的皇族遗留下的冠冕、还有能传播其影响力的魔法物品。

Blue Dragon Wyrmling.name: 蓝龙雏龙
Blue Dragon Wyrmling.text:
蓝龙雏龙通常会为更强大的生物服务，在此过程中研习驭人之术，并在弱小生物的族群中散播威名。许多蓝龙雏龙最开始都忠不可言，但随着其羽翼渐丰，它们便会背叛旧主。蓝龙雏龙会以微薄宝藏与发迹之后升官发财的空头支票诱惑一小群生物为自己服务。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.KZA8RgvixZYhiifG caption=false classes="top-frame"]

Young Blue Dragon.name: 青年蓝龙
Young Blue Dragon.text: 青年蓝龙会试图成为恐怖的统治者。许多青年蓝龙都将孤立的社群宣占为自己的领土，亦有可能占据能助其获得力量的远古遗迹，试图从中寻找魔法。这些蓝龙有可能会暂时和其它龙或强力反派合作，以攫取追随者和影响力。

Adult Blue Dragon.name: 成年蓝龙
Adult Blue Dragon.text:
成年蓝龙统治着小规模的帝国，例如其麾下众多附庸的领土、阴影之中的犯罪网络、甚至是邪教团所控制的飞地。蓝龙针对其对手的怀疑与警惕永不停息，它们会精心编织阴谋来毁灭敌人，考验下属们的忠诚，并确保其统治可以绵延数个世纪。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Rr3I3ZCbZqF2vQfd classes="top-frame"]

Ancient Blue Dragon.name: 远古蓝龙
Ancient Blue Dragon.text:
远古蓝龙的眼界早已超越了统治那些朝生暮死的仆从——它们认为，自己应当君临整个世界，号令诸龙、乃至这世上最为强大的那些住民。而要是远古蓝龙觉得统治世界过于老套，它们甚至可能会将魔爪伸向异界的国度、建立横跨多元宇宙的庞大帝国、甚至是现实中的某种概念力量——生命，风暴，甚至是时间本身。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.zjGefufLFY1uvFjB classes="top-frame"]

Blue Dragon Lairs.name: 蓝龙巢穴
Blue Dragon Lairs.text:
Blue dragons dwell in arid lands. Their lairs might be death traps meant to entomb invaders or ostentatious fortresses where they plot domination.

The region containing an adult or ancient blue dragon’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Sinkholes. Sinkholes form more frequently in the area within 1 mile of the lair. Whenever a creature in that area other than the dragon and its allies finishes a Long Rest, roll 1d20. On a 1, a sinkhole opens beneath the creature, and the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or fall 2d4 × 10 feet into the sinkhole.

Spiteful Storms. Dust devils and thunderstorms rage within 1 mile of the lair. The area is Lightly Obscured.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Bone Devil.name: 骨魔
Bone Devil.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.QrEtZmUlaPMl9rB8 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Devil of Dread and Obedience

Habitat: Planar (Nine Hells); Treasure: Implements

Bone devils are gaunt, nightmarish Fiends with pallid skin stretched tight over frames that combine human and insectile features. Also known as osyluths, these Fiends command weaker devils and other beings aligned with infernal legions. Bone devils ensure that the commands of hellish sovereigns are exacted efficiently and that non-devils fulfill their commitments to the Nine Hells. They slay those who renege on infernal deals, sending treacherous mortal souls to face unspeakable punishments.

When not serving their diabolical masters, bone devils tempt self-obsessed mortals with promises of other creatures’ adulation and obedience. These devils prop up petty tyrants, helping them grow increasingly calloused and amoral.

Bone devils are just one of a thousand reasons never to make a deal with a devil, but they’re a significant one. Break said deal, and it’ll likely be one of these nightmares that drags you down to the Nine Hells.

—Sylvira Savikas, Candlekeep sage

Bone devils travel across the multiverse to fulfill diabolical orders. If left with no other choices, they might conscript mortals to aid them in their vicious goals. Roll on or choose a result from the Bone Devil Objectives table to inspire a bone devil’s goals.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmBoneDevilObjec rollable classes="caption-top"]

Bone Naga.name: 骸骨纳迦
Bone Naga.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.SdaMo2JdKR6KRUxN caption=false classes="top-frame hike-1"]

不死不灭的惑念蛇灵

栖息地： 幽暗地域；宝藏： 圣物

纳迦虽是一种不朽的生物，但并非无敌，足够强大的魔法能够终结它们的生命。骸骨纳迦则是自那些被魔法杀害，或自那些被杀死但还未完成更生的纳迦遗骸之中唤起的骨架怪物。它们经由邪教徒，原体蛇人和病态的阴魂纳迦所举行的仪式而被赋予了不洁的生命。这些亡灵纳迦不仅拥有与其生前类似的魔法能力，更具一种能摄人心魂的妖异凝视。

骸骨纳迦通常听命于将它们复活的始作俑者，作为不知疲倦的守卫为其服务，并向它们分享生前所积累的秘闻。亡灵之躯扰乱了骸骨纳迦生前享有的完美记忆力，使它们残缺不全，或让其中细节如破碎的拼图般错乱交织。

在极少数情况下，骸骨纳迦会延续它们生前的未竟之志，而非侍奉其他生物。大多数具有自由意志的骸骨纳迦都是自阴魂纳迦Spirit Naga的遗骸中唤起的邪恶存在，但在特殊情况下，自守秘纳迦Guardian Nagas 中创造而来的骸骨娜迦尽管其思维错乱，却能依旧秉持善良之心。

Brass Dragons.name: 黄铜龙
Brass Dragons.text:
逸闻与和睦之龙

栖息地： 荒漠；宝藏： 奥秘

黄铜龙性格外向，喜好分享学识与故事。尽管这一支金属龙族更偏好干旱地带，但它们亦愿跋涉千里，拜访好友，传授学识，收集奇闻轶事。黄铜龙性格温和，但并非怯战之辈，用魔法睡眠把敌人们放倒，再用烈火将其烧却。

黄铜龙喜好暖热的气候，尤喜稀树草原，以及砂石或沙土覆盖的荒漠。它们喜欢化作人形，伪装成行商、学者、讲述故事者，以及其他倾听他人故事之人。

黄铜龙对待宝藏不拘一格。虽然其大多数藏品看起来都不过是零碎杂玩，但这些玩意背后都有着自己的故事——也许是对昔日回忆的纪念，或是神话传说的一部分。一顶被遗忘的王朝的末代统治者的王冠，与一顶老友的帽子，在黄铜龙的宝库中并无任何地位差别。

Brass Dragon Wyrmling.name: 黄铜龙雏龙
Brass Dragon Wyrmling.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.jGLeTcYi5qCk9y57 caption=false classes="right three lift-1"]

Brass dragon wyrmlings are relentlessly curious. These dragons eagerly engage approachable creatures and are quick to explore any place that has an interesting story. Once they hear tales of adventure, many are keen to start their own quests.

Young Brass Dragon.name: 青年黄铜龙
Young Brass Dragon.text: 青年黄铜龙热爱游历四方，通常会在某个地区漫游数年，之后再绕回其巢穴。一些青年黄铜龙会和其它金属龙密切合作，在盟友之间传递信息。

Adult Brass Dragon.name: 成年黄铜龙
Adult Brass Dragon.text:
成年黄铜龙通晓诸多秘密，同时有着庞大的关系网络。这些巨龙会分享它们在世界各地学来的观点，并竭力反击散播谎言的骗子与蛊惑世人的奸徒。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.781iDxBc1nN2OZct classes="top-frame"]

Ancient Brass Dragon.name: 远古黄铜龙
Ancient Brass Dragon.text:
远古黄铜龙的关系网络遍及整个世界。它们对抗压迫与谎言，助众生以史为鉴。无论是亲自传信，还是通过关系网络转达，远古黄铜龙都会告知盟友它们可以共同面对的各种挑战。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.2Y7RaLikLn7SgKiw classes="top-frame"]

Brass Dragon Lairs.name: 黄铜龙巢穴
Brass Dragon Lairs.text:
Brass dragons usually dwell in secret caves and canyons near well-traveled routes.

The area containing an adult or ancient brass dragon’s lair is altered by its presence, creating the following effects:

Mirages. While in its lair, the dragon can cast Major Image, requiring no Material components and using the same spellcasting ability as its Spellcasting action. When casting the spell this way, the spell’s range is 1 mile, and the dragon doesn’t need to see the spot where the illusion appears.

Refreshing Water. Water within 1 mile of the lair is magically refreshing. A creature that drinks such water gains 2d4 Temporary Hit Points, and the dragon is immediately aware of the creature’s presence.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Bronze Dragons.name: 青铜龙
Bronze Dragons.text:
雷霆与守御之龙

栖息地： 海岸；宝藏： 器具

青铜龙所栖之地绽放着奇迹。这一支金属龙族想象力丰富，同时亦专心致志，向着伟大的理想努力前进，并襄助他人尽其所能。青铜龙看重创新，无论其是久远文明的古老遗产还是当今时代的最新发现。在与短寿种交流时，青铜龙们倾向于谈话与栽培来帮助对方，但当恶徒意欲阻碍其他人实现自己的潜能之时，青铜龙们亦不会回避战斗。

青铜龙享受着瀚海之力与无限可能。它们通常在自然形成的美景或是希望守护的社群中建立巢穴。青铜龙在这些巢穴之中囤积那些它们认为未来可期的事物。青铜龙还会打捞失落于海面之下的宝物，回收这些财宝与沉船。

Bronze Dragon Wyrmling.name: 青铜龙雏龙
Bronze Dragon Wyrmling.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.iG6PGZ4AlfBVzLCX caption=false classes="right three lift-1"]

Bronze dragon wyrmlings believe they can solve any problems, and they seek to prove it. They often fixate on local challenges, such as drought or rampant banditry. While their zeal can be charming, these wyrmlings can get in over their heads and might then need help correcting mistakes.

Young Bronze Dragon.name: 青年青铜龙
Young Bronze Dragon.text: 青年青铜龙很可能是某些领域的专家：例如赶走海盗、或是保护社群免受风暴侵扰。青年青铜龙交友广泛，其可靠的朋友圈涉及各种专业领域。

Adult Bronze Dragon.name: 成年青铜龙
Adult Bronze Dragon.text: @Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.LhVx3vNOyYpm0fAv classes="top-frame"]

Ancient Bronze Dragon.name: 远古青铜龙
Ancient Bronze Dragon.text:
远古青铜龙闪耀的鳞片上奇妙地生着“铜绿”。这些巨龙守护的庇护涵盖着从地区到国家、甚至整个星球的浩瀚领域。远古青铜龙们寻找方法对抗多元宇宙中肆虐着的横跨位面的浩劫大灾，亦会挺身而出，对抗色彩龙族的邪恶伟力。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.nl4CxG21CMZXHJWi classes="top-frame"]

Bronze Dragon Lairs.name: 青铜龙巢穴
Bronze Dragon Lairs.text:
Bronze dragons usually make their homes near or under the sea.

The region containing an adult or ancient bronze dragon’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Buoying Currents. Creatures within 1 mile of the lair that lack a Swim Speed ignore the extra cost of movement while swimming.

Sun and Storms. While in its lair, the dragon can cast Control Weather, requiring no Material components and using the same spellcasting ability as its Spellcasting action. When casting the spell this way, the dragon can control the weather within 1 mile of its lair, regardless if the dragon is inside or outside.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Bugbears.name: 熊地精
Bugbears.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.EJk5FMiDOaByFxxx caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Lurking Goblinoid Brutes

Habitat: Forest, Grassland, Planar (Feywild), Underdark; Treasure: Armaments, Individual

Bugbears embody fear of the wilds and the menace of natural places. They’re notoriously stealthy, and foes that venture into their territories often vanish without a trace.

Bugbear Stalker.name: 熊地精追猎者

Bugbear Warrior.name: 熊地精武者
Bugbear Warrior.text: 熊地精武者为那些向他们提供财宝、食物或狩猎具有挑战性猎物机会的人服务。

Bulettes.name: 鲨蜥
Bulettes.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.cvK1louEjKMLI1Vz caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Ravenous, Subsurface Land Sharks

Habitat: Grassland, Hill, Mountain; Treasure: None

Also called “land sharks,” bulettes are single-minded predators that burrow under, leap over, and burst through obstacles in pursuit of their quarry. They burrow rapidly just belowground. On sensing movement, they erupt from below, attempting to catch prey in their oversize maws.

Bulette.name: 鲨蜥
Bulette.text: 鲨蜥的活动范围非常广。它们常常威胁到牧群，甚至能消灭整个农社群。

Bulette Pup.name: 鲨蜥仔
Bulette Pup.text: 鲨蜥的幼崽被称作“仔仔”，它们成群结队的出游，利用数量击倒更大的敌人。它们的出现往往预示着成年鲨蜥的到来。

Bullywugs.name: 啵灵蛙
Bullywugs.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ge05JmB5wPdmaAQ3 caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Amphibious Appreciators of Marsh and Muck

Habitat: Swamp; Treasure: Implements, Individual

Fey embodiments of swamplands, bullywugs protect the murky wilds and consider themselves cosmically favored for that role. These human-size, toad- or frog-like creatures have close relationships with the creatures of the swamp.

Bullywug Bog Sage.name: 啵灵蛙沼地大贤
Bullywug Bog Sage.text: 啵灵蛙沼地大贤能引导沼泽之魔法，令敌人染病，还能与植物交谈。

Bullywug Warrior.name: 啵灵蛙武者
Bullywug Warrior.text: 啵灵蛙武者精于在沼泽中穿行，以及伏击入侵者。它们经常和受训练过的巨蛙一起行动。

Cambion.name: 坎比翁
Cambion.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.gWQznavqUVets84S caption=false classes="right three lift-50"]

Mortal Infused with Fiendish Might

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Relics

Cambions are former mortals corrupted by fiendish power or possessed by insidious forces. While tieflings are free-willed individuals with a hint of fiendish ancestry, cambions are inherently tied to or remade by the wicked magic of the Lower Planes.

Many cambions serve the malevolent forces that are the source of their powers. Others seek to claim the might of whatever created them or to seize otherworldly powers of their own. Among the most notorious of such cambions is Iuz, a villain who became an evil demigod and whose villainous nation threatens the Free City of Greyhawk on Oerth.

It seems that I must do everything myself, since I have only fools for servants. Clearly disappointment must ever be the price of divinity.

—Iuz the Evil, cambion demigod

Cambions come into being in disparate ways. Roll on or choose a result from the Cambion Origins table to determine the source of a cambion’s fiendish might.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmCambionOrigins rollable classes="caption-top"]

Carrion Crawler.name: 食腐虫
Carrion Crawler.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.uGgXh4VIKrmXqRq4 caption=false classes="top-frame hike-1"]

扫荡墓穴的食尸怪物

栖息地： 幽暗地域、城市；宝藏： 无

食腐虫是贪婪的食尸者，它们会聚集在尸横遍野的腐烂之地。食腐虫们在这种阴森之地用死者大快朵颐，对餐食的来源和新鲜度没有丝毫顾虑。

食腐虫的身体分节，像是巨大的切根虫幼虫。八条细长的触手从它们分瓣的巨口中伸出。被这些触手缠上的生物会有麻痹和被吞掉的风险。

食腐虫在下水道、战场、公墓和臭气熏天的荒野之间扫荡尸体，还会倒吊在天花板上伏击体型更小的猎物同时避开其他互相竞争的猎手。它们会被光线和血腥味吸引，认为这是食物的信号。

这些食腐动物会避免摄入无机物。墓穴中只会剩下空空如也的陪葬铠甲，里面的尸体则被吮吸干净。过分干净的地下墓穴往往是食腐虫肆虐的标志。

Centaurs.name: 人马
Centaurs.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.oEIHKi0dbBaGDtxM caption=false classes="right three lift-1 top-frame"]

Defenders of the Feywild

Habitat: Forest, Grassland, Planar (Feywild);
Treasure: Armaments, Individual

Centaurs are defenders of forests, plains, and sites of primeval power. With upper bodies like humans’ and the lower bodies of horses, centaurs charge into battle against those who would harm their allies.

Centaur Warden.name: 人马守望者
Centaur Warden.text: 人马守望者通常率领着一队人马骠骑，他们会在妖精和闯入妖精领地的外来者之间充当调解人。

Centaur Trooper.name: 人马骠骑
Centaur Trooper.text: 人马骠骑是骑士一般的守卫者。他们中的许多并不信任妖精以外的生物。

Chain Devil.name: 链魔
Chain Devil.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.JK6pdZfy3B81nllT caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-cradle-frame"]

Devil of Pain and Control

Habitat: Planar (Nine Hells); Treasure: Implements

Also known as kytons, chain devils consider themselves morbid artisans who use deception, menace, and vicious metal to coerce prisoners into betraying themselves. Many serve powerful devils, wrenching secrets from imprisoned souls using deadly, animate chains. Left to their own devices, chain devils encourage ruthless individuals to pursue forbidden magic, leading their pupils down paths to the Nine Hells.

Along with psychological threats and physical harm, a chain devil uses its unnerving gaze to make its victims perceive their worst fear rather than the monster. Roll on or choose a result from the Chain Devil Masks table to inspire a chain devil’s fearful appearance.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmChainDevilMask rollable classes="caption-top"]

Chasme.name: 喀嘶魔
Chasme.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.soH0Sh5K0oFtC77K caption=false classes="right two lift-1 top-frame"]

Demon of Betrayal and Sycophancy

Habitat: Planar (Abyss); Treasure: Relics

Flying forth from the Abyss, chasmes resemble horse-size flies. They incapacitate foes by producing a mind-numbing droning, then use their proboscises to drain victims of life. In the Abyss, most chasmes obsequiously serve more powerful demons and search for captives to press into demonic hordes.

Chimera.name: 奇美拉
Chimera.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.6MSLQ95uLUwDmdmu caption=false classes="top-frame"]

多首掠夺者

栖息地： 草原，丘陵，山地； 宝藏： 任意

暴虐无常的奇美拉糅合了狮子、山羊和红龙最致命的特征。奇美拉有着可怖的利爪、强力的犄角和炽热的吐息，三个头颅本能的冲撞让其化作肆虐的风暴，唯有在进食和将竞争者驱逐出那崎岖领土的巢穴时才能达成共识。奇美拉发现猎物时通常会先以火焰吐息空中扫射，然后用其尖牙、利爪和犄角在陆地攻击。

龙的本能让奇美拉变得贪婪，它们会在巢穴中囤积宝物，但是对收集品毫无辨别力。除了最近猎取的战利品和骨头外，奇美拉还会收集亮闪闪的东西。若大胆者想要令其分心或是暂时安抚奇美拉，可以试着献上财宝和食物。

Chuul.name: 甲伏怪
Chuul.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Zi2FsVqLBKS6P4fM caption=false classes="hike-3 top-frame"]

原初力量的甲壳仆从

栖息地： 海岸，沼泽，幽暗地域； 宝藏： 圣物

甲伏怪起源于某个失落纪元，那时，底栖魔鱼和更加诡异的存在仍统治着水下的异星帝国。底栖魔鱼将无数的深海掠食者改造为仆役，令其可以远渡重洋以收集更多可利用的魔法和生物。甲伏怪即是这些异种仆役中存续至今的典型。

许多甲伏怪都侍奉着底栖魔鱼领主，它们在无光之海和原始沼泽中执行着主人的怪异理想。其他的甲伏怪则会跟随新的异怪主人，例如眼魔、触须怪或夺心魔。还有些甲伏怪会遵从自己的渴望，无止境地收集远古的魔法秘宝或以扭曲的形式继续执行着古老的使命。不论其动机如何，甲伏怪都会以巨钳擒住其他生物，然后用其触须麻痹生物，令其丧失行动能力。

甲伏怪不会衰老且可以在隐匿处休眠数千年，直到某个威胁，古老的使命，或异常的状态将其唤醒。

Clay Golem.name: 黏土魔像
Clay Golem.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ENVwdTIEEf2itAzS caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Guardian of Home and Heart

Habitat: Urban; Treasure: Relics

Clay golems are magical defenders made from earth and clay to protect places or communities. The materials used in creating clay golems originate from near the location the golems protect and often have special significance to their creators, such as clay from a holy site or bricks from a magical ruin. While some clay golems are masterfully sculpted to resemble living beings, others have only vaguely humanlike forms.

These golems obey their creators’ orders and protect what their makers value most. Some still follow these orders long after their creators’ deaths. Roll on or choose a result from the Clay Golem Orders table to inspire the commands a clay golem follows.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmClayGolemOrder rollable classes="caption-top"]

Cloaker.name: 斗篷怪
Cloaker.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Ql55vQgY3XjRCdcx caption=false classes="right three lift-50"]

Haunter in the Dark

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Implements

Cloakers are mysterious Underdark predators, named by adventurers for their resemblance to hanging cloaks when they cling to walls. What cloakers call themselves is unknown, if they refer to themselves at all. Though they’re undeniably intelligent, their behavior is often inscrutable.

Cloakers sometimes gather in Underdark enclaves, but they rarely build settlements or form social structures. Most operate as solitary predators, lurking in dismal subterranean reaches or abandoned dungeons—sometimes for months at a time—as they wait for prey to pass. They use their mottled hides to blend in with their surroundings. When unsuspecting prey nears, cloakers unfurl and attempt to latch on and then smother their victims in their powerful wings.

Cloakers delight in frightening foes. In addition to their methods of ambush, cloakers can create illusory duplicates of themselves and emit surreal moans that non-cloakers find terrifying in unexplainable, primal ways. Cloakers might antagonize explorers lost in the Underdark for days, terrorizing and scattering them before attacking. They rarely converse with other beings, except to whisper eerie riddles to those they’re about to consume.

Cloud Giant.name: 云巨人
Cloud Giant.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.UfSjIYh7XSNxLwHO caption=false classes="top-frame"]

至高巅峰之巨人

栖息地： 山地；宝藏： 奥秘

云巨人利用天空的力量观察并巧妙地影响世界。这些巨人形似人类，拥有蓝色或银色的头发，皮肤呈现出云朵般的暮色或者纯白色。他们的上颚长着弯曲的獠牙，獠牙延伸至下唇之外。在战斗中，云巨人挥舞着被风暴云环绕的武器，并投掷咆哮的雷云。

大多数云巨人居住在山脉之巅的堡垒或漂浮于云间的魔法宫殿中，许多云巨人认为自己拥有高山一般崇高的地位或使命。有些云巨人视自己为神明一般的存在，可以肆意操控并掠夺地面生物而不受惩罚；另一些则声称漫长的寿命和云端的居所赋予了他们独特的视角，他们会记录地面世界的所见所闻，却并不干涉世界。无论是哪种情况，云巨人通常拥有惊人的魔法宝物——这些宝物可能从世界各地夺取而来，也可能是巨人为自己打造（并适配其巨型体型）的珍宝。

Cockatrices.name: 蛇鸡
Cockatrices.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.AVwoE39RSRMC9c8Z caption=false classes="right three lift-50"]

Accursed Avians with the Power to Petrify

Habitat: Grassland; Treasure: None

Cockatrices combine the features of irate roosters and starving reptiles. They petrify those they bite, their slightest peck turning their prey to stone.

Cockatrice.name: 蛇鸡
Cockatrice.text: 蛇鸡总是试图占据引人注目的建筑作为栖息地，例如废墟或是僻静的农场。

Cockatrice Regent.name: 蛇鸡王
Cockatrice Regent.text: 蛇鸡王比起它体型较小的同类来说更加大胆，它们以不稳定的魔法能量限制远处的敌人。

Colossus.name: 巨神兵
Colossus.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.auDW8nOuP9WQpUZ7 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 corner-frame"]

Titanic Vessel of Divine Might

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Relics

Colossi are massive Constructs created by the devout to reflect the nature of a deity, which could be benevolent or wicked. Colossi thrum with incredible magic and work divine will on the land.

Droves of faithful artisans craft a colossus in a shape to honor their deity, then call on that god to infuse the statue with life. This arduous process might take decades and involve hundreds of workers. If the god favors the creation, the mighty crystal at the construct’s heart pulses with divine power, and the colossus rises to protect the faithful or enact the god’s will.

Most colossi were created in ages past and now lie dormant in secluded wilderness, awakening only when disturbed or called on to serve once more.

Commoner.name: 平民
Commoner.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.BwZznUdKBbq6lneT classes="top-frame"]

黎民百姓，芸芸众生

栖息地： 任意； 宝藏： 个体

平民是不去钻研魔法天赋、亦不接触非凡训练、更不会踏入冒险生活的普罗大众。有的平民行事慷慨、乐于助人；另一些则在分享事物之时十分谨慎。下列表格给出了平民们可能的职业和身份，供你在冒险中使用：

艺人 Artist

烘焙师 Baker

酒保 Bartender

铁匠 Blacksmith

屠夫 Butcher

囚徒 Captive

木匠 Carpenter

流浪者 Castaway

鞋匠 Cobbler

厨师 Cook

染工 Dyer

农民 Farmer

渔民 Fisher

制箭师 Fletcher

造假者 Flimflam artist

八卦士 Gossip

隐士 Hermit

无赖 Hooligan

猎人 Hunter

旅馆老板 Innkeeper

力工 Laborer

灯夫 Lamplighter

石匠 Mason

商人 Merchant

矿工 Miner

挖泥工 Mud lark

病人 Patient

朝圣者 Pilgrim

盗尸者 Resurrectionist

暴乱者 Rioter

抄写员 Scribe

侍从 Servant

牧羊人 Shepherd

学徒 Student

裁缝 Tailor

皮匠 Tanner

传信人 Town crier

织工 Weaver

青少年 Youngster

Copper Dragons.name: 赤铜龙
Copper Dragons.text:
共融与求索之龙

栖息地：丘陵； 宝藏： 奥秘

绝大多数赤铜龙们都总是极度友善且好奇，并认为这世上充满了无尽的奇事与可能性。这些合群的巨龙是耐心、好客与幽默的化身，并会试图改善点亮相遇者的生命——至少，也要为其旅途缀满笑语。在必须使用武力来保护自身或是盟友的时候，赤铜龙会用其缓速吐息与其强大的体能来制服对手。赤铜龙只会在极度危险或是情绪激动的时候才会使用致命性的强酸吐息。

赤铜龙通常居住在景色如画般优美的丘陵或裸岩地带——尤爱有着知名地标的那些。这些巨龙热爱收集礼物，那些没有背景意义的宝藏对赤铜龙来说基本毫无价值。精心赠送的礼物，以及其背后所蕴含着的情感与回忆，在赤铜龙眼中甚至要比大师的杰作或是蕴含魔法的圣物还要重要。

Copper Dragon Wyrmling.name: 赤铜龙雏龙
Copper Dragon Wyrmling.text:
赤铜龙雏龙闯荡世间，意欲广结良缘、遍寻奇观。有时这些小龙会陷入麻烦，而帮助它们的人就可能成为小龙的一生之友。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.nkdgLhGf2j1S9XBl caption=false]

Young Copper Dragon.name: 青年赤铜龙
Young Copper Dragon.text: 青年赤铜龙与一处社群或一群友人建立了羁绊，同时热衷于各种各样的艺术爱好。

Adult Copper Dragon.name: 成年赤铜龙
Adult Copper Dragon.text:
成年赤铜龙会依靠其影响力润泽世间。赤铜龙们有着广泛的朋友圈子，这些龙族也很乐于在友人之间牵线搭桥，并帮助人们找到能够安居乐业的家园。当灾难降临之时，赤铜龙会带着亲朋好友的助力，匡扶正义，重建家园——直至其发展得远超先前的模样。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.jo7mFOwEQ93B1keY classes="top-frame"]

Ancient Copper Dragon.name: 远古赤铜龙
Ancient Copper Dragon.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.60J6r5aW22zIcp2c classes="top-frame"]

随着时间变化的影响，抵达远古的赤铜龙往往温暖而又可靠。它们向朋友敞开的舒适巢穴，乃是可供年轻人们以及有需要者们学习与欢笑的温暖港湾。在维护这种小小的温暖之家同时，远古赤铜龙亦会警惕着未来的威胁，并在必要之时出手交战。

Copper Dragon Lairs.name: 赤铜龙巢穴
Copper Dragon Lairs.text:
Copper dragons typically inhabit multichamber caves and renovated ruins.

The region containing an adult or ancient copper dragon’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Chatty Critters. Tiny Beasts magically gain the ability to speak and understand Draconic while within 6 miles of the lair.

Giggle Fits. Whenever a creature other than the dragon and its allies is within 1 mile of the lair and rolls a 1 on a D20 Test, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn, as it is wracked with laughter.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Couatl.name: 羽蛇
Couatl.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.1wSWtKaYi2ywvnxm caption=false classes="top-frame"]

Guardian Manifestation of the Divine

Habitat: Desert, Forest, Grassland, Urban; Treasure: Relics

Embodiments of prophecy and protectors of divine secrets, couatls ensure fate unfolds as it should. They resemble serpents with rainbow wings, and each is a manifestation of a divine edict, a truth or fate that a righteous god decrees must hold true for all time. Most couatls appear in places of ancient power, where they guard hidden magic or ensure foretold acts do or don’t come to pass. Rarely, couatls watch over communities or travel lands in disguise, interpreting omens or manipulating factors to set fate on its proper course.

Motivated by eternal mandates, couatls sometimes behave in inscrutable or antagonistic ways. They are inflexible and uncompromising, as their existences are fundamentally tied to their divine directives, but they harm other creatures only when absolutely necessary to achieve divine goals.

Each couatl goes through a period of renewal at the end of an age. In a couatl’s lifecycle, an age might correspond to a celestial calendar or some divine chronology. Near the age’s end, the couatl lays a wondrous, rainbow-hued egg. When the age ends, the couatl dies. For a period—perhaps a single day, perhaps until an annual solar event—the couatl’s work is unattended. Once this time passes, the same couatl that laid the egg hatches from it, fully grown and renewed to serve for another age.

Crawling Claws.name: 蠕行之爪
Crawling Claws.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.2FfZKVMaJ8hCP1va caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Severed Appendages with Malicious Will

Habitat: Any; Treasure: None

Crawling claws are severed hands that move and act of their own murderous accord. These deathless appendages can spring to life from the severed limbs of killers and villains, and sinister magic-users might animate crawling claws as foul servants. Crawling claws appear in a variety of forms, from decaying human hands to the fresh appendages of animals or monsters.

Crawling Claw.name: 蠕行之爪
Crawling Claw.text:
Is it possible for any creature, any living being, to be inherently evil? Such an assertion may itself facilitate the committing of evil acts. By defining a person as evil, we give them free rein to behave as they will, absolving them from the wickedness of their words and the evil of their hands.

—Ansolm Haas, The Isolation of Evil

Lone crawling claws can continue killing sprees they perpetrated in life. Some recklessly attack the living, while others pursue specific victims. In rare cases, a crawling claw wreaks mayhem while the rest of its body still lives, with the original creature potentially unaware of its severed hand’s crimes.

Swarm of Crawling Claws.name: 蠕行之爪集群
Swarm of Crawling Claws.text: 蠕行之爪集群通常是由某位堕落的死灵师活化而来。但偶尔这些诡异的大群会从某个乱葬岗或者惨案的现场自行活化，去要凶手付出代价。

Cultists.name: 邪教徒
Cultists.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.00xigL73QK6AnaUF classes="top-frame"]

宣扬末日，不移狂信

栖息地： 任意；宝藏：个体，圣物

邪教徒使用魔法以及其他极端手段来传播其激进的信仰。一些邪教团是追求玄奥隐秘的密教团体，而另一些则是活跃于暗面的阴谋集团，意图实现某种怖人的大业。邪教徒们通常遵循着晦涩的密教习俗行事，或是醉心于解读古老的预言。它们还可能将其信仰献上给超自然的宗主——神灵、异界的生物、擅于操弄凡人的异质心灵、甚至是其他更加诡异的力量。掷一次邪教大业表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发一伙邪教徒们会意欲达成什么样的目标。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmCultistAgendas rollable classes="caption-top"]

Cult Members.name: 邪教成员
Cult Members.text: 邪教团通常围绕着一位魅力十足或独断专政的领导人建立了一系列等级制度。虽然邪教团的成员可能会自发地行动，但它们通常都听命于掌握了更强大非凡力量的上级。任何邪教团都可以包括以下几种成员：

Occult Symbols.name: 密教圣印
Occult Symbols.text:
我拜请萨瑞兹顿，上古元素之眼的恐怖威能，一切毁灭原力的主宰者——我代表邪恶元素教团向您献上请愿，请赐许我等为汝之代行——汝之愿景定将实现！

—邪恶元素教团的仪式

邪教徒通常依靠圣印来分辨教团的成员。这些圣印通常印在邪教的标志性物品上，亦可能印在衣物上、甚至可能直接刻在邪教徒的身体上。圣印的意义可能很容易理解，亦可能只有教团成员才能分辨。掷一次邪教圣印表，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定邪教团会使用什么作为自己的标志。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmCultSymbols000 caption=false]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmCultSymbolsDep caption=false]

Cultist.name: 邪教徒
Cultist.text: 邪教徒将自身奉献给其信仰领袖或能力非凡的尊主。这种狂热并不能给邪教徒带来魔法力量，但却给予它们直面威胁的超凡决意。邪教徒们执行着教团的大部分世俗工作，包括传播福音、执行犯罪——甚至充当祭品。

Cultist Fanatic.name: 邪教狂信者
Cultist Fanatic.text: 邪教狂信者领导着小规模的邪教，它们亦可能是更大的教团中的一份子。狂信者们比低阶的信徒们更加了解教团的隐秘，并能从其宗主处获得魔法力量。

Cultist Hierophant.name: 邪教教宗
Cultist Hierophant.text: 邪教教宗是监督并掌控着下属之生活、制定教团的法条、并解释其宗主之意愿的教团领袖。教宗的超凡伟力来自教团的宗主，或是某种其他超自然来源——甚至可能来自教宗自身的狂热虔信。这些宗教领袖掌握着教团最深层的隐秘，通常还掌控着奇异的圣物、神秘的遗迹、以及作为仆从的怪物。

Types of Cultists.name: 邪教徒类型
Types of Cultists.text: 邪教可以围绕任何神秘传统组织起来，但许多邪教都侍奉超自然存在。邪教成员通常拥有与他们所崇拜的力量相关的特殊能力。

Aberrant Cultist.name: 异怪邪教徒
Aberrant Cultist.text: 异怪邪教徒寻求来自世界之外的不可名状之力。它们会与诸如底栖魔鱼Aboleths或夺心魔Mind Flayers等怪物结盟，或是引导克苏鲁、哈达、精灵噬者伊提亚克-奥瑟尔、奈亚拉托提普、恶孽尸星、以及其它来自遥远国度之实体的不可名状之力。

Death Cultist.name: 死亡邪教徒
Death Cultist.text: 死亡邪教徒醉心于寂灭之力，自认为走在迈入永生、净化多元宇宙、降下注定的熵之末日的道途之上。这些邪教徒侍奉着强大的亡灵、末日的先兆、或是驾驭着超越死亡之力的不朽存在，例如阿瑟拉克、凯沃斯、奥喀斯、维克那，还有维捷丝。

Elemental Cultist.name: 元素邪教徒
Elemental Cultist.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.uCmcE0HVO62lsSZb classes="top-frame"]

元素邪教徒驾驭着毁灭性的原初伟力，用破坏去净化文明在世界上留下的痕迹。它们的目标亦可能是证明某一元素应当凌驾于构成世界的其他元素之上。这些邪教徒与元素怪物以及诸如邪恶元素亲王或上古元素之眼的不朽邪恶结盟。

Fiend Cultist.name: 邪魔邪教徒
Fiend Cultist.text: 邪魔邪教徒信仰邪魔以及邪恶神灵。它们通常致力于向无辜者降下毁灭，或是将其罪恶的宗主召唤进入这个世界。邪魔邪教徒通常侍奉臭名昭著的大能，例如大魔鬼、恶魔领主、以及其他邪恶的不朽存在。典型的宗主包括狄摩高跟、帕祖祖、埃乌兹、扎瑞尔以及祖格莫伊。

Cyclopes.name: 独眼巨人
Cyclopes.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.BfYvRpVPGrDEOOP3 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Monocular Servants of Destiny

Habitat: Coastal, Desert, Grassland, Hill, Mountain, Underdark; Treasure: Armaments

Cyclopes are gigantic, one-eyed descendants of the gods. Using their mystical vision, cyclopes can witness how future events are likely to occur.

Cyclops Oracle.name: 独眼巨人先知
Cyclops Oracle.text: 独眼巨人先知们凝望着历史的长河，研习其中被隐藏的真实。许多独眼巨人先知会向那些帮助其纠正属于过去的错误之人分享这些隐秘。

Cyclops Sentry.name: 独眼巨人哨卫
Cyclops Sentry.text: 独眼巨人哨卫大多侍奉其神圣先祖，并阻挠那些妄图篡改命运之人。

Dao.name: 土巨灵
Dao.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.pQOuSxXJVqGU7WbZ caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-corner-frame"]

Genie of the Earth

Habitat: Planar (Elemental Plane of Earth), Underdark; Treasure: Implements

Genies of minerals and gemstones, dao embody the resolve of rock. Using innate magic, they move through the earth unimpeded, exploring depths inaccessible to most. Dao delight in the treasures of the earth, whether raw gemstones, jewelry crafted from pure metals, or wondrous fossils. In exchange for such treasures, dao might reveal underground mysteries, such as paths through the Underdark, buried ruins, or whole subterranean realms.

Many dao call the Elemental Plane of Earth home. There, they create cities that glitter with treasure. Among these realms is the labyrinthine expanse called the Great Dismal Delve or the Sevenfold Mazework, which protects the City of Jewels, the Iron Crucible, and the Strait of Magnets.

On the Elemental Plane of Earth, galaxies of gemstones twinkle over vaults of treasure. If dao are there, so is wealth worth hunting.

—Gundren Rockseeker, dwarf treasure hunter

Darkmantle.name: 暗幕魔兽
Darkmantle.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ZgS8yH3gGOq4UWJP caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Ceiling-Clinging Ambush Predator

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: None

Unnatural subterranean hunters, darkmantles veil themselves in magical shadows and use their bizarre anatomies to disguise themselves as stalactites. When prey passes below, lurking darkmantles drop and unfurl their webbed tentacles, attempting to blind, suffocate, or crush their victims.

Darkmantles share similarities with piercers and ropers and often hunt near those monsters. Scholars have attempted to establish a shared origin or life cycle between those creatures, but their efforts are thwarted by those monsters’ supernatural physiologies and deadly natures.

Just assume there’s no such thing as a stalactite.

—S. Wakeman, Underdark explorer

Death Dog.name: 亡命恶犬
Death Dog.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.yloAbXj4y3Bk4JwW caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-corner-frame"]

Two-Headed Spreader of Disease

Habitat: Desert; Treasure: None

Death dogs are plagues on the arid lands they inhabit. These vicious, two-headed canines ambush creatures they perceive as weaker than themselves, favoring the wounded or infirm. They attack recklessly, infecting as many creatures as possible with their diseased jaws. If driven off, death dogs linger close to their victims, letting infection weaken their prey before they attack again.

And his sorrows will stalk your land like hungry dogs until the seas turn to sand and the sun burns to cinders.

—Tablet fragment from the Bright Desert

Legends tie death dogs to malicious death gods, the underworld, and cursed rulers. These stories are based on the malady death dogs spread. Roll on or choose a result from the Death Dog Malady Symptoms table to inspire symptoms spread by a death dog’s bite. These symptoms are cosmetic and don’t alter the effects of the death dog’s Bite action. The symptoms vanish when a creature no longer has the Poisoned condition from a death dog’s Bite.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmDeathDogMalady rollable classes="caption-top"]

Death Knights.name: 死亡骑士
Death Knights.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.xaVe6QDoYinq3bY1 classes="top-frame"]

不死军团的恐怖统帅

栖息地： 任意；宝藏： 武备

死亡骑士乃是邪恶的勇士，身披盔甲的骷髅督军。这些同时身负毁灭性的武艺和亵渎魔法的不死暴君率领着亵渎军团对抗生者，或在被诅咒的堡垒中盘踞。每一名死亡骑士都被过去的悲剧和耻辱缠绕，并最终因此犯下更大的罪行。

Death Knight.name: 死亡骑士
Death Knight.text: 死亡骑士是有着晦暗过往的可怕战士和霸道的指挥官。有些死亡骑士致力于终结让它们无法死去的诅咒，但它们自私的灵魂令其永远无法摆脱束缚自身的命运。另外一些，例如臭名昭著的死亡骑士索斯爵士，则会在破败的废墟中沉寂数个世纪——直到某些事物再次点燃它们不灭的邪恶时才会重新活动。

Death Knight Aspirant.name: 死亡骑士志从
Death Knight Aspirant.text: 当一个堕入邪道的骑士团之领袖作为死亡骑士复活时，其恶毒的追随者亦可能同样被诅咒浸染，化身为死亡骑士志从。这些追随者承继了其首领一部分的力量，并像在世时一样为其效力，忠诚地服从死亡骑士的命令，宣扬其可怕的意志。

Death Tyrant.name: 亡眼暴君
Death Tyrant.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.u65ZHLft3dXfCYCN caption=false classes="top-frame"]

一簇微光从天花板上黑暗的裂隙中降下。这些光点闪烁着诡异的光辉，映出悬浮于其下的一个巨大的异形颅骨。

—地脉迷城探险家，
加斯图斯·空翎的探索日志

跨越死亡的眼魔

栖息地： 幽暗地域；宝藏：任意

亡眼暴君通常蛰伏于幽暗地域的深处，它们生活在生前所盘踞的迷宫般的隧道内，或是居住于被其击溃的敌对眼魔的巢穴中。它们的巢穴内不存在任何生命，因为亡眼暴君会将它们的仆从也转变为不死的恐怖存在。

当眼魔痴迷于死亡，对自身的病态神化，或是想要前往那些生命难以存续的国度时，它们就会在数年后转变为一只亡眼暴君。有些亡眼暴君会从死去的眼魔尸体中诞生，另一些则可能是诡异魔法或幽暗地域辐射的杰作。尽管十分罕见，但有些眼魔会刻意地追求这种不死的状态，就像是堕落的施法者追求巫妖的不死特性一样，不过绝大部分眼魔都早已认为自己是完美无缺的。

Death Tyrant Lairs.name: 亡眼暴君巢穴
Death Tyrant Lairs.text:
Death tyrants often lurk deep in the Underdark, in the tunnel-mazes they occupied in life or in the lairs of enemy beholders they conquered. These lairs are devoid of life, as death tyrants change their servants into Undead horrors.

The region containing a death tyrant’s lair is warped by its presence, creating the following effects:

Negative Energy Suffusion. Whenever a creature within 1 mile of the lair regains Hit Points from a spell, it subtracts 1d10 from the number of Hit Points regained.

Scopophobia. Creatures within 1 mile of the lair feel as if they’re being watched. Any creature (excluding the death tyrant and its allies) that finishes a Short Rest while within 1 mile of the lair must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain no benefit from that rest.

If the death tyrant dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Demilich.name: 半巫妖
Demilich.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.2REPMI2LB1LxjLK6 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 corner-frame"]

What Lies beyond Lichdom

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Arcana

A demilich is a skull harboring the remnants of a lich’s wicked essence. If the burden of immortality overwhelms a lich, its consciousness turns inward as its body rots away. But if its remains are disturbed, a demilich rises. Demiliches usually appear as skulls adorned with gems or arcane sigils.

Demilich Lairs.name: 半巫妖巢穴
Demilich Lairs.text:
Demiliches jealously guard their deathtrap-laden sanctums. The most notorious of these is the Tomb of Horrors, lair of the infamous Acererak.

The region containing a demilich’s lair is twisted by its presence, creating the following effects:

Enervating Domain. Whenever a creature other than the demilich or one of its allies finishes a Long Rest within 1 mile of the lair, the creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or have its Hit Point maximum reduced by 1d4. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a Long Rest outside that area.

Travel Ward. Creatures can’t use teleportation or planar travel to enter or exit the lair.

If the demilich dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Deva.name: 天神使徒
Deva.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.fJwUjXWjHzXYlzmB caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

World-Changing Angelic Messenger

Habitat: Planar (Upper Planes); Treasure: Relics

Devas are emissaries of divine will. These immortal messengers adopt the shapes of mystical beasts or idealized, winged mortals. As with all angels, their true forms are known only to the gods they serve.

Rather than literal correspondence from a god, a deva conveys an allegory or quest to mortals, tasking them with delivering something to its rightful place. While the angel might be called on in times of need, it encourages mortal heroism. Should a deva’s chosen champions carry out their charge, they experience a revelation or the world is changed in line with divine purpose. Roll on or choose a result from the Deva Messages table to inspire a deva’s charge.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmDevaMessages00 rollable classes="caption-top clear-both"]

Displacer Beast.name: 移位兽
Displacer Beast.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.V1rpGnHoXOUvWNFb caption=false classes="right two lift-1 top-frame"]

Deceptive Feline Stalker

Habitat: Forest; Treasure: None

A displacer beast resembles a gaunt, six-legged panther with a barbed tentacle sprouting from each of its shoulders. This predator uses innate magic to displace light so it appears to be several feet away from its actual location.

The murderous fury of a displacer beast is fit only for nightmares, of which I’ve been haunted since narrowly escaping one’s ambush. I’m certain that beast stalks me still.

—Jen-Ahb, naturalist
and displacer beast survivor

Displacer beasts hunt not just to feed but because they enjoy killing. Once displacer beasts begin stalking prey, they can’t be deterred until either they or their quarry is slain. While displacer beasts commonly inhabit dense forests, they might pursue travelers across great distances and even into cities or dungeons. More cunning than mere animals, these predators might set ambushes or lie hidden for days to bring down their prey.

Displacer beasts sometimes pursue prey through portals to other planes of existence. As a result, these predators can be found across the multiverse, particularly on the worlds of the Material Plane, in the Shadowfell, and in the Feywild. These restless hunters can destroy a land’s natural balance and drive other creatures to extinction. As a result, many druid circles and Fey view displacer beasts as deadly threats.

Djinni.name: 气巨灵
Djinni.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.oPJEtvvW6KQSmX4L caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-corner-frame"]

Genie of the Air

Habitat: Coastal, Planar (Elemental Plane of Air); Treasure: Arcana

As genies of wind and skies, djinn personify freedom and might. They can control wind and travel as swiftly as a breeze. They might be as serene as drifting clouds or as tempestuous as storms, but most djinn relish their freedom and desire to discover the wonders of the multiverse. Djinn often know many stories, and they might share such lore with those who offer their own exciting stories in trade.

While many djinn create airy palaces on stormy coasts or high in the clouds, untold numbers dwell on the Elemental Plane of Air. In floating cities, djinn collect tales and experiences from across the planes of existence, sharing them in fabulous forums, libraries, and theaters. The greatest of these cities is the Citadel of Ice and Steel, in which wind-sculpted towers contain a city-size trove of incredible knowledge and treasures that defy belief.

Doppelganger.name: 变形怪
Doppelganger.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.zciT1bWJ5X4MhXsE caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Shape-Shifting Infiltrator

Habitat: Underdark, Urban; Treasure: Individual

Doppelgangers are supernatural beings with the ability to shape-shift into any humanlike form. Their mind-reading abilities aid them in creating near-perfect disguises and plucking secrets from unguarded minds. Occasionally, doppelgangers use their shape-shifting ability in more overt ways, transforming into unsettling forms to frighten foes.

Meeting yourself is the surest way to realize you’re not as charming as you think you are.

—Someone claiming to be
Lorhirin of Fearchor Keep

A doppelganger’s agenda might relate to its mysterious magical origins or to more mercenary goals. Roll on or choose a result from the Doppelganger Deceptions table to inspire a doppelganger’s plot.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmDoppelgangerDe rollable classes="caption-top"]

Dracolich.name: 龙巫妖
Dracolich.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.dIpJ9ujlKGI6l7TX caption=false classes="top-frame"]

巨龙暴君再临

栖息地： 任意； 宝藏： 任意

最堕落的那些巨龙试图挣脱死亡的束缚，以禁忌秘术与亵渎魔法将自身化为可怖的龙巫妖。这些不死巨龙将魂魄与宝石相缚，以邪法驱使腐朽躯壳。当龙巫妖的尸骸最终化作森然白骨，其仍延续生前跨越数个世纪的阴谋，向宿敌施以复仇，追逐其生时未能实现的残虐野心。

龙巫妖兼具亡灵扭曲的永生之力与巨龙的传奇威能。它们仍保有龙息，却化作充满暗能的颤栗魔爆。这些可怖存在会逐渐腐化巢穴周遭的土地，并吸引阴邪的追随者——通常是其他亡灵或渴求其可怖力量的邪教徒。所有活龙皆憎恶龙巫妖并欲除之而后快，亦视其为龙族魔法的畸变。

巨龙蜕变为龙巫妖的亵渎仪式不可胜数。无论以何种方式诞生，龙巫妖皆会选定一枚承载魂魄的宝石，将不死巨龙锚定于世。只要龙巫妖与灵魂宝石身处同一位面，即便其躯壳被毁，其魂魄亦可遁入宝石蛰伏，待时机成熟重聚骇人形骸。龙巫妖常将灵魂宝石藏于宝库中意义非凡的珍宝内，或伪饰成平凡饰物。掷一次龙巫妖灵魂宝石载体表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发龙巫妖的灵魂宝石藏于何处。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmDracolichSoulG rollable classes="caption-top"]

Dracolich Lairs.name: 龙巫妖巢穴
Dracolich Lairs.text:
And naught will be left save shattered thrones with no rulers. But the dead dragons shall rule the world entire …

—Sammaster the Fallen’s
translation of The Chronicle of Years to Come

A dracolich lurks in a corrupted version of the lair it had in life.
The region containing a dracolich’s lair is warped by its presence, creating the following effects:

Sapping Mist. The area within 1 mile of the lair is Lightly Obscured by pale fog. Whenever a creature other than the dracolich or one of its allies finishes a Long Rest in that area, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 Exhaustion level.

Soul Drain. Creatures within 1 mile of the lair have Disadvantage on Death Saving Throws.

If the dracolich is destroyed or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately. The effects resume if the dracolich gains a new body (see its Soul Gem trait).

Dragon Turtle.name: 龙龟
Dragon Turtle.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.9fkVEpMi7I1kkDpH caption=false classes="top-frame"]

海底世界的远古统御者

栖息地： 海岸，水下；宝藏： 任意

龙龟是强大的生物，它们的龟壳庞大至足以被误认为是岛屿，而其下颚亦能向折断树枝一样轻松咬碎船只。在这些水生巨龙之中，有些安然在深海中沉睡，而另外一些则以它们的灼热龙息戒备森严地守护着广阔的领地，将一切沉入海底或航行于波涛之上的事物视作己物。偶尔，这些巨龙也会同意援助海盗、水生族群或海洋宗教，以此换取他们对沉没秘藏的“贡献”。

许多龙龟栖息于水下深处的隐秘巢穴或废墟中，甚至数代地表居民都无从得见。正如组成其名的龙与龟，龙龟的寿命也极其悠长。有些龙龟会回忆起上古奇景或很久之前经过它们领地的非凡个体。若能提供它们从未在海底见过的奇珍异宝，或许便可说服这些龙龟分享它们的往昔故事，亦或是得到穿越其领地的指引。

Dretches.name: 怯魔
Dretches.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.wt1OWvE4dWTeUM5L caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-corner-frame"]

Demons of Frenzy and Vulgarity

Habitat: Planar (Abyss); Treasure: None

The servants and victims of greater demons, dretches embody petty instincts, chaotic impulses, and violent urges. Dretches exist in unfathomable numbers in the depths of the Abyss, where their reeking throngs fill vast demonic hordes.

Dretch.name: 怯魔
Dretch.text:
Ah, the infinite wonders of the Abyss. If there’s anything you don’t like, you’ll find it here.

—Jaranda, expert on the Abyss

Lone dretches serve other demons or evil magic-users. They are erratic, filthy, and violent, and they demonstrate little sense of self-preservation.

Swarm of Dretches.name: 怯魔集群
Swarm of Dretches.text: 怯魔集群有时会从无底深渊逃入其他存在位面，亦可能是某次恶魔入侵的一部分。这些粗鄙的恶魔带着残忍的激情，漫无目的地横行肆虐。

Drider.name: 蛛化卓尔
Drider.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.dU27MOiCEYOxjNUh caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Spiderlike Underdark Hunter

Habitat: Forest, Underdark; Treasure: Armaments

Driders combine the features of drow and giant spiders. The wicked god Lolth is fond of transforming her drow worshipers into driders, as either a blessing or a curse. These driders often become fanatical servants of their god, or they are overwhelmed by their transformation and live only to indulge their predatory arachnid instincts.

Driders also appear when whole communities are transformed by a wicked god’s wrath or other magical means, or driders might be part of a world’s natural population. Most dwell underground or in dense forests where they can make the most of their spiderlike traits. Driders with non-drow features are uncommon but possible. Roll on or choose a result from the Drider Metamorphoses table to inspire how supernatural driders come into being.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmDriderMetamorp rollable classes="caption-top clear-both"]

Druid.name: 德鲁伊
Druid.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.eGHYRvhixasexZet caption=false classes="top-frame"]

卫戍自然，维护自然

栖息地： 任意； 宝藏： 圣物，个体

德鲁伊们驾驭原初魔法，遵循古老教义，与动物和其他玄秘存在紧密联结，捍卫着广袤自然，净化着世界的疾病。这些魔法使可能是隐居于某地的隐士，亦可能从属于某一神秘组织。掷一次德鲁伊使命表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发这名德鲁伊如何使用魔法践行其使命。
