@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmDruidTradition rollable classes="caption-top"]

Dryad.name: 树精
Dryad.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.4rCxYanQpanY5dvW caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Tree-Bound Guardian of Nature

Habitat: Forest; Treasure: Any

Guardians of the woodlands, dryads magically flit from tree to tree and from root to bough, harrying trespassers with tangling vines and thorns. Most of these elusive beings have a special connection with one plant or a natural sanctuary that they protect. Some also share physical similarities with the plants they’re most connected to. Dryads might sicken or die if their plant or sanctuary is destroyed, recovering only if it is healed or magically replaced. Roll on or choose an option from the Dryad Sanctuaries table to inspire a dryad’s bond.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmDryadSanctuari rollable classes="caption-top"]

Earth Elemental.name: 土元素
Earth Elemental.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.yC0ZARX08HatY2Ot caption=false classes="right two lift-1 top-frame"]

Primal Spirit of Soil and Stone

Habitat: Mountain, Planar (Elemental Plane of Earth), Underdark; Treasure: None

Primal spirits from the Elemental Plane of Earth merge with rocks and minerals to form earth elementals. These beings possess powerful limbs and coarse features, sometimes studded with ore, gems, crystals, colorful striations, or living plants. On the Material Plane, earth elementals often serve those who conjure them, or they appear in regions influenced by their home plane, such as crystalline nodes, energetic fault lines, or veins of magical ore. Earth elementals effortlessly move through stone and can bring ruin to whole structures with their mighty fists.

The foundations of our homes, the strength of our weapons, the vaults of our greatest secrets—earth is nothing less than the grip of reality itself. It is the mightiest element. This cannot be denied.

—Kabril the Perfect Compass, ruler of dao

Earth elementals are typically made of more than dirt. While an elemental’s composition doesn’t change its statistics or have monetary value, it makes each elemental distinct. Roll on or choose a result from the Earth Elemental Compositions table to inspire an earth elemental’s features.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmEarthElemental rollable classes="caption-top"]

Efreeti.name: 火之巨灵
Efreeti.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.nQFeWNF6AwBbpjBy caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Genie of Fire

Habitat: Desert, Planar (Elemental Plane of Fire); Treasure: Armaments

Efreet burn with the energy and unpredictability of fire. Their innate magic allows them to conjure flames from nothing and shape treasures within magical infernos. Many efreet have wicked reputations, as their fickle natures and love for dramatic conflagrations can be destructive. Other efreet delight in fire’s beauty, be it the delicacy of a candle flame or the shared wonder of fireworks. These genies might aid mortals in exchange for treasures or the liberation of captive Elementals.

Imagine seas of platinum and liquid flame, the Crimson Pillar with fires hot enough to sear the gods, and the infinite delights of the City of Brass. Now imagine what my master offers …

—Veyisvexvayn, magma mephit herald

On many worlds, efreet dwell in sweltering deserts and volcanic regions. Those that make their homes on the Elemental Plane of Fire create incredible cities among seas of flame and molten minerals. Eclipsing all of these is the storied City of Brass, a gleaming metropolis that is one of the most wondrous cities in the multiverse. Here, magic tempers the plane’s extreme heat, making the City of Brass a hub of trade between planes of existence.

Elemental Cataclysm.name: 元初天劫
Elemental Cataclysm.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.cX0guEqQPcL9kfC8 caption=false classes="top-frame"]

旧世破灭，新世创生

栖息地： 异界（元素混沌）； 宝藏： 无

元素位面的边界之外的元素混沌，原初能量永无止境地冲刷，肆虐。这片无边无际的残虐之域正是元初天劫横行之地——祂们诞生自多元宇宙原初原力，充斥着不相容的元素威能。 这些蕴含着原始之对立的实体会湮灭其所见的几乎所有事物，但祂们亦会在废墟之中留下新生的种子。

元初天劫很少逃出元素混沌。然而，当位面之间出现某种灾变，又或是因虚无主义邪教的召唤，天劫便从元素混沌之中逃出，降临物质位面。元初天劫的存在足以撼动整片界域，在物质位面的祂会毁灭途经的一切，如碾碎蝼蚁般踏过城市，将整个国度拖入混乱。元初天劫的肆虐并非是随机的，祂们憎恨一切对自然界的破坏：矿井、丰碑、要塞、城市——然而祂们最为仇视的，乃是金属造物与机关造物。祂们呼嚎着天罚，吟唱着破灭，令万事万物于内层位面之言中步入毁灭。

几乎没有人能阻止元初天劫的脚步。胆敢面对此等浩劫大灾之一者通常会去试图中断将祂召唤现世的仪式，或是将祂引向一道位面裂隙，甚至是咒唤另一尊泰坦，以期二者能够同归于尽。在恐怖的浩劫过后，祂所留下的只有灰烬、洪涝、风暴，以及崩裂的大地。然而待这些灾难消退之后，这些土地亦会重获新生，或是发生其他环境变化。掷一次元初天劫遗留转变表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发在元初天劫过后会发生什么样的变化。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmElementalAlter rollable classes="caption-top"]

Empyreans.name: 至高天
Empyreans.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.2bLHU5BFkZcLefGj classes="top-frame"]

诸神之子嗣

栖息地： 任意；宝藏： 圣物

终有一日，吾将登临风暴之神位——照看无可计数的信徒，回应每一道祈祷，赋予世界以变革——但在那之前，我想做什么就做什么。

—寇铎哈，风暴之神子

至高天是神灵的后代。祂们并非真正的神祇，却也继承了来自其神性亲代的神性影响与威能。一些至高天类似半神，驾驭着难以想象的伟力，以及重塑凡人之能力；另一些至高天却不过是神性存在之思想或某道关注力的具现化。无论一个至高天是具体化的完美生物，还是某份神力的片影，其外表都受其创造者的影响。掷一次至高天特征表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发一位至高天继承的神力在其外表上以何种形式具现。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmEmpyreanInflue rollable classes="caption-top"]

Empyrean Iota.name: 至高天微尘
Empyrean Iota.text: 至高天微尘乃是神灵的思绪、回忆、甚至是间接投下的注意，并具有一定程度上的自主性。其外形类似悬于空中的图纹、聚集的彩色光点、神祇的象征、或是奇异的形状，这些存在是神祇的信使，并为其神仆提供援助。至高天微尘有着自己性格与知识，不过其知识也许会被其创造者的神域与愿景所局限。

Empyrean.name: 至高天
Empyrean.text:
继承了神性伟力的至高天乃是有着人形外形的完美存在。至高天与祂们的创造者之间的关系，也许是父母与其子嗣、统治者与其侍从、发明者与其造物、或是其他类似形式的关系。至高天的存在从根本上受其守护神以及其与诸上层位面的圣神及诸下层位面的魔神的联系所影响，不过即使如此，至高天们仍然有着自由意志。

作为天族的那些至高天通常是意图证明自己配得上其神圣血统的贵胄。祂们大多为其亲代服务，或是支援这些神祇的理念，或是协助他们的神选勇者。

作为邪魔的那些至高天则通常是自私且怖人的恶徒，意图夺取其亲代的伟力。祂们中的一些会集结起一支亵渎大军，或是统治着一座隐藏的国度，来嘲讽那些真神；不过也有一些邪魔至高天会寻找摆脱其受诅咒般的“家庭”。

Erinyes.name: 罪魔
Erinyes.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.sbcrVytogOa2R5Qr caption=false classes="right three lift-50"]

Devil of Vengeance and Righteous Wrath

Habitat: Planar (Nine Hells); Treasure: Armaments

Erinyes, also known as furies, are winged devils clad in fiendish armor. These fallen angels exact a merciless form of divine justice, hunting down oath breakers and dragging the rightfully damned to the Nine Hells in the grip of their magical ropes. Few ever glimpse what lies within these devils’ armored exteriors, and erinyes ensure that those who do can never speak of what they’ve seen.

Erinyes often serve archdevils and guard the order of the Nine Hells against trespassers and escapees. Although they’re prone to wrathful outbursts, erinyes cooperate well with other devils. They sometimes hunt in trios with other erinyes, forging infamous reputations for themselves.

When not in the service of a diabolical master, erinyes hunt wicked souls. They pursue quarries relentlessly, across the multiverse and for ages if need be. While they might be summoned to serve evil magic-users, erinyes also listen for oaths and curses sworn in their names. In rare cases, wronged mortals who call out with just rage might be heard by an erinyes who appears to take vengeance on their behalf. Once erinyes are so summoned, they won’t leave without claiming the soul of either their quarry or the mortal who summoned them.

Ettercap.name: 伊特怪
Ettercap.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.dnQMffbac0Vrxtxd caption=false classes="top-frame"]

剧毒蛛形绑匪

栖息地： 森林； 宝藏： 器具

伊特怪是一种类似蜘蛛的猎手，潜伏在森林深处，寻找猎物并将受害者拖进蛛网密布的巢中。这些恶毒的掠食者貌似蛛形纲动物，但双足行走，身躯驼背。它们因剧毒的啃咬和和射出蛛网捕捉受害者的能力而臭名昭著。伊特怪经常以小团体的形式和巨蜘蛛与普通蜘蛛群一同捕猎。

伊特怪经常在它们生活环境中过度捕猎。如果不加以控制，伊特怪很可能会用网和被包成茧的剩饭堆满整片森林，使得伊特怪和妖精们发生冲突。恶毒的伊特怪会不择手段地折磨作为食物的妖精；它们更喜欢恐吓那些比他们小的妖精，比如皮克精Pixies以及小仙灵Sprites。伊特怪几乎不会立即把智慧生物吞食，而是会先把猎物裹成茧，恐吓折磨数日，再饱餐一顿。

伊特怪会避开火焰，因为火焰能快速烧尽它们的蛛网，还有它们安家的枯木。

Ettin.name: 双头巨人
Ettin.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.CWBPA8KsqIJzGYE2 caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Quarrelsome Two-Headed Giant

Habitat: Hill, Mountain, Underdark; Treasure: Individual

Ettins are physically powerful Giants with two heads. While many ettins have features similar to hill giants, others have more bestial or unusual traits, such as tusks, short horns, or a single eye on each head.

Ettins frequently ally with other Giants or groups that value their strength, such as hill giants, bandits, or ogres. Some ettins possess mystical ties to the lands they inhabit, and they might know or guard secrets valued by druids or Fey.

Twice the malice, aggressiveness, and appetite—the ettin demonstrates that two heads aren’t necessarily better than one.

—Bertrand, Inquisitor of the Mind Fire

Each ettin head has a distinct personality. While this makes some ettins quarrelsome with themselves and others, many function as a team. An ettin head might have its own name, or both heads might refer to themselves as a single being—either with one name or a portmanteau of two.

Roll on or choose a result from the Ettin Interactions table to inspire how an ettin’s heads are interacting when the creature is encountered.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmEttinInteracti rollable classes="caption-top"]

Faerie Dragons.name: 妖精龙
Faerie Dragons.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.s25jNqKl9TMQi10l caption=false classes="right three lift-1 top-frame"]

Whimsical Draconic Tricksters

Habitat: Forest; Treasure: Implements

Faerie dragons are cat-size pranksters with draconic features, butterfly-like wings, and scales of warm hues as youths and cool hues as adults.

Faerie Dragon Adult.name: 妖精龙成体
Faerie Dragon Adult.text: 成年妖精龙的戏谑往往指引迷途者至需帮助之人或导正世间不公。

Faerie Dragon Youth.name: 妖精龙青年体
Faerie Dragon Youth.text: 青年妖精龙尤爱对古板之徒喷吐欢愉吐息。

Fire Elemental.name: 火元素
Fire Elemental.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.elP0SQVVUF6vTQM3 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Primal Spirit of Heat and Flame

Habitat: Desert, Planar (Elemental Plane of Fire); Treasure: None

All the elements bow to fire. The strongest earth melts. Water boils. Even air ignites. We are all souls of flame, and we know what it is to burn.

—Marrake the Incandescent, ruler of efreet

Fire elementals arise when spirits of the Elemental Plane of Fire inhabit flames, burning cinders, and heated smoke. These beings are tangible despite largely being made of flames and particles, and they can uses their vague limbs to ignite foes and flammable materials. Fire elementals typically burn in shades of orange and red, but other colors are possible. Most on the Material Plane are summoned by magical means, or they might appear near rifts amid desert depths, volcanoes, wildfires, or magma flows that connect to their home plane.

Fire elementals might burn in distinctive ways. Roll on or choose a result from the Fire Elemental Compositions table to inspire a fire elemental’s features.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmFireElementalC rollable classes="caption-top"]

Fire Giant.name: 火巨人
Fire Giant.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Grz6u1ydBBOD2M4o caption=false classes="hike-3 top-frame"]

灼热火渊之巨人

栖息地： 山地，幽暗地域；宝藏： 武备

火巨人栖居于山脉深处的熔渊空洞与炽热岩浆之间。他们利用地底深处丰富的热能与矿藏打造出各种奇物，比如巨大的战争兵器和精妙的艺术造物。

火巨人拥有魁梧的身躯，皮肤呈现出多种岩石的色调，发丝如同跃动的火焰。

大多数火巨人居住在活跃的火山山脉或幽深的洞穴之中，那里矗立着他们熔炉要塞。邪恶的火巨人往往崇尚武力，他们锻造强大的兵器征服邻族并攫取珍贵资源。较为温和的火巨人则会以工艺制品换取所需物资，甚至可能与其他匠人分享巨人古老的锻造技法。无论哪一种火巨人，他们都热衷于实施宏大的建造计划，且绝不容忍旁人打扰他们巨大工坊中的神圣创作。

Flameskull.name: 燃焰之颅
Flameskull.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.1OI2RKyKLrHuzoQa caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Skull Smoldering with Magical Obsession

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Arcana

I never cared for warmth. I never needed a body. My will is enough, and my work will be the legacy that makes my every sacrifice worthwhile!

—Trenzia, Undermountain flameskull

Flameskulls are flying skulls that blaze with magical fire and the half-remembered arcana of dead spellcasters. They rise from the remains of dead magic-users who were reanimated by sinister necromancers or whose magical pursuits drive them beyond death. Flameskulls might serve as guardians for their creators or pursue ambitions left unfulfilled in life. They lash out at foes with destructive spells and bursts of fire, wielding magic without the need for most components.

Flameskulls take various forms, from skulls with humanlike features to ones with fearsome or bestial alterations. Their flames vary in color and grow more intense when they’re angry. Roll on or choose a result from the Flameskull Details table to inspire what makes a flameskull distinctive.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmFlameskullDeta rollable classes="caption-top"]

Flesh Golem.name: 血肉魔像
Flesh Golem.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Wb1UZlASIbLD3Ptq caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-cradle-frame"]

Dead Flesh Given New Life

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Arcana

The barrier between the mortal and the divine lies shattered—open is the mold for new gods. It was I who invaded the divine. Not with a spear but with a stitch. Not with my heresies but with my heart.

—Viktra Mordenheim,
Darklord of Lamordia

Flesh golems are roughly human-shaped collections of body parts bound together by misused magic or strange science. They serve their reckless creators, but many possess disjointed memories and instincts from their component parts. If wounded, these golems might go berserk and vent their confusion on anything in their sight, including their creators.

Flesh golems appear in varied forms. Roll on or choose a result from the Flesh Golem Characteristics table to inspire a flesh golem’s features.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmFleshGolemChar rollable classes="caption-top"]

Flumph.name: 呋噜
Flumph.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.xUE0NVTUynPQvh99 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 corner-frame"]

Strange Ally from a Strange Place

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Arcana

Bizarre creatures with aberrant agendas inhabit the Underdark. Flumphs number among the few that are helpful to strangers.

These tentacled, telepathic creatures jet through the air in short bursts, venting gases with a sound that gives them their name. Rather than speaking, flumphs communicate telepathically and by changing color to reflect their moods.

Flumphs dwell in psychically charged regions or near creatures with psionic magic. They harmlessly feed off psychic energies, but in doing so, they often encounter dangerous beings such as aboleths and mind flayers. While flumphs generally avoid combat, they often help adventurers in peril. Such help might be of doubtful use, but flumphs mean well. Roll on or choose a result from the Flumph Assistance table to inspire what support flumphs provide.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmFlumphAssistan rollable classes="caption-top"]

Flumph Colors.name: 呋噜颜色
Flumph Colors.text:
呋噜的肢体会通过变幻颜色来反应其心情。呋噜颜色和情绪表总结了常见的呋噜颜色以及与之最为相近的人类情绪。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmFlumphColorsAn caption=false]

Fomorian.name: 废陋巨人
Fomorian.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Z5TWsmxFnX2ZPPFN caption=false classes="top-frame"]

诅咒缠身的黑暗巨人

栖息地： 幽暗地域；宝藏： 任意

由于卡罗托在废陋巨人进攻妖精荒野这件事中扮演的角色，全父安南放逐了他的这个儿子。自那一天起，序位——也就是巨人及其神灵的阶级制度——永远地发生了改变，废陋巨人不再于其中有一席之地。

—毕格比

废陋巨人曾经以魔法天赋而闻名，而如今则被妖精诅咒缠身。出于自大，他们被欺骗入侵了妖精荒野，意图把那里的魔法据为己有。而当至高妖精君王们联合起来时，废陋巨人被他们击溃，并被妖精们施以超自然的古怪诅咒，让它们的身体变得和它们那罪恶的灵魂一般丑得令人生厌。自那以后，废陋巨人便居住在幽暗地域，在他们魔法城市的废墟之中，至高妖精的诅咒依然缠着他们，用不住蔓延的溃烂、歪七扭八的器官和诡异的不适感折磨着这些巨人。然而废陋巨人非但没有为自己的罪行赎罪，反而利用起了诅咒的魔力来对付他人。 掷一次废陋巨人扭曲表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发生物在遭受废陋巨人的扭曲恶咒时外形发生什么样的变化。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmFomorianWarpin rollable classes="caption-top"]

Frost Giant.name: 霜巨人
Frost Giant.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.38e8opU0db1lfgr0 caption=false classes="top-frame"]

寒霜与风雪之巨人

栖息地： 寒带，山地；宝藏： 武备

那些小个子们几乎没有什么值得掠夺的东西，所以我们从他们那里拿点什么，他们应该也不会在意。

—贾尔·格鲁格努尔，霜巨人

从冰川覆盖的山巅到广袤的苔原，霜巨人的家园屹立于此。这些巨人的皮肤和头发呈现出冰冷之色。对寒冷的天然免疫力使他们能够在大多数生物无法生存的地方繁衍生息。他们在狩猎和战斗时会利用这种坚韧，并用令人颤栗的战吼为盟友提供支持。

霜巨人经常长途跋涉以寻找食物和物资。这导致许多霜巨人成为掠夺者，并因此声名狼藉。另一些霜巨人则以更和平的方式生活，比如猎杀巨型猎物或建造避寒的庇护所（通常以温泉或雪地竞赛为特色）。霜巨人有时会与冰冷的妖精或居住在地下的火巨人结成伙伴关系，作为他们领域的守护者，以换取财宝、武器和工艺品。

Fungi.name: 真菌
Fungi.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.FOHxOq0mU98UM0Ds classes="right two lift-50 right-cradle-frame"]

Deadly Spores and Predatory Polyps

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: None

The dank, sunless Underdark is a fertile breeding ground for weird and dangerous fungi.

Gas Spore Fungus.name: 气孢菌
Gas Spore Fungus.text: 气孢菌是一种漂浮的球状真菌，带有类似于眼魔的眼球与眼柄的根状生长结构和突起。气孢菌在被摧毁时会爆发出毒性气体，以此能够感染生物并在数小时内杀死它们。感染者的尸体会产生出更多气孢菌——它们将在数日后生长至完整的大小。

Shrieker Fungus.name: 尖叫菌
Shrieker Fungus.text: 如若暴露于光照或受到其他干扰，这些形似蘑菇的尖叫菌会发出高音调的尖叫——正如其名。这种尖嚎可能会向其他生物示警或吸引捕食者。

Violet Fungus.name: 紫腐菌
Violet Fungus.text: 紫腐菌行动缓慢但灵活，其卷须触碰到的任何血肉都会腐烂。

Violet Fungus Necrohulk.name: 紫腐菌尸聚怪
Violet Fungus Necrohulk.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.QzhgyzX20XtRFUyv caption=false classes="right two lift-1 top-frame"]

A violet fungus necrohulk forms when a violet fungus colony infests and animates an ample heap of decay. This necrohulk attacks prey and spreads fungal spores for the colony.

Galeb Duhr.name: 石人
Galeb Duhr.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.nmgbbpH13CD9nQRD caption=false classes="top-frame"]

大地众眼，大地众耳

栖息地： 丘陵、山脉；宝藏： 任意

石人是活生生的石头生灵，它们追寻着大地之中的和声，回应着山石之间的颤音。它们的身躯由岩石构成，有肢体与仿似人脸的特征，身上被宝石、矿物（或是周遭能找到的其他矿物质）所点缀。

石人近乎不朽，它们的寿命可以与众山比肩，但它们对时间的感知以及对危险的察觉能力完全不如那些短命的种族。它们依靠隐藏自己来躲避危险，而当它们现身时，即便它们的行为与举止看似无比笨拙，但它们对周边土地与大地的秘密了如指掌。被迫行动时，石人会痛击它的敌人，不仅如此，还会让周围的石头也一起来痛击它的敌人。

一些山中居民认为石人算是某种置身事外的盟友。他们也许会将秘密或宝藏托付给石人保管，借由给这些长寿生灵之手将事物寄托给它们的后代。还有一些山中居民流传着石人之歌的传言，称那石人们之间唱着一种几乎无法被人听见的和声，这和声能引发地震，也能让火山喷发。

Gargoyle.name: 石像鬼
Gargoyle.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.GItjEgV0aXDqg5fk caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Sculpted Sentinel Hidden in Plain Sight

Habitat: Underdark, Urban; Treasure: Any

Gargoyles are sculptures inhabited by elemental spirits. Wings and magic allow their heavy stone bodies to fly, and they often perch where they can blend in amid ornate architecture, rock formations, or mundane statues. Gargoyles usually serve the magic-users who conjured them into their bodies, but if left to their own devices, they might play cruel pranks and steal treasures to hoard in lofty lairs.

Gargoyles have a variety of appearances. Roll on or choose a result from the Gargoyle Sculptures table to inspire how a gargoyle looks.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGargoyleSculpt rollable classes="caption-top clear-both"]

Gargoyle Ambushes.name: 石像鬼伏击
Gargoyle Ambushes.text:
Where evil passes in the Elemental Plane of Earth, it stains the rock and spoils the soil. Malice vanishes amid other elements, but in the dismal dark, the wicked shape it into nightmares.

—Tiv, scholar of the Elemental Planes

Gargoyles seek to ambush foes or creatures that trespass on their territories. With no biological needs and supernatural patience, these monsters might wait unmoving for months, revealing themselves only when conditions are perfect to attack. They tend to lurk where statuary seems commonplace or where terrain obscures the shape and color of their bodies. Roll on or choose a result from the Gargoyle Camouflage table to inspire where a gargoyle sets up an ambush.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGargoyleCamouf rollable classes="caption-top clear-both"]

Gelatinous Cube.name: 凝胶方块
Gelatinous Cube.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.VMb5V9t6BEiFyFnc caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Dungeon-Scouring Block of Ooze

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Any

Quivering masses of acidic goo, gelatinous cubes wobble through narrow caverns and dungeons, engulfing anything in their paths. These Oozes are naturally transparent, making them difficult to see while they’re stationary. Creatures and objects that become stuck within these slimes are gradually dissolved. Undigested detritus sometimes floats within a gelatinous cube, hinting at its past meals. Roll on or choose a result from the Gelatinous Cube Debris table to inspire a gelatinous cube’s contents.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGelatinousCube rollable classes="caption-top"]

Ghasts.name: 妖鬼
Ghasts.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.R26MiQsqnl6fSXKo caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Tyrants among Corpses

Habitat: Swamp, Underdark, Urban; Treasure: Any

Ghasts are reeking, undying corpses closely related to ghouls. They hunger for the vices they enjoyed in life as much as they do for rotting flesh.

Ghast.name: 妖鬼
Ghast.text: 妖鬼时常与食尸鬼一同掠夺墓穴，然后窃走内部的财富。

Ghast Gravecaller.name: 妖鬼坟语者
Ghast Gravecaller.text: 妖鬼坟语者使用着堕落的魔法，会与尸体沟通。它们也许会装成吸血鬼或巫妖的样子。

Ghost.name: 幽魂
Ghost.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.fpm1tkGctzWWTfsZ caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Lost Soul and Unquiet Spirit

Habitat: Underdark, Urban; Treasure: Any

Ghosts arise when living creatures die in a state of extreme emotion or having left an important task undone. These incorporeal spirits haunt locations that are meaningful to them, lingering until their business is complete or they’re put to rest.

Ghosts typically appear as semitransparent versions of the creatures they were in life, though some bear evidence of the wounds that killed them or have nightmarish distortions to their forms. Many have extreme reactions to actions, objects, or individuals that remind them of emotionally charged aspects of their lives. Particularly desperate or vengeful ghosts might possess the living to fulfill their ends.

Ghouls.name: 食尸鬼
Ghouls.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.EVfaVbUfg7WyJuBh caption=false classes="right two lift-50 bottom-frame"]

Eaters of the Dead

Habitat: Swamp, Underdark, Urban; Treasure: Any

Packs of ghouls haunt the rotten corners of the world, ravenously hunting for corpses and those soon to be corpses. These gaunt, animate cadavers with unnaturally long tongues dwell in catacombs and ruins where they devour the contents of graves and paralyze foes with vicious claws.

On a plain of teeth, in a temple of filth, the starving king wastes no morsel. Every coffin a banquet. Every slab a platter. Now is the time of feasting!

—Invocation of Doresain, King of Ghouls

Lacedon Ghoul.name: 食尸水鬼
Lacedon Ghoul.text: 食尸水鬼皮肤松弛，是一种水生的食尸鬼。它们通常源自贪婪的海盗、在荒岛上饿死者、或者在水中溺亡的恶人。

Gibbering Mouther.name: 呓语之口
Gibbering Mouther.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.M7Ffsj978ytSqlFb caption=false classes="right three lift-1"]

Ravenous Chorus of Unreality

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: None

Gibbering mouthers endlessly feed on and regrow their own amoeboid bodies—amorphous heaps roiling with eyes, teeth, and strange organs. These mind-bending terrors sing and scream, laugh and cry with a cacophony of voices ranging from disturbingly unnatural to shockingly familiar. They exist only to feed and to unleash their disdain for reality, their many maws dripping with otherworldly spittle.

Alas, the Elder Elves made a fatal mistake. When the Dragon’s Tear comet next returned, the Vast Gate—still keyed to the Far Realm of alien entities—linked to the comet and opened again. And what emerged, ululating profanities, sang unnameable hungers into an unguarded world.

—From The Book of the Gate,
found near Firestorm Peak

Gibbering mouthers come into being in various unpleasant ways. Roll on or choose a result from the Gibbering Mouther Nascencies table to inspire what brought one of these horrors into being.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGibberingMouth rollable classes="caption-top"]

Githyanki.name: 吉斯洋基人
Githyanki.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.6FTuchI4hNLxsW31 classes="top-frame"]

掠袭星界的侵略者

栖息地： 异界（星光位面）； 宝藏： 武备

吉斯洋基曾是平凡的种族，却在邪恶夺心魔帝国的暴行中被刻入了冲突之本能。这些瘦削的人形生物生有锯齿状双耳，皮肤布满黄色、绿色及棕色的斑点。尽管部分个体选择践行自己的道途，但大多数吉斯洋基人仍未摆脱那永远改变他们命运的夺心魔暴行的影响。

以维拉基斯之名杀戮是至伟的奉献，以巫妖女王之名赴死是最终的虔敬。

—梅尔达夫，吉斯洋基骑士

History of the Gith.name: 吉斯人的历史
History of the Gith.text:
远古时期，一个类人的种族被夺心魔帝国征服。夺心魔通过无尽的恐怖、强制突变与心灵重塑操控此族。最终，一位名为吉斯Gith 的领袖从奴隶中崛起，并率众发动了一场反抗压迫者的起义。后来，那些击溃了夺心魔并粉碎了其庞大帝国的吉斯追随者们被称为吉斯人。

吉斯人的胜利转瞬即逝。当吉斯意欲建立一个朝气蓬勃的新兴帝国时，名为泽锡蒙Zerthimon的领导者向吉斯发起了挑战，他声称吉斯的复仇欲与征服欲是夺心魔植入精神枷锁的体现，这种生物学层面的操纵依旧使族人们陷于奴役之中。此论导致族群分别分裂为吉斯和泽锡蒙的追随者——吉斯洋基人（意为“追随吉斯者”）与吉斯泽莱人（意为“唾弃吉斯者”）并爆发了旷日持久的内战。

在吉斯身陨后，其幕僚维拉基斯Vlaakith篡取了吉斯洋基之大权。巫妖女王维拉基斯对吉斯洋基人的统治一直延续至今。这个不死的暴君迫使她的子民对夺心魔、吉斯泽莱人及一切威胁吉斯洋基霸权之物发起了一场无休止的战争。

Githyanki Warrior.name: 吉斯洋基武者
Githyanki Warrior.text: 吉斯洋基武者运用灵能以增幅其作战能力。

Githyanki Knight.name: 吉斯洋基骑士
Githyanki Knight.text: 吉斯洋基骑士挥舞银刃以猎杀那些利用星界投影Astral Projection 侵入其领地的施法者。这些银刃乃吉斯洋基人的圣物，任何持有此武器的非吉斯洋基个体都将受到骑士们饱含怒火的追杀。

Githyanki Dracomancer.name: 吉斯洋基龙巫
Githyanki Dracomancer.text: 吉斯最后的事迹之一是在吉斯洋基人和龙神提亚马特Tiamat间铸就了联盟。从那以后，龙后的红龙面首，埃菲洛蒙Ephelomon和他的亲族一直是吉斯洋基人的忠实盟友。吉斯洋基龙巫们坚守这一盟誓，并磨练与红龙伟力相辅相成的魔法才能。

Githzerai.name: 吉斯泽莱人
Githzerai.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ZdU0WjGEX34GR03R classes="top-frame"]

求极现实的探险家

栖息地： 异界（混沌海）；宝藏： 奥秘，个体

吉斯泽莱人是枯瘦的人形生物，他们的生理构造与吉斯洋基人完全一致。与此同时，他们与吉斯洋基人共享一段同样的历史——皆遭遇过夺心魔在生理与心灵上的改造（详见“吉斯洋基人”）。吉斯泽莱人深知其民族在肉体与心智上均被前灵吸怪奴役者所操控。他们从未屈从于这种程序式的改造，而是遵循首位领袖泽锡蒙的教导，重塑身心以寻求平静。

吉斯泽莱人通过灵能在多元宇宙的混乱区域中创造宁静隐秘的庇护所。此类堡垒多数漂流于混沌海位面，但吉斯泽莱聚落亦存在于无底深渊、元素混沌与妖精荒野。吉斯泽莱人建立这些封闭的庇护所旨在磨砺其灵能、参悟多元宇宙真谛，并躲避吉斯洋基人与夺心魔。

吾等吉斯泽莱渴求挑战，为使泽锡蒙归来时见证吾辈之完备，故吾等奔赴呼啸混沌海，筑造崭新之家园。

—伊斯·门尼尔-阿格-吉斯，吉斯泽莱领袖

Githzerai Monk.name: 吉斯泽莱武僧
Githzerai Monk.text: 吉斯泽莱武僧通过磨练肉体与灵能天赋来追求对心智的控制。他们可能会离开吉斯泽莱之圣地，以期在多元宇宙的危险极端环境中考验自己。

Githzerai Zerth.name: 吉斯泽莱泽锡修士
Githzerai Zerth.text: 吉斯泽莱泽锡修士奉行由首位领袖泽锡蒙所提出的戒律。他们的灵能控制力协助其保护族人，并使得他们能在存在位面间穿行而无惧吉斯洋基人或夺心魔的追猎。

Githzerai Psion.name: 吉斯泽莱灵能使
Githzerai Psion.text: 这些强而有力的灵能使监管吉斯泽莱圣地、研究晦涩的位面事件，并领导“拉克玛Rrakkma”——即针对夺心魔殖民地的突袭行动，以歼灭灵吸怪并揭露远古吉斯民族被改造的秘密。

Adventures with Gith.name: 与吉斯人相关的冒险
Adventures with Gith.text:
角色们可能会以多种方式卷入涉及吉斯泽莱人与吉斯洋基人的冲突。掷一次吉斯人冲突表，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发这些古老宿敌的相关冒险。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGithConflicts0 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Glabrezu.name: 迷诱魔
Glabrezu.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.BJk75sxTEamE3wpG caption=false classes="top-frame"]

迷乱与诱诈并存的恶魔

栖息地： 异界（无底深渊）； 宝藏： 圣物

迷诱魔是迷乱与诡诈的化身。这些狡猾的恶魔知道最有效的陷阱即是让那些人自作自受。尽管迷诱魔有着巨大的爪子与壮硕的躯体，它们更擅长用奉承与误导迫使受害者孤立自己，伤害他人。

你同伴的生命，还是你在无限的旅途中找到的东西！做出你的选择。

—格尔佐格
无尽阶梯的迷诱魔

在无底深渊，迷诱魔是形单影只的猎手，或是更强大恶魔的狡诈顾问。迷诱魔寻求着通往物质位面的通道，并愿意被魔法使用者召唤。它们渴望为凡人服务，并诱惑他们背叛他们的盟友，沉溺傲慢的幻象之中。一旦魔法使用者犯下不可挽回的罪行，其灵魂必然被判入深渊，迷诱魔就会尽力谋杀它的召唤者。

Gladiator.name: 角斗士
Gladiator.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Hq1z71PBP1wX4ZBF classes="right two lift-50 cradle-frame"]

Competitor and Prizefighter

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Armaments, Individual

Gladiators are professional fighters who pit themselves against one another, monsters, and other challenges to entertain audiences. While some compete merely to survive, others love the thrill of performing—and all gladiators know the importance of theatrics in keeping audiences excited. Roll on or choose an option from the Gladiator Theatrics table to inspire the unique flourishes a gladiator uses when competing.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGladiatorTheat rollable classes="caption-top"]

Gnolls.name: 鬣狗人
Gnolls.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.9F9tWwYGKD4XcEQC classes="top-frame"]

拥有野性肉身的邪魔

栖息地：荒漠，森林，草原，丘陵；
宝藏： 武备，个体

第一批鬣狗人诞生于摄食了被深渊侵染的肉体的鬣狗。它们的腐化与暴力取悦了恶魔领主耶诺古，其增加了它们的数量，并在多元宇宙散播它们。从那之后，鬣狗人们成为了耶诺古咯咯叫的仆从，存在即为造成毁灭，享用残羹剩宴。

Gnoll Warrior.name: 鬣狗人武者
Gnoll Warrior.text: 鬣狗人武者渴求着无止境的杀戮，但很快就对它们所杀害的猎物与劫掠的财宝感到厌倦。尽管如此，它们会被别人占有自己的东西的想法激怒，驱使着它们摧毁不能被它们自己所带走的东西。

Gnoll Pack Lord.name: 鬣狗人头目
Gnoll Pack Lord.text: 有着远超其他鬣狗人的恶毒与壮硕体魄的鬣狗人头目叱令着更弱小的鬣狗人为它们效命。这些暴徒驱使其他鬣狗人执行极为暴力的行动，并占有其仆从战利品中最好的那部分。

Gnoll Fang of Yeenoghu.name: 鬣狗人耶诺古之牙
Gnoll Fang of Yeenoghu.text:
耶诺古声称鬣狗人并非他的子嗣，而是故意释放去感染可憎尸体的蛆虫。它们是残暴之兽在凡间散播的恶疾。无论它们曾是什么，它们已然被改造，现在为他所有。

—伊格薇尔伏，《伊格薇尔伏恶魔志》

被恶魔领主耶诺古的恶魔残余所占据的鬣狗人，耶诺古之牙引导鬣狗人军团造成混乱。在途中，这些狂热者们追寻耶诺古的可怕预兆，并努力诠释恶魔领主的邪恶目的。

Gnoll Demoniac.name: 鬣狗人魔头
Gnoll Demoniac.text: 鬣狗人魔头是鬣狗人通过仪式飨食了深渊腐化的肉体后所诞生的狂战士。如今，这些鬣狗人化身耶诺古的滔天饿意投身于战场，全然不顾胜算与自身的安危。这些狂暴的魔头甚至在它们狂乱时吞噬其他的鬣狗人。

Goblins.name: 地精
Goblins.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.cBVzC8bpftooySMS classes="hike-1 top-frame"]

狂野的捣蛋鬼和麻烦精

栖息地： 森林，草原，丘陵，异界（妖精荒野），幽暗地域； 宝藏： 器具，个体

地精是妖精荒野鲁莽和破坏的化身。他们喜欢废墟——声音越大、越闹腾、越复杂越好。地精的袭击通常是他们享受纵情放火和折磨牲畜的机会，而这些则是更具破坏性的阴谋的一部分。

Bree-yark!

—从地精语翻译成通用语大概意思是“嘿，乡巴佬！”

地精会追随那些做出最疯狂的计划的家伙。这些领导者可能是地精袭击的策划者，夸夸其谈的施法者或那些能制造出最大噪音的家伙。大地精和强大的类人生物也能号令暴躁的地精团伙，让他们把破坏力发泄到抢劫、捣乱和战争之中。

神祇马格鲁比耶自封为地精、大地精和熊地精之神。在修罗场的无限战场之中，这位神灵指挥着无数的地精军团。在许久以前，马格鲁比耶特看到了地精们的破坏倾向，并将他们中的一部分从妖精荒野转移到了他位于外层位面的神国。从那时起，这些更具军事头脑的地精大军蓬勃发展，其中一些还找到了通往物质位面的道路。这些恶毒的入侵者会试图播下毁灭的种子，为他们的神灵的征服铺下基石。

Goblin Minion.name: 地精喽啰
Goblin Minion.text: 地精喽啰们热爱参加聪明头儿指定的破坏计划。但一到要遭报复的时候，他们就会迅速溜之大吉。

Goblin Warrior.name: 地精武者
Goblin Warrior.text: 地精武者擅长使坏。那些侍奉马格鲁比耶的地精武者则更有纪律，会在撤退之后再进行伏击。

Goblin Boss.name: 地精老大
Goblin Boss.text: 地精老大往往是最有想象力、最能搞破坏或最有说服力的地精。通过好运气、怂包和冷酷无情，这些头儿通常会牺牲手下来避免自己受伤。

Goblin Hexer.name: 地精咒术师
Goblin Hexer.text: 地精咒术师会使用华丽亮眼并且会引发混乱的魔法。许多地精咒术师都喜欢装模作样，他们的穿着和行为都是对大法师的夸张模仿。

Gold Dragons.name: 金龙
Gold Dragons.text:
希望与威严之龙

栖息地： 森林，草原； 宝藏：奥秘

金龙致力于让世界变得更加美好。它们是金属龙族中最为强大的一支，这些威严巨龙守护良善，并将命运引领至光明之道。尽管金龙心地善良，但在必要之时它们亦会加入战斗，以绚烂火炎与削弱魔法来击溃敌人。

金龙偏爱草原与原始森林，常栖于大自然鬼斧神工造就的奇景附近；它们亦可能卫戍着古代文明的遗迹。金龙的巢穴中囤积着钱币与宝石，但它们亦常常将这些财物投入更大的目标中；金龙将金钱用于购入珍贵典籍，雇佣线人，以及资助志向远大的冒险者。

Gold Dragon Wyrmling.name: 金龙雏龙
Gold Dragon Wyrmling.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.JpOiZRf5LRO7FVoD caption=false classes="right two lift-1"]

Gold dragon wyrmlings learn much from their elders, then head off to save the world. Idealistic and curious, these wyrmlings seek to right obvious wrongs and make friends among those they aid.

Young Gold Dragon.name: 青年金龙
Young Gold Dragon.text: 青年金龙已然认清这世上真正的邪恶，并对其发动圣战。青年金龙解决问题的手段通常直接且大胆。

Adult Gold Dragon.name: 成年金龙
Adult Gold Dragon.text:
成年金龙的行动往往十分微妙——它们经常化形为看似无害的动物出面，或是制作出一套可供其扮演的身份，用以像普通人一样融入社会。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.k5I9PDgI0UIf2Zea classes="hike-1 right-corner-frame"]

Ancient Gold Dragon.name: 远古金龙
Ancient Gold Dragon.text:
远古金龙睿智而神秘。许多道德高尚的团体都会暗中得到金龙的引导与庇护。远古金龙只有在存亡之际才会揭露自身存在，展露古龙之威。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.HqmUYAuOZXW1t5B5 classes="top-frame"]

Gold Dragon Lairs.name: 金龙巢穴
Gold Dragon Lairs.text:
Gold dragons make their homes in places of natural and magical wonder.

The region containing an adult or ancient gold dragon’s lair is altered by its presence, creating the following effects:

Dream Messenger. While in its lair, the dragon can cast Dream, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. When casting the spell this way, the dragon can target any creature within 6 miles.

Foretelling Fog. The area within 1 mile of the lair is Lightly Obscured by opalescent fog. While in that area, creatures can’t be surprised, as the fog swirls into shapes that warn of danger.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Gorgons.name: 石化铁牛
Gorgons.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.SknhhXOeHONmmygD classes="top-frame"]

呼出石化气体的牛形卫士

栖息地： 森林，草原，丘陵； 宝藏： 任意

石化铁牛形似身披铁铠的强壮公牛，是如活物一般的构装体。它们会摧毁所有踏入其领地的生物。除了用致命的牛角顶撞，用铁蹄践踏之外，石化铁牛还能呼出剧毒的气体 。

石化铁牛是施法者创造的卫士。制造石化铁牛的过程劳神费力且危险，其中一种办法需要将公牛的骨架、美杜莎的血和鸡蛇的大脑组装到施了魔法的钢铁框架之中。如果这一过程失败，石化气体会从材料中溢出，产生一种魔法威胁，会充满建筑物内部并经年不散。

在我先祖的零散设计中，有个值得一提的是一头居住在沼泽里的牛怪，附有一条让人不安的笔记：“还可以做得更好”。

—卢姆大师，《金属之心》

当施法者创造石化铁牛时，他们通常会用魔法让其能忽视那些在它们面前提供了特别的秘钥（通常是密码或特别的信号）的人。一旦石化铁牛被设置为守卫一个区域，它就会进攻进入的一切闯入者，直到敌人逃跑或被毁灭。而闯入者如果提供了秘钥，只要仍在它的视线范围内，石化铁牛便会无视其存在。但如果闯入者胆敢离开视线再返回却没有出事秘钥，石化铁牛便会发起进攻。身处石化铁牛领地的时候必须时刻小心，掌握这怪物的具体位置，否则便有可能被原以为已经不再构成威胁的石化铁牛攻击。

创造石化铁牛的人会让秘钥难以发觉。在石化铁牛创造者的记录或石化铁牛保护的区域中，可能会找到关于秘钥的提示——可能是闯入者生命的最后潦草写下的。掷一次石化铁牛秘钥表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发什么样的口令或者信号才能暂时解除石化铁牛的威胁。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGorgonCommandK rollable classes="caption-top"]

Gorgon.name: 石化铁牛
Gorgon.text: 绝大多数石化铁牛都是萦绕着石化气体云雾的钢铁公牛。它们的金属板光泽和颜色各不相同，从闪亮的银白到凹凸不平的漆黑。最古老的那批石化铁牛可能已经浑身覆满铁锈，但这不会影响它们的能力。这些石化铁牛脚下的土地上满是惨遭石化的敌人遗骸。许多石化铁牛比其创造者要多活上数个世纪，这让一些人误以为这些造物有着自然的起源与分布。许多如此古老的石化铁牛都继续遵循着古老的命运，而它们守卫的地点也早已化作废墟。

Brazen Gorgon.name: 焚化铜牛
Brazen Gorgon.text: 被放逐的大魔鬼摩洛克的追随者改变了石化铁牛的创造过程，造出了他们自己的邪恶卫士，叫做“焚化铜牛”。这些铜牛是身体中空、如牛一般的自动机械，金属身体散发着可怖的热量。当它们向敌人发起冲锋时，其肋骨会像笼子一样打开，将敌人缚住并在里面将其活活烤死。焚化铜牛常常出现在供奉摩洛克、其他大魔鬼或嗜血神灵的亵渎圣所。

Goristro.name: 巨牛魔
Goristro.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.VewVzKD94zJVlY3V caption=false classes="top-frame"]

浩劫之恶魔

栖息地： 异界（无底深渊）；宝藏： 武备

虽权谋如织，诡计似网，然骄矜难御终焉之威。纵使胜汝百倍者，亦曾陨落于深渊狂澜之中。

—深狱炼魔梅拉戈罗斯，
《诡道与兵策》

巨牛魔是有着骇人的体型与无以伦比的力量的恶魔巨物，足以毁灭一座城市。这些恶魔是无意义的混沌与破坏的虚无主义的化身，并更倾向于攻击与它们体型相当的生物或是建筑物。城堡、高塔、巨人或是战争之兽都是这些怪物发泄愤怒的常见目标。

巨牛魔就像是驼背的原始的牛头人，身上带着深渊战争的伤疤与战争机器造成的伤口。它们的外表正是它们创造者、许多邪恶牛头人所信奉的恶魔领主——巴弗灭的体现。巨牛魔在巴弗灭那被称为无尽迷宫的深渊领域游荡，并消灭这个巨大魔法迷宫中所遇到的一切非恶魔生物。

Gray Oozes.name: 灰泥怪
Gray Oozes.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.jcTrY9MC02LsVkII caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Hungry Slimes and Magical Failures

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: None

Gray oozes are predatory, corrosive slimes that blend in with stony surroundings.

Gray Ooze.name: 灰泥怪
Gray Ooze.text: 一片区域内要是出现了灰泥怪，其原因往往都是因为这里有失控的魔法。那些魔法使们将元素精魂绑在构装生物躯体上的试验要是失败了，也有可能因此而意外创造出灰泥怪。

Psychic Gray Ooze.name: 心能灰泥怪
Psychic Gray Ooze.text: 心能灰泥怪获得了暴力的灵能能力。尝试召唤或创造一些与土元素位面Elemental Plane of Earth相关联的生物（例如石像鬼Gargoyle或人工生命体Homunculus）时失败就可能会诞生这种泥怪。

Green Dragons.name: 绿龙
Green Dragons.text:
欺诈与嘲弄之龙

栖息地： 森林； 宝藏： 奥秘

禁林深处，绿龙向世界播撒着邪恶，用低语操控着凡人。它们是色彩龙族中阴险、狡诈、又自负的一支，亦会颇具耐心地蚕食短生种的恐惧，令其腐化堕落、孤身无援。绿龙能在迷宫般的荒野之中潜伏数百年而不暴露自身的存在；即使是它们手下最忠实的追随者，往往也只能见到林间之音或梦中低语。

尽管绿龙的身体素质很强大，但它们大多鄙夷使用暴力，视战斗为其仆人们的职责——绿龙本身则更倾向于将敌人诈骗进危险或持续性的剥削之中。绿龙会收集那些体现其操纵之网的“玩物”充当装饰以及勒索工具，例如有失体面的文件、传家的珍宝、以及寄托情思的宝物。

Green Dragon Wyrmling.name: 绿龙雏龙
Green Dragon Wyrmling.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Yk8Rm9uHMLrBw70O caption=false classes="right two lift-1"]

Green dragon wyrmlings often serve as pawns in older dragons’ schemes. By spying on those dragons’ agents, wyrmlings learn the art of manipulation. Once they’ve accumulated influence and lackeys, these wyrmlings depart to claim their own territories and pursue their sinister ambitions.

Young Green Dragon.name: 青年绿龙
Young Green Dragon.text: 青年绿龙常常控制成群的伊特怪、狗头人、盗贼，以及其它怯懦的仆从。绿龙这样做的目的是为了避开能摧毁它们的其它恶龙。不过，渐渐的，绿龙也会对这种压迫弱小生物、积累毫无意义的财富的日子感到厌倦——它们要以更具野心的方式释放自己的欲念。

Adult Green Dragon.name: 成年绿龙
Adult Green Dragon.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.PkYqOitn88M2ERBK classes="right two lift-1 cradle-frame"]

The words of adult green dragons are as deadly as their poisonous breath. They are brilliant schemers that pride themselves on influencing communities near their lairs. They obsess over information and create vast spy networks. Many of these dragons seek magical methods of surveillance or domination, and they manipulate adventurers into hunting down lost magic to aid in such control.

Ancient Green Dragon.name: 远古绿龙
Ancient Green Dragon.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.P67q7POtIoEv6opP classes="right three clear-both top-frame"]

Ancient green dragons are creatures of legend, rarely seen by their servants or foes. Via magic and well-hidden agents, these dragons stoke suspicion between allies and undermine noble works. As bonds fray, the dragons reap rewards of greater wealth and control. Eventually the ambitions of ancient green dragons stretch beyond their territories as they seek control over empires, planar realms, or death itself.

Green Dragon Lairs.name: 绿龙巢穴
Green Dragon Lairs.text:
Green dragons lair in ancient forests, often shaping stands of massive trees into compounds of interwoven branches, hollow trunks, and caverns amid mighty roots. They might also dwell amid forested ruins, particularly the former homes of those they’ve conquered.

The region containing an adult or ancient green dragon’s lair is warped by its presence, creating the following effects:

Beast Spies. Tiny Beasts magically gain the ability to understand Draconic and can communicate telepathically with the dragon while within 1 mile of the lair.

Poisonous Thicket. Ordinary plants growing within 1 mile of the lair poison the air around them. Whenever a creature other than the dragon or its allies finishes a Long Rest in that area, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the Poisoned condition for 1 hour.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Green Hag.name: 绿鬼婆
Green Hag.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.8DfpeUPUZSWd5u2n caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Foul Witch of the Wicked Wild

Habitat: Forest, Hill, Swamp; Treasure: Arcana

Green hags work bitter magic to foul all that is beautiful and pure. Whether alone or in covens of other hags, these ancient witches call on eerie forces, spreading corruption and plotting doom for those who earn their ire. Green hags are adept deceivers, and they use illusions to cloak themselves in unassuming forms, hoping to tempt innocents into peril. These hags often spirit their victims back to surreal lairs where they hold captives prisoner or cook them into monstrous meals.

Green hags frequently know strange magic or forgotten secrets, such as the weaknesses of villains, the locations of lost treasures, or the ways to break curses. They might trade such knowledge for rare magic or symbolic treasures. Roll on or choose a result from the Green Hag Bargains table to inspire what a green hag charges for its secrets.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGreenHagBargai rollable classes="caption-top"]

Grell.name: 触须怪
Grell.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.4jMVLMK26xpO31uY caption=false classes="right three lift-50"]

Bizarre Hunter That Travels between Worlds

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: None

For meal, my hunger grinds within my teeth. For might, my hunger clenches in my grip. But for what we’re told we mustn’t know, my hunger snaps a raptor’s beak and makes my mind a muscle that knows only how to chew.

—Evard, Eighth Eye of the Necrophilosopher

With barbed tentacles sprouting from their brain-shaped bodies, grells hunt the lightless depths. These silent predators defy gravity, allowing them to strike from unexpected places, and they perceive their surroundings via sound and electrical fields. Their tentacles secrete paralytic venom, which prevents most creatures ambushed by grells from crying out before being dragged into the dark and consumed.

Grells are sapient beings, but their intellects and motivations are alien to most. They typically cooperate with one another only to defeat more powerful prey. Most demonstrate no interest in creating things or in communicating with other creatures, including their own kind.

Many grells pursue methods of traveling between worlds and planes of existence. They sometimes slip onto star-faring vessels or enter portals heedless of their destination. Roll on or choose a result from the Grell Explorations table to inspire why grells seek passage between realms.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGrellExplorati rollable classes="caption-top"]

Gricks.name: 穴居攫怪
Gricks.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Fz71hbnYzqOAHd22 caption=false classes="right three lift-1 top-frame"]

Worms That Hunt the Dark and Decaying

Habitat: Forest, Underdark; Treasure: Any

Gricks are wormlike predators that burst from hiding—flailing and snapping—to consume whatever prey passes near. They hide in cavernous crags or amid deadfalls, the scattered bones and possessions of past meals the only evidence of their threat.

Gricks’ origins are unclear, but some suggest these creatures arise from natural worms or similar invertebrates mutated by magical phenomena. Many cite the presence of gricks in a region as evidence of portals to other planes of existence, legendary magic items, or powerful supernatural beings.

Grick.name: 穴居攫怪
Grick.text: 穴居攫怪往往是独行的猎手，但幼年的穴居攫怪也可能会潜伏在数十个同族伙伴周围数年之久，直到它们逐渐离群索居。

Grick Ancient.name: 远古穴居攫怪
Grick Ancient.text: 穴居攫怪可以存活数个世纪，最古老的穴居攫怪可以生长到令人恐怖的体型。比起埋伏等待，远古穴居攫怪会更积极地进行狩猎，而且它们会毫无顾虑地吞食较小的穴居攫怪。

Griffon.name: 狮鹫
Griffon.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.mVdCUAMif2D5B3cg caption=false classes="top-frame"]

陆空两栖的威武猎手

栖息地： 寒带，海岸，草原，丘陵，山地；宝藏：无

人们认为我们在城市高空飞行是为了避开风向标或是晾衣绳之类的玩意儿。而事实上，假如狮鹫闻到下面有多少马肉在晃荡，比法师乱飞和蚊蝇更糟的事就要发生了！

—希尔达·冬行者，深水城狮鹫骑兵团退休成员

狮鹫结合了猛禽和大型猫科生物的特征（通常是鹰和狮），并兼具二者的精准与凶猛。一些稀有品种的狮鹫同时具有秃鹫和豹子的特征，还有一些品种则是猎鹰和老虎的结合。无论外表如何，狮鹫通常与皇室相关，被称为万兽之王。

狮鹫身上有着无数的故事，掷一次狮鹫故事表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发关于狮鹫的故事。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGriffonTales00 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Grimlock.name: 幽邃盲族
Grimlock.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.bkC7tgM45mg6wLs1 caption=false classes="top-frame hike-1"]

夺心魔威胁所创造的提线木偶

栖息地： 幽暗地域； 宝藏： 任意

我们还以为，我们发现了一支居住在远超已知深度的地底新种族。结果事实远比那糟糕。

—阿加耶拉，幽暗地域先知

幽邃盲族是夺心魔们的生物实验的受害者。灵吸怪会猎捕类人生物，将他们暴露于某种怪异的幽暗地域辐射之中，然后再向他们脑内植入指令，从而创造出幽邃盲族。创造幽邃盲族的过程会撕裂生物的意识，令该个体完全丧失曾经的个性。

幽邃盲族原先是眼睛位置现在只有一道浅浅的凹痕，但幽邃盲族能使用第六感来感知它们周围的环境。在转变为幽邃盲族时产生的灵能力量会萦绕于其体内，而且他们会在攻击时运用上这些可怕的力量。

掷一次幽邃盲族任务表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发幽邃盲族如何侍奉灵吸怪。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGrimlockTasks0 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Guardian Naga.name: 守秘纳迦
Guardian Naga.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.OdUyEG4M0NP94MtH caption=false classes="top-frame"]

亘古长存的护识蛇灵

栖息地： 荒漠，森林，异界（上层位面）；
宝藏： 圣物

守秘纳迦是不朽的蛇形学者，享有着完美的记忆力。它们收集着来自与其一同生活的族群的历史与秘闻，并看护着不同文化的故事再将其准确无误地传递给新生代的后裔们。一些比共生文明更为长存的守秘纳迦仍在残垣断壁之间徘徊，铭记着已逝文明的故事，让其亡佚的子民在传承中延续下去。

掷一次守秘纳迦秘闻表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发该纳迦的所见所闻。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmGuardianNagaLo rollable classes="caption-top"]

Guards.name: 警卫
Guards.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.wPwb0rLQD1MmML3O caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Sentries and Watch Members

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Armaments, Individual

To distinguish between Waterdeep’s different groups of guardians, keep this handy mnemonic in mind: the Guard guards the walls while the Watch watches all.

—Volothamp Geddarm, legendary explorer

Guards protect people, places, and things, either for pay or from a sense of duty. They might perform their duties vigilantly or distractedly. Some raise alarms at the first sign of danger and defend their charges with their lives. Others flee outright if their compensation doesn’t match the danger they face.

Guard.name: 警卫
Guard.text: 警卫们有着优秀的察觉力，但基本没受过什么武术训练。它们可能是保镖、岗哨、城市卫队成员，以及其他目光敏锐的武者。

Guard Captain.name: 警卫队长
Guard Captain.text: 警卫队长经验丰富。它们可能是小有成就的保镖、魔法宝藏的守护者、卫队中的老兵，或是其他类似的看守者。

Half-Dragon.name: 半龙
Half-Dragon.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.eBjVosgmMmjCuPVO caption=false classes="hike-3 top-frame"]

巨龙打造的武者

栖息地： 任意； 宝藏： 武备

天底下难道有比提亚马特亲赐之血更伟大的赐福吗？

—龙躯领主阿扎·库尔，半龙

半龙诞生自与巨龙之精粹密切相连的魔法仪式，依其创造者的意志及自身的龙族本性行事。半龙大多是由那些希望拥有继承了自己的伟力与威严的侍从的色彩龙所创作。半龙们常常作为凶恶巨龙手下的指挥官，指挥着巨龙的其余手下；亦可能会作为代理人前往那些半龙背后的巨龙主子不方便亲自前往的地方。

半龙有着与其巨龙创造者一致的性格特质，并遵从其创造者的规划。源自色彩龙的半龙通常憎恶着其创造者，哪怕二者有着共同的目标也依旧如此。继承了金属龙特质的半龙极其稀有——他们通常诞生自某些魔法性的事故、源于莽撞的魔法使捅出的篓子、甚至是巨龙于垂死之际所做出的最终之举。

Harpy.name: 鸟妖
Harpy.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.8X24P3Ri9RNtvb1i caption=false classes="top-frame"]

羽翼与毁灭之歌

栖息地： 海岸、森林、丘陵、山脉；宝藏：任意

鸟妖是一种充满憎恨的生物，他们创造痛苦，终结爱情，以及生命。这些怪兽有着人类的特征、可怖的禽爪、与一对食腐鸟类的双翼。鸟妖最著名的便是他们的歌声，那是能让听众不顾危险跟随他们的歌声。被鸟妖的歌声蛊惑的生物往往会死在鸟妖的爪下，或是被歌声引入致命的自然危险之中。

鸟妖会居住在偏僻的、荒凉的地方，那里充满了悲剧与绝望。一些传说称鸟妖是被迫转化为这种形态的，这是众神对他们降下的惩罚。而鸟妖也可能是那些被神罚诅咒的灵魂转世。

每个鸟妖的歌声都截然不同。据说有些鸟妖的歌声过于美妙而令世人失心，有些鸟妖的歌声却如同凄惨的哀嚎——只有一点是相同：他们的歌声能够魔法性的蛊惑他人。

Hell Hound.name: 地狱犬
Hell Hound.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.IzDSms6FDnN47Z9V caption=false classes="top-frame"]

下层位面的无情守卫

栖息地： 山地，异界（下层位面），幽暗地域；宝藏： 无

地狱犬诞生自修罗场、焦炎火狱和九层地狱的深坑，执行着这些国度内的无情律法和暴君的心血来潮。在地狱犬自己的存在位面，这些恐怖的犬类物种会确保那里的灵魂无法逃脱凄惨的死后命运。而在物质位面，地狱犬一般会侍奉于它们残暴的饲主——诸如火焰巨人和邪教徒，它们的凶残、服从性和燃火的特性令其广受青睐。只要给予地狱犬狩猎和杀戮的机会，它们就能将其他生物视作主人，但如果仅仅把它们视作小动物，那地狱犬很快就会背叛它们的饲主。

相比普通的犬类，地狱犬要更加狡猾。它们是经验丰富的追踪者，在集群中合作无间，且善于谋划诡计和设下埋伏。地狱犬十分享受猎物们在其滚烫的血口和灼热的呼吸中发出的尖叫声。它们经常不遗余力，只为激发受害者临终前的恐惧。

Helmed Horror.name: 恐怖铠甲
Helmed Horror.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.zXj85dKuP9bjz75M classes="top-frame"]

肩负武者之职的铠甲

栖息地： 任意；宝藏： 武备

恐怖铠甲是一套由魔法驱动的护甲。这些装甲疙瘩并非没有理性的自动机械，而是拥有士兵般的狡诈以及应对毁灭性魔法的抗性。尽管它们的名字暗示着邪恶的意图，但这些生物会忠诚地为其创造者服务。恐怖铠甲有时也被称为末日守卫或魂灵铠甲。它们大多数没有表现出个性，但也不乏例外。

恐怖铠甲可能会执行各种任务。掷一次恐怖铠甲指令表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发恐怖铠甲执行哪些任务。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmHelmedHorrorDi rollable classes="caption-top"]

Hezrou.name: 狂蟾魔
Hezrou.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.BbwLAgSNlSSlNF6a caption=false classes="right three lift-1 top-frame"]

Demon of Obscenity and Outrage

Habitat: Planar (Abyss); Treasure: Any

Hezrous compose the bulk of many demonic hordes. In croaking, reeking throngs, these ogre-size brutes seek to crush and consume foes. Their oozing hides are manifestations of embodied evils. Every few moments, patches of their slimy skins erupt with grotesque transformations such as rows of mismatched fangs, fungal growths, or half-formed features. These unsettling manifestations emerge, then roil away.

Hezrous serve more powerful demons, such as nalfeshees and mariliths. They take the abuse and intimidation of these deadlier demons and pass it on to droves of weaker dretches and manes. This predictable brutality makes hezrous useful links in the chaotic structure of a demonic horde.

When on the Material Plane or otherwise left to their own devices, hezrous recklessly indulge in destructive, short-sighted rampages. Only magic and threats from more powerful masters can curb these demons’ outrages and compel hezrous to pursue greater plots. Powerful spellcasters often use sinister coercions, spells like Magic Circle and Planar Binding, or other magic to force hezrous to serve them. Roll on or choose a result from the Demonic Undertakings table to inspire how a magic-user might employ a hezrou or similar demon.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmDemonicUnderta rollable classes="caption-top"]

Hill Giant.name: 山丘巨人
Hill Giant.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.wvHJQthwTn6jqh3U caption=false classes="top-frame"]

岩崖与山谷之巨人

栖息地： 丘陵；宝藏： 武备

山丘巨人生活在崎岖的悬崖和高地之间，它们的体型是普通人类的三倍。山丘巨人的皮肤和毛发呈现出多种不同的色调，色调通常与它们居住地附近的泥土和苔藓颜色相似。

栖居于隐秘的山谷、原始的瀑布和猎物丰富的山坡之间，山丘巨人通常依靠大自然的馈赠来满足它们的日常需求。山丘巨人会自己制作荒野无法提供的生活用品，它们会用石头、木头和兽皮打造衣物、工具和武器。当遇到陌生人时，山丘巨人可能会对领地产生戒备和保护心理，但如果旅行者愿意取悦它们，有些山丘巨人可能会愿意分享它们的丰饶之物。

自然灾难、外敌入侵或资源匮乏可能会迫使山丘巨人离开家园，进入他人的领地。一些流离失所的山丘巨人可能会偷窃所需之物，或通过摧毁弱小生物的家园来报复他们的损失。另一些则可能以劫掠为生，或为其他巨人效力以换取庇护。

Hippogriff.name: 骏鹰
Hippogriff.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.8XzNCeqbp59D4AYx caption=false classes="hike-3 corner-frame"]

环游世界的猎人和骏马

栖息地： 草原，丘陵，山地；宝藏： 无

半是猎鸟半是马，骏鹰就是这样一种威风的生物。它们以独行的旅行者和牲畜为目标，在迁徙途中伺机狩猎。骏鹰可能会在旅途中载着骑手以换取食物或是其他帮助。

骏鹰的迁徙持续数月乃至数年，而贤者常常会预测它们的路线，掷一次骏鹰目的地表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发骏鹰可能前往的目的地。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmHippogriffDest rollable classes="caption-top"]

Hobgoblins.name: 大地精
Hobgoblins.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.AP8pgbTtMxik7btZ classes="hike-1 top-frame"]

万世万界之征辟者

栖息地： 荒漠，森林，草原，丘陵，山地，异界（修罗场），幽暗地域； 宝藏： 武备，个体

大地精们体现了对于发展与扩张的原始欲望，并会通过使世界屈从于自己心血来潮的幻想的方式来表达这种欲望。大地精人数稀少时，它们将林地宣称为领土并会去洗劫那些人迹罕至之地。大地精结群成队时，便会形成等级森严的军事化社会，专注于开疆扩土，将所至之处洗劫一空以满足它们的扩张狂热。

大地精们降服了许多动物，怪物以及一些具有破坏力的妖精——特别是地精与熊地精——以为其计划服务。大地精们也会和巨龙、军阀、好战神明的奴仆，以及其他强大的生物结盟以确保对新领土的控制。当大地精们令整片大地俯首称臣之后，它们仍然会踏上新的征途，远涉海洋，深入幽暗地域，或者前往存在位面与星辰大海之外的世界。

许多大地精侍奉着与他们一样渴求着征服的残暴神明马格鲁比耶Maglubiyet。马格鲁比耶的大地精追随者们在能够永无止境地满足它们的征服欲望之地，修罗场的无尽战场中发展壮大。这些痴迷于战争的大地精使用着他们在物质位面各个世界中所施展过的详尽战术以及各种怪异武器。

Hobgoblin Warrior.name: 大地精武者
Hobgoblin Warrior.text: 对征服与掠夺的欲望是大地精超自然本性的一部分，尽管少数大地精可能会压抑自己的好战倾向或者将这种倾向引导向更有用的目的。掷一次大地精战略表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发关于某个大地精如何执行自己的征服计划。

Hobgoblin Captain.name: 大地精长官
Hobgoblin Captain.text: 大地精长官是战场的谋略家。它们通过使用军事技艺并利用命令与威胁而将其他人动员起来的方式，领导它们的盟友夺取胜利。大地精长官们通常管理着大地精战团以及较弱怪物们所组成的帮派。

Hobgoblin Warlord.name: 大地精军阀
Hobgoblin Warlord.text: 大地精军阀领导着大地精军队及其盟友，运用自身经验以及战术头脑在战争的大潮之中运筹帷幄。

Hobgoblin Warfare.name: 大地精武者
Hobgoblin Warfare.text:
大地精武者有时会独自进行狩猎与袭击，有时也会与驯化的獒犬、骑蛛、地精帮派，或者其他盟友一同行动。它们采取直截了当的战术策略，并会尽可能地利用盟友所提供的每一处优势。为了取得胜利，它们愿意牺牲自己的同伴。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmHobgoblinStrat rollable classes="caption-top"]

Homunculus.name: 人工生命体
Homunculus.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Dh5TD59HWKHiQWGG classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Winged Servant Given Magical Life

Habitat: Any; Treasure: None

A mage can create a cat-sized, obedient assistant called a homunculus through a ritual that uses the mage’s blood. Each homunculus shares a telepathic bond with the mage who created it and loyally serves its creator. A homunculus is reduced to inert material if its creator dies.

A homunculus’s appearance reflects its creator’s tastes. Roll on or choose a result from the Homunculus Features table to inspire a homunculus’s form.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmHomunculusFeat rollable classes="caption-top"]

Hook Horror.name: 恐爪怪
Hook Horror.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.GH7lXzeMMod10Gwt caption=false classes="hike-1"]

栖息地： 幽暗地域； 宝藏： 无

恐爪怪是一种具有喙状器官的掠食者，它们的前肢末端生有巨大的钩状利爪。这些生物在幽暗地域的洞穴迷宫之中繁衍生息，在深达数英里的沟壑和悬于空虚黑暗之上的钟乳石林中，它们肆意穿梭于洞穴之间，飞荡在穹顶之上。

恐爪怪是机会主义的猎手，它们以植物、真菌，以及任何距离近到足以被它们钩住的生物为食。恐爪怪会制造各类声响来制造回声，如敲击岩壁和自己的躯壳，或是怪异的鸣叫、尖啸或滴答声，以此帮助它们其辨识周围的环境。只有恐爪怪自己才知道这些声响的涵义，但许多幽暗地域的探索者与许多深邃洞穴周遭的住民则为了探寻声响的源头而沦为了饥饿恐爪怪的美餐。

Horned Devil.name: 角魔
Horned Devil.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.h1fv9OlETvhQuHBI caption=false classes="right two lift-50 cradle-frame"]

Devil of Hatred and Subjugation

Habitat: Planar (Nine Hells); Treasure: Relics

Horned devils, also known as cornugons or malebranche, are infernal warriors that exact the will of diabolical generals and lead other devils in battle. Their bodies and weapons are forged in the Nine Hells, and they torment their foes with diabolical flames and pernicious wounds.

Hydra.name: 多头蛇
Hydra.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.kKUnGfpBOCyQzK7X caption=false classes="top-frame"]

传说中的多头巨蛇

栖息地： 海岸，沼泽；宝藏： 任意

多头蛇是传说中的英雄杀手，有着凶恶的蛇头和臭名昭著的再生力。它们永不餍足，会吞噬任何捕到的生物。捕尽猎物的多头蛇将陷入漫长的休眠期，直至新的猎物到来。

绝大多数多头蛇长着五个头，不过成熟或历战的多头蛇可能有更多的脑袋。这些年长的多头蛇将成为当地的传奇怪物，常因其与英雄间的鏖战或是其领地里失落的财宝而闻名。

虽然不少多头蛇自立领地，不过邪恶神祇也会用它们来守护宝藏或是魔法场所。掷一次多头蛇巢穴表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发多头蛇为何盘踞在此。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmHydraLairs0000 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Ice Devil.name: 冰魔
Ice Devil.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.etFREmomPMQrNnA5 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 bottom-corner-frame"]

Devil of Antipathy and Intellectual Arrogance

Habitat: Planar (Nine Hells); Treasure: Arcana

Part of the charm of ice devils is that they always think they’re smarter than you. Mmm—there are few pleasures sweeter than proving a devil wrong.

—Tasha

Heartless strategists of the Nine Hells, ice devils—also known as gelugons—forsake emotion to indulge in their own malicious interpretations of logic. For them, the multiverse is a puzzle that must be solved to benefit them, their masters, and the Nine Hells.

Ice devils act maliciously, disguising their whims as reason and strategy. In the service of evil masters, these insectile devils patiently plot the movements of infernal armies and scheme ways to fulfill wicked goals. They might also serve as guardians, owing to their martial prowess and ability to reshape battlefields with walls of ice.

When indulging their own schemes, ice devils tempt mortals to forsake empathy and social connections to embrace selfish, destructive visions of intellectualism. After isolating victims, these devils drain them of their secrets or send them forth to spread fractious dogmas cloaked as reason.

Ice devils usually lurk in frozen realms, particularly the frigid layer of Cania in the Nine Hells.

Imp.name: 小魔鬼
Imp.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.gjT00IJgxZwU6WwQ caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Devil of Pettiness and Suspicion

Habitat: Any; Treasure: None

I can tell you what I know, but wouldn’t you rather I tell you what’ll let you do what you know you’re going to do anyway?

—Skeever, imp servant of Firan Zal’Honan

Known for their cowardice and toadying, imps serve devils and wicked magic-users. Their abilities to shape-shift and pass unseen make them skillful spies and adept at fleeing danger. Imps sent to surveil other creatures relate what they discover to their masters, but they frequently omit important details or cast events in the worst possible light to mislead their masters into following the imps’ devilish council.

Imps without masters delight in manipulating other creatures and inflating their own egos. They might take over bands of weaker monsters, or they might pose as helpful spirits and trick influential individuals into pursuing nefarious ends.

Incubus.name: 梦魔
Incubus.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.QucOIE4hZnfQFxle caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Life-Leeching Dream Stalker

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Urban; Treasure: Any

Incubi exploit the vulnerability of mortal dreams. Slipping into the homes of sleepers, incubi feed off dreams and replace them with terrifying nightmares. Incubi visit victims nightly until their prey expires. The incubi then hunt for new victims, preferring the loved ones of past targets.

Incubi can transform into succubi and vice versa, taking the forms they need to manipulate foes in dreams or in the flesh.

Those visited by an incubus have recurring nightmares. Roll on or choose a result from the Incubus Nightmares table to inspire these night terrors.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmIncubusNightma rollable classes="caption-top"]

Intellect Devourer.name: 噬脑怪
Intellect Devourer.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ZfVZL4T9y6LE6w45 caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Brain-Eating Body Thief

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: None

Intellect devourers serve their mind flayer creators by consuming other creatures’ brains and puppetizing the mindless bodies. These quadrupedal brains seek to ambush sapient beings, then drain their thoughts until they’re mindless. Then, if their victims are Humanoids, they enter the creatures’ skulls. With access to the victims’ knowledge and control of their bodies, intellect devourers use their perfect disguises to pass as the people they’ve replaced and further mind flayer plots.

I know Durgan, and that wasn’t Durgan. It was like something was wearing Durgan … like some sort of suit … a Durgan suit.

—Johana Grethe,
Account of the Stormport Shock

Invisible Stalker.name: 隐形追猎者
Invisible Stalker.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.CpRimnt6lf9Us3S5 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Unseen Magical Assassin

Habitat: Urban; Treasure: None

Magic and malice give form to invisible stalkers, bodiless spirits of the air. These elusive beings pass unseen with nothing more than a stirring of air. They control powerful winds capable of moving objects and battering foes. Magic-users conjure these creatures to serve as killers and thieves. Invisible stalkers relentlessly pursue their quarry, and they rarely leave evidence of their crimes.

As detectives, we seek truth by eliminating the impossible, ever mindful that the impossible might also be seeking to eliminate us.

—The Casebook of Alanik Ray

In rare cases, an invisible stalker lingers in the world without a spellcaster controlling it. Roll on or choose a result from the Uncontrolled Invisible Stalkers table to inspire why one of these monsters lurks in an area without a direct command.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmUncontrolledIn rollable classes="caption-top"]

Iron Golem.name: 铁魔像
Iron Golem.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.e5Da0H8o4dNIsmWM caption=false classes="right two lift-50 cradle-frame"]

Guardian of That Which Must Endure

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Any

Their magical cores protected by mighty armor, iron golems defend important sites and objects. These golems are forged in bipedal forms, the details of which are decided by their creators. Many resemble armored guardians or legendary heroes. Iron golems confront their foes with a combination of overwhelming physical force and eruptions from their magical core. These magical blasts take the form of fiery bolts and poisonous emissions.

Iron golems preserve and protect their charges for generations. Roll on or choose a result from the Iron Golem Orders table to inspire what commands an iron golem follows.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmIronGolemOrder rollable classes="caption-top"]

Jackalwere.name: 化形胡狼
Jackalwere.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.yo03wVukpcXva3iq caption=false classes="right two lift-50 corner-frame"]

Shape-Shifting Trickster of the Wilds

Habitat: Desert, Grassland; Treasure: Implements

Indistinguishable from jackals in their natural form, jackalweres shape-shift to deceive others. These shape-shifters can take three forms: a jackal, a human, or a monstrous hybrid of the two. Jackalweres are easily mistaken for werewolves, but jackalweres aren’t supernaturally afflicted—their jackal forms are their natural state. Jackalweres also possess magical gazes capable of putting foes to sleep, allowing jackalweres to play their tricks unimpeded or get the upper hand over threats.

Jackalweres dwell in inhospitable wildernesses and pride themselves on their cleverness. They take offense at those who travel through their lands without leaving a gift of treasure or fresh game. Roll on or choose a result from the Jackalwere Tricks table to inspire how a jackalwere repays such slights.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmJackalwereTric rollable classes="caption-top"]

Kenku.name: 天狗
Kenku.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.IP56OQKa00P6HHVa caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Flightless, Noise-Mimicking Avian

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Shadowfell), Urban;
Treasure: Implements, Individual

Kenku are birdlike folk who once soared the skies and sang enchanted songs, but a curse stole their wings and transformed their voices. Now kenku slip through the shadows of cities and the Shadowfell, trying to recover what they’ve lost. To some, this means seeking an end to their curse; others search for magic or contraptions to enable them to fly and sing again.

The curse affecting kenku allows them to vocally communicate only by mimicking sounds they’ve heard. Kenku can supernaturally re-create vast varieties of noises, from crying babies to running water and short phrases in others’ voices. Cunning kenku use their mimicry to deceive foes, lure creatures into ambushes, and signal to allies.

Knights.name: 骑士
Knights.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.HFApU8ARS3yXFHop caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Battle Masters and Heroic Wanderers

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Armaments, Individual

Knights are skilled warriors trained for war and tested in battle. Many serve the rulers of a realm, a religion, or an order devoted to a cause.

Knight.name: 骑士
Knight.text: 骑士们在战斗中通常领导着各自麾下的部队，或是结成足以左右局势的战阵。骑士们常有扈从同行，这些扈从们通常是武艺仍待精进的士兵或是平民。

Questing Knight.name: 天命骑士
Questing Knight.text: 天命骑士为完成某一使命而旅行。它们的使命通常是杀死一名恶徒、打败某只怪物、寻回某件神器，或是光复其昔日的荣光。

Kobolds.name: 狗头人
Kobolds.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.FUAFG9Ig3zt7KtIZ caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Tricksters and Servants to Chromatic Dragons

Habitat: Arctic, Coastal, Desert, Forest, Hill, Mountain, Swamp, Underdark, Urban; Treasure: Armaments

Cowardly cousins to chromatic dragons, kobolds serve draconic overlords as warriors and servants. These scrappy menaces mimic the behaviors of their dragon masters. Though their small stature and recklessness make kobolds poor imitators of dragons, what they lack in ferocity they make up for in zeal and ingenuity. They are especially adept at creating traps and setting ambushes.

Kobolds’ scales resemble those of chromatic dragons that live near their warrens. Rarely, kobolds possess features evocative of metallic dragons or other dragon-like creatures.

Kobold Warrior.name: 狗头人武者
Kobold Warrior.text: 狗头人武者使用游击战术袭击敌人并保卫家园。为了避免危险，它们经常布置一些粗糙的陷阱。

Winged Kobold.name: 带翼狗头人
Winged Kobold.text: 一些狗头人生来便拥有翅膀。这些被同类称为厄德urds的狗头人通常被认为受到了巨龙或龙后提亚马特的祝福。尽管受到了眷顾，带翼狗头人仍与它们的同族一样怯懦，它们通常利用飞行能力来躲避敌人的攻击。

Kraken.name: 克拉肯
Kraken.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.sOOONFV6pY930RoV caption=false classes="top-frame"]

传说中的巨海兽

栖息地： 水下；宝藏： 任意

克拉肯对凡人世界的事物通常毫无兴趣。这些恐怖海兽由诸神所造，作为战争兵器活跃于被遗忘的上古时代。随着纪元更迭，大多克拉肯都已消失于海潮之下，沉眠着，等待诸神再度将其唤醒。不过现今仍有一些克拉肯在世间活跃着，为其神圣侍主守护着深海之下的宝藏，甚至为侍主守护着整片海洋。而另一些克拉肯却早已遗忘其神圣造主，转而追求其自身的目的——支配海下海上的一切势力。

克拉肯很少在海面上现身，而祂们的出现往往会象征着时代更迭与毁灭的来临。当这些泰坦从沉寂中醒来后，祂们会精确地袭击沿海城市以及海上舰队，祂们的袭击在怒火得以满足之前绝不停止，除非其神圣宗主出面、或是其自我因价值庞大的供奉而得以满足。掷一次克拉肯攻击表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发克拉肯会释放出什么样的毁灭。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmKrakenAttacks0 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Kraken Lairs.name: 克拉肯巢穴
Kraken Lairs.text:
A kraken dreams of casting its tentacles into the heavens and strangling that which birthed it, and when its dream exceeds its reach, it settles for the occasional passing ship.

—Malfeore Serrang, Night of the Kraken Cult

Kraken lairs tend to be sunken temples, eldritch ritual sites, or primeval places of divine power. They might lie deep beneath bodies of fresh or salt water, and they often connect to labyrinths of flooded subterranean tunnels or networks of magical portals.

The region containing a kraken’s lair is twisted by its presence, creating the following effects:

Ocean Tyrant. The kraken exerts its dominance over animals in its domain. All Beasts within 1 mile of the lair have the Charmed condition while in that area.

Sea and Storms. While in its lair, the kraken can cast Control Weather, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

If the kraken dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Kuo-toa.name: 寇涛
Kuo-toa.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.vgnasZK9xLmt0hFy classes="top-frame"]

深海中狂热的鱼形信徒

栖息地： 海岸，幽暗地域；宝藏： 圣物

寇涛鱼人拥有滑腻的类人生物身躯和鼓眼深海鱼类的头颅。它们声称自己曾统治过整个世界，在鱼形神祇的庇佑下建立起横跨陆地与海洋的帝国。寇涛鱼人说不清是何等灾祸终结了它们荣耀煊赫的文明，但精灵、人类、夺心魔和寇涛鱼人神祇成了它们主要的指责对象。从地表世界的陆地与海洋撤退后，寇涛鱼人潜入了海沟洞穴和幽暗地域的深海。在这些隐秘国度里，寇涛鱼人不断酝酿着对一切已失去和遗忘之物的怨恨，密谋为那些可能从未发生过的轻蔑行为复仇。

当尸月升起，饵潮涌来，鼓眼者们便从浪涛下的巢穴中浮起。它们咕哝着腥臭的呓语而来，如同我们在拂晓dawn浪涛中捕鱼那般，在夜晚的海岸垂钓。

——污港镇港务长
塔克·梅拉金

寇涛鱼人憎恨地表和幽暗地域的文明，认为自己是被古老轻蔑与持续阴谋迫害的受害者。它们精心策划各种情节以图重掌霸权，常通过绑架民众来窃取秘密，或向诡异神祇进行可疑献祭。为推进此类阴谋，寇涛鱼人会尝试用渔网或奇特武器活捉生物。幽暗地域的卓尔、矮人和侏儒，以及靠近水下洞穴通道的地表聚落，经常成为寇涛鱼人袭击和其他阴谋的目标。

寇涛鱼人常侍奉堕落的幕后主使，例如底栖魔鱼和克拉肯。这些寇涛鱼人认为强大存在是寇涛鱼人神祇的化身或本体。它们可能暂时与其他邪恶生物结盟，但随着寇涛鱼人领袖解读来自反复无常神祇的预兆，这些盟约也会随时变动。

XEDbrbc4fOsasH55.name: Kuo-toa
XEDbrbc4fOsasH55.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.F8Xi8TJrdthU6mKz caption=false classes="right two clear-both right-cradle-frame"]

Kuo-toa loot ruins and raid communities near their dwellings in the Underdark. Their shields are coated in sticky slime, which they use to disarm their foes, and they employ slimy nets to entrap victims. They usually strive to take their enemies alive and drag captives to their hidden lairs.

Most kuo-toa follow the orders of their more powerful leaders out of a combination of faith and fear. In rare cases, a kuo-toa might abandon its community to live as a hermit or wanderer. Such kuo-toa might know much about the Underdark, but they live in fear of the strange gods they forsook.

Kuo-toa Whip.name: 寇涛驱策者
Kuo-toa Whip.text: 寇涛大祭司的仆人，寇涛驱策者——之所以这么称呼是因为它们扮演了在其他寇涛之中强迫命令实施的角色——驱策着战争部队执行上级的命令。作为它们热情的回报，这些寇涛会被赐予一些微小的魔法能力以及钳状武器，用以征服敌人。在战斗中，驱策者使用暴力的威胁以及低沉的咒骂驱策着其他寇涛。

Kuo-toa Monitor.name: 寇涛监察者
Kuo-toa Monitor.text:
寇涛监察者掌控着较弱小的寇涛们的日常生活，指导它们的工作以及信仰。它们也会训练野兽或怪物——例如甲伏怪Chuuls或巨蟹Giant Crabs——为寇涛服务以及指挥它们进行战斗。大祭司为监察者祈求了力量，使其能够用长鞭引导电流，以控制其走卒，征服其敌人。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.nXzjI9SJmrkDWovI classes="top-frame"]

Kuo-toa Archpriest.name: 寇涛大祭司
Kuo-toa Archpriest.text: 寇涛大祭司通过解读来自它们诡异神明的预兆与信息来领导寇涛社区。它们穿着怪诞的仪式服装，以向它们的神明表示崇敬。大祭司将其信仰引导至法术之中以维持信众。

Kuo-toa Deities.name: 寇涛的诸神
Kuo-toa Deities.text:
寇涛一直试图寻找能够安抚它们那神秘莫测的神明们的办法。然而，很少有寇涛能够确定它们神明的身份，不同寇涛社区之间亦很少取得一致。唯有形似人类的躯体却长着龙虾一般的头颅和螯爪的“海之母”布里博杜普Blibdoolpoolp享受着普遍的信仰。

由于有关寇涛的其他神明样貌资料的缺乏，所以寇涛祭司会为这些神明编造新的躯体，他们用手边随便什么物件来创造神圣的偶像。但无论这些寇涛祭司从信仰，从幻象，从天资非凡之人当中，亦或是从某个诡异的超自然源泉当中吸取力量，总会有某些力量回应它们的祈求。掷两次寇涛神明特征表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发寇涛如何描绘神明。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmKuotoaDeityFea rollable classes="caption-top"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmKuotoaFeatures rollable classes="caption-top"]

Kuo-toa Sanctuaries.name: 寇涛的圣所
Kuo-toa Sanctuaries.text:
它们从别的地方而来，身上带着来自无光深海的一切阴冷与恶臭。没人知道它们所求何物，而在我看来，它们也不知道自己究竟想要什么。

—特洛斯利·加内特格特，侏儒冒险者

寇涛一般会围绕着它们认为对其神明重要的地点组建社区。这些地点可能是某些建筑或者某些洞穴，其中大部分地点的特征是既要充满空气，又要带有水下空间。重要之地在这些地点的选址暗示了寇涛信仰的仪式形式，寇涛神明的要求，又或者是寻求预兆的大祭司一时的想法等等。与寇涛的神明一样，这些地点的特征也因不同社区而异。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmKuotoaRitualSi rollable classes="caption-top"]

Lamia.name: 拉迷亚
Lamia.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.V41ZuvMK0QLQDkFL caption=false classes="top-frame"]

受诅咒的交易者和废墟劫掠者

栖息地： 荒漠； 宝藏： 奥秘

据传说记载，首只拉迷亚是一位野心勃勃的统治者，它曾与恶魔领主格拉兹特达成了邪恶的契约，以换取永恒的权力。而作为代价，这位统治者被变为了一只拉迷亚，一种拥有狮身与诅咒之触的怪物。

拉迷亚要么是那第一只拉迷亚的后裔，要么是曾达成了与之类似的契约。它们常栖身于废墟附近，搜寻着能令其攫取财富和影响力的神秘魔法。拉迷亚会使用魔法幻象和蛊惑手段来诱骗其他生物为它们服务。它们有时还会勾结匪徒绑架旅者，且仅当旅者接受了它们危险的契约后才会将其释放。掷一次拉迷亚契约表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发拉迷亚的渴求之物。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmLamiaPacts0000 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Larvae.name: 幼虫魔
Larvae.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ceRLmbsNPSXbxU1A caption=false classes="top-frame"]

堕魂应许之终

栖息地： 异界（下层位面）； 宝藏：无

堕入下层位面的灵魂常化为幼虫魔。这些幼虫魔是蛆虫般的可憎存在，扭曲面容依稀残存生前轮廓。这些可怜虫近乎无助，竭力躲避下层位面强大住民的注意。诸多邪魔视其为珍馐，而邪恶施法者则用其进行堕落仪式。夜鬼婆Night Hag 常豢养幼虫魔，跨位面贩卖给多元宇宙的奸恶之徒。

若在下层位面存活够久，幼虫魔最终会蜕变为其他低阶邪魔。

Larva.name: 幼虫魔
Larva.text: 幼虫魔的生前记忆破碎而痛苦。多数幼虫魔会拼命避开其他生物。

Swarm of Larvae.name: 幼虫魔集群
Swarm of Larvae.text: 孤虫孱弱，聚则成灾。幼虫魔在绝望驱使下汇作扭曲虫群，翻涌之势如潮，裹挟无声呜咽与蠕虫蠕动之音。

Lemures.name: 劣魔
Lemures.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.4YPiVfChaiBkCa5B caption=false classes="right three lift-50 corner-frame"]

Devils of Agony and Despair

Habitat: Planar (Nine Hells); Treasure: None

The least of all devils, lemures arise from wicked souls, their mortal memories scoured away. Only vague limbs and anguished features jut from these slurries of infernal proto-matter.

Lemure.name: 劣魔
Lemure.text: 劣魔会折磨更弱小的生物，然而在九层地狱之中，比劣魔还弱的生物少之又少。劣魔服从于更强大的魔鬼，以免自己受到更惨烈的折磨。

Swarm of Lemures.name: 劣魔集群
Swarm of Lemures.text: 当其他魔鬼将一大群劣魔驱使到一起，或是劣魔自行聚集成一大团原质时，便会让这群劣魔形成一个统一的思想，并变为劣魔集群。

Lich.name: 巫妖
Lich.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.yXvu5NJgsINWnPtM classes="top-frame"]

不死不灭的魔法主宰

栖息地： 任意；宝藏：奥秘

一些罪恶的魔法使会执行禁忌的死灵仪式，将其灵魂与躯体切离，以此转化为巫妖——死亡的主宰，魔法的宗师。它们将灵魂存放在秘藏起来的圣物中，远程操纵着自己的躯体，以此满足自己摆脱死亡之束缚的野心。

巫妖有着非凡的狡诈与魔法之力，这些亡灵使用其悖逆自然的不朽生命来追求远越凡人一生所能抵达之极限的奥法隐秘。巫妖的邪恶大计令其投身于探索生命之秘、多元宇宙、神性、以及其他不可理解的内容。它们对凡人的生活与欲望漠不关心，不遗余力地投身到推进自己的计划之中。

巫妖的年龄与起源会影响其外貌。古老的巫妖看起来也许不过是一具披着来自被遗忘的帝国风格的腐烂服饰的脆弱枯骨，而更“年轻”的巫妖看起来则更接近活物，穿着现代的服饰。许多巫妖都使用幻术伪装真身，化作标致的凡人之貌。

尽管巫妖不惧死亡，但它们却未必能摆脱漫长时光的蹂躏。一些巫妖会在经年累月之后逐渐失去和凡界的联系，退化为半巫妖Demiliches。

Lich Spirit Jars.name: 巫妖命匣
Lich Spirit Jars.text:
转化成巫妖的过程复杂且危险，而且每个立志成为巫妖者所需的转化过程都不尽相同。一旦仪式成功，巫妖的灵魂就会被束缚在一个命匣之中：这是一种专门为此准备的魔法容器。这件圣物将巫妖的魂灵锚定在世间，如此一来，即使躯体被毁，其灵魂亦能不受影响地存在于命匣之中——只有先摧毁命匣，巫妖才能被彻底杀死。因此，巫妖会竭尽全力隐藏并保护其命匣。

巫妖的命匣通常是对巫妖昔日之生活中意义深刻、精工制作的小型物件。掷一次巫妖命匣表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定一名巫妖会将其灵魂藏在什么东西里。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmLichSpiritJars rollable classes="caption-top"]

Lich Lairs.name: 巫妖巢穴
Lich Lairs.text:
Ambition can become an addiction of the mind and spirit. It builds beyond a driving flame into an insidious inferno that burns a mage hollow until only the desire for more magical power remains.

—Rudolph van Richten,
Van Richten’s Guide to Liches

Liches create secluded libraries of magical lore and arcane laboratories hidden within extraplanar bastions, fortresses with cursed reputations, or other such deadly sanctuaries.

The region containing a lich’s lair is warped by its presence, creating the following effects:

All-Seeing. While in its lair, the lich can cast Clairvoyance, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as its Spellcasting action.

Inevitable Siphon. Whenever a Humanoid dies within 1 mile of the lair, its soul is immediately consumed by the lich. A Humanoid whose soul is consumed in this way can be brought back to life only by a True Resurrection or Wish spell.

If the lich is destroyed or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately. These effects resume if the lich gains a new body (see its Undead Restoration trait).

Lizardfolk.name: 蜥蜴人
Lizardfolk.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.QmY98xs2U9AtWUiy caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Reptilian Defenders of the Land

Habitat: Forest, Swamp; Treasure: Individual

Lizardfolk dwell in wildernesses suffused with primal magic. While many lizardfolk are Humanoids with varied skills, some forge powerful bonds with the Elemental Plane of Earth, granting them magical connections to the cycle of growth and rebirth.

Lizardfolk Geomancer.name: 蜥蜴人地脉术师
Lizardfolk Geomancer.text: 蜥蜴人地脉术师从自然世界中引动魔法，使用这种力量保护其人民与领地。

Lizardfolk Sovereign.name: 蜥蜴人大王
Lizardfolk Sovereign.text: 蜥蜴人大王通过魔法仪式为自身灌注了来自土元素位面的非凡伟力与魔法。不过，对于其中一些蜥蜴人来说，这也让它们觉醒了原初的暴虐性情。

Mages.name: 魔法师
Mages.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.6BnQ9iAnorblkSW8 caption=false classes="top-frame hike-3"]

魔法学士，驾驭法咒

栖息地：任意；宝藏：奥秘，个体

魔法师们是行使魔法，创造奇迹之人，从拥有施法能力的霸主到隐世研学的女巫，都可以被称为魔法师。它们研究玄奥的隐秘，研习怪物、传说、预兆、以及其他学识。魔法师们经常召集盟友或雇佣助手来助其进行研究，或是获得强大的魔法力量。

掷一次魔法师身份表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发这是一名什么类型的魔法师。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmMageRoles00000 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Mage Apprentice.name: 魔法学徒
Mage Apprentice.text: 魔法学徒是技艺不精的施法者。有些魔法学徒是略有成就的魔法师手下的学生，有的则只是天生拥有这种力量。

Mage.name: 魔法师
Mage.text:
你有亲自凝视过‘混沌符文’吗？你有用颤抖的手握着‘亡月法球’、穿过‘吞世之门’、踏过‘俱灭之路’、或是坐在萨扎斯坦的左手边亲眼目睹‘二重烧却秘仪’的现场吗？没有？那你最好别跟我谈法师、也别跟我谈塞尔。

——那瑟尔，塞尔难民

魔法师是技艺精湛的施法者，其生活与魔法密不可分。他们可以使用其力量来守护或支配其他生物，或是专心投入于魔法研究，解析玄奥的隐秘。

Archmage.name: 大法师
Archmage.text: 大法师掌握着难以想象的魔法威能。许多大法师使用其魔法守护世界，而另一些大法师却选择成为暴君，或是追求禁忌的隐秘。大法师大多都有许多魔法仆从，收集魔法物品于秘传学识。

Magmin.name: 火童
Magmin.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.4N1AiNNvlObStTwe caption=false classes="top-frame"]

异常执着的元素纵火家

栖息地： 异界（火元素位面）；
宝藏： 无

火童们认为整个世界只有两种东西：烧着的，和该烧着的。这些半身人大小的生物有着由火焰与岩浆岩组成的身躯，他们享受着纵火的乐趣。他们这么做完全没有恶意，纯粹是出于对原始火焰的热爱。他们不认为物件除了拿来烧还有什么别的存在价值，也不觉得生物会被烈火烧伤。如果你尝试和他们解释这些事，他们只会觉得这些破事难懂并迅速忘掉。而另一方面，他们会抓住一切机会来点燃易燃物体，且特别偏好点燃纸张、木质建筑物、以及各种爆炸物。火童即便死亡也极其危险——被摧毁时，他们会爆炸，这生命最后的火焰也能让周遭的所有可燃之物化为烈火。

火童们也许是被魔法使们召唤而来烦扰其仇敌的，也许是通过传送门或裂隙（目的地为其他领域）逃离火元素位面。他们会被那些有着极高温度的地方吸引，像是火山或是岩浆河之类的地方。如果他们找不到自己喜欢的环境，他们也不会闲在那，而是去点燃建筑物或是引发点野火来取乐。

Manes.name: 原魔
Manes.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.dkwKVGrLXlRTc1p5 caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Demons of Panic and Frenzy

Habitat: Planar (Abyss); Treasure: None

The lowest form of demons, manes appear when truly loathsome souls are condemned to the Abyss. These misshapen demons have distorted features and bodies that crawl with Abyssal parasites. Overwhelmed by demonic urges and constant terror, manes know only shock and frenzied outbursts.

THQIg50PcHdnwG4d.name: Manes
THQIg50PcHdnwG4d.text: Manes lash out at creatures that appear weaker than themselves—or that react to them with fear—and strive to avoid more powerful demons. When manes escape from the Abyss, they go on reckless rampages and inflict as much harm as possible.

Manes Vaporspawn.name: 原魔汽化体
Manes Vaporspawn.text: 汽化体诞生于邪恶的灵魂被难以言喻地折磨或更强大的恶魔碾压粉碎之后。这些扭曲的原魔经历了无尽、痛苦地畸变，并试着与任何它们所遇到地生物分享这份痛楚。

Manticore.name: 蝎尾狮
Manticore.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.CUCgwo3GMjBi1K2h caption=false classes="hike-3"]

有翼的食人狮

栖息地： 寒带，海岸，草原，丘陵，山地；宝藏：任意

蝎尾狮有着狮子的利爪、带皮膜的翅膀和满口的獠牙，它们自天空俯冲突袭，吞噬旅行者。蝎尾狮痴迷人类的滋味，但若没有这道最爱的珍馐，它们也会贪婪的吞噬其他人畜。

蝎尾狮的尾部密布可脱落的钉刺。这些怪物会向猎物发射尾刺，刺穿地面的猎物或是击落空中生物。

尽管蝎尾狮贪婪无度，但它们乐于与将被吞噬的猎物交谈。有时它们还会与猎物达成交易，掷一次蝎尾狮协商表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发蝎尾狮可以提供什么来换取更诱人美食。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmManticoreNegot rollable classes="caption-top"]

Marid.name: 水巨灵
Marid.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.UaQtYrSYHvfDQZkI caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-corner-frame"]

Genie of the Water

Habitat: Coastal, Planar (Elemental Plane of Water), Underwater; Treasure: Relics

Marids surge with the power of the seas, using it to manipulate the waves or create water. These genies typically dwell in or near bodies of water. While gentle marids make homes amid springs, oases, and serene pools, tempestuous marids inhabit sea stacks, whirlpools, and treacherous coasts. Marids vary in appearance, their bodies reflecting the colors of the waves while distinctive fins and scales accent their features. Marids lend their powers and knowledge of the seas to those who defend the marids’ watery realms or who offer them pleasing gifts. Marids appreciate rare aquatic treasures, such as colorful pearls, shell instruments, or delicacies from distant seas.

Marids hail from the Elemental Plane of Water, where they live in wondrous homes drifting amid the endless ocean. Among these is the Citadel of Ten Thousand Pearls—a coral sphere studded with dozens of domed theaters and libraries—and the air-filled, cosmopolitan City of Glass.

Marilith.name: 六臂蛇魔
Marilith.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.z3YN8AzEcB0EUNrC caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Demon of Cruelty and Viciousness

Habitat: Planar (Abyss); Treasure: Armaments

Mariliths are six-armed, serpentlike demons that wield lethal, Abyss-forged blades. With these cursed weapons and experience from countless battles, they lead other demons to slaughter virtuous souls. They often command droves of weaker demons.

Medusa.name: 美杜莎
Medusa.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Yo26oiTbwHGBIw6P caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Snake-Haired Recluse with a Petrifying Gaze

Habitat: Desert; Treasure: Any

With their hair of living snakes and their infamous petrifying gazes, medusas are hubristic creatures that inhabit sites of fallen glory. They often dwell beyond the fringes of civilization or travel in disguise, leaving trails of petrified victims. Some medusas dominate groups of monsters or criminals, controlling them with threats of petrified doom, while others recruit servants that are immune to being petrified, such as gargoyles and gorgons.

Medusas are born or created through preternatural circumstances. Roll on or choose a result from the Medusa Fates table to inspire what led to a medusa’s creation.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmMedusaFates000 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Mephits.name: 魔蝠
Mephits.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.K9VjkR9UC92EmU6i caption=false classes="top-frame"]

恶意肆虐的元素顽徒

栖息地： 异界（元素位面）；宝藏： 无

魔蝠栖息于元素位面，是性情顽劣的恶作剧者。最常见的六种魔蝠形似半身人大小的石像鬼，拥有翅膀、夸张的五官、以及由两种元素交织而成的身躯。它们大多自私自利，沉溺于扭曲的幽默感或膨胀的自负，在自己的家园位面恣意妄为。有些魔蝠则充当巨灵或魔法使用者的信使与间谍。

魔蝠极不情愿离开它们极端元素之力满盈的家园。如若被放逐至物质位面或其他世界，它们便会以恶毒的恶作剧发泄不满，甚至折磨弱小生物取乐。当魔蝠被摧毁时，它们会在一阵元素魔法爆裂中化为乌有。

Dust Mephit.name: 尘魔蝠
Dust Mephit.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.gg4DLE4hm3Yq9k3D caption=false classes="right two lift-50 corner-frame"]

Dust mephits are composed of air and fine earth. They are drawn to forsaken places, and they think everything associated with death is hilarious.

Ice Mephit.name: 冰魔蝠
Ice Mephit.text: 冰魔蝠的身体由寒冷空气和冻结的水组成。它们喜欢冻结物体，并将冰块丢进人们的衣服中。

Magma Mephit.name: 熔岩魔蝠
Magma Mephit.text: 熔岩魔蝠是土与火的融合化身，就如同炽热岩浆。它们喜欢熔化物体，但讨厌火童，一看到火童魔蝠就会发起攻击。

Mud Mephit.name: 泥魔蝠
Mud Mephit.text: 泥魔蝠是土与水的结合体，一种粗鲁恶心的生物。它们会抓住一切机会使用淤泥来毁坏物件、污染食物。

Smoke Mephit.name: 烟魔蝠
Smoke Mephit.text:
我乃塞穆斯桑瑟斯占纳斯，邪魔弑杀者，无双大商贾，死亡贩售者！

—塞穆斯桑瑟斯占纳斯Seamusxanthuszenus
，一只典型的妄自尊大的烟魔蝠

烟魔蝠是一种由炽热余烬和灼热空气组成的形影难辨的存在。它们喜欢误导生物，然后嘲笑它们的轻信之举。

Steam Mephit.name: 蒸汽魔蝠
Steam Mephit.text: 这些傲慢的魔蝠由热量和蒸汽水组成。它们经常欺骗生物帮它们的忙，然后又违背承诺的奖励。

Merfolk.name: 人鱼
Merfolk.text:
