@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.7yiqDKCaLb0OliNn caption=false classes="right two lift-50 corner-frame"]

Protectors and Explorers of the Seas

Habitat: Coastal, Underwater; Treasure: Individual

Beneath the waves dwell merfolk, mysterious creatures that merge the features of humans and sea creatures. Some are curious about land dwellers, while others view them with suspicion.

Merfolk Skirmisher.name: 巡海人鱼
Merfolk Skirmisher.text: 巡海人鱼们保卫着家园，抵御着水生怪物和陆上生物的侵袭。

Merfolk Wavebender.name: 御浪人鱼
Merfolk Wavebender.text: 这些人鱼魔法师利用其驾驭着的魔法获得助力，操控洋流、掌握风暴、甚至是海洋生物来援助自己。

Merrow.name: 梅洛人鱼
Merrow.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.LHAKfsX4Nxmh8v2v caption=false classes="right two lift-50 cradle-frame"]

Ogreish Undersea Abductor

Habitat: Coastal, Underwater; Treasure: Any

Vicious aquatic hunters, merrow combine the features of ogres with those of primeval, predatory fish. They lurk in coastal waters, hoping to snare unsuspecting prey by bursting from the water and grabbing their quarry or by skewering victims with deadly harpoons. These hunters then drag land dwellers back to dismal undersea lairs. Merrow often keep prisoners in their larders as future meals.

Merrow raid coastal settlements and merfolk communities to steal weapons and treasure. This leads to conflicts between merfolk and merrow, but it also provokes misunderstandings with surface dwellers who blame merfolk for merrow attacks.

Sages trace merrows’ origins to aquatic ogres, depraved merfolk, and worse. Such broad theories reveal little about these monsters but overmuch of the dread lurking beyond our certain shores.

—Leomund

Mezzoloth.name: 毒虫罗斯魔
Mezzoloth.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.OizYVYJqFhIJyjJ3 caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Yugoloth of Tenacity and Want

Habitat: Planar (Gehenna); Treasure: Armaments

Mezzoloths are insectile yugoloths that seek power and souls in the service of fiendish lords. These greedy, violent yugoloths are more direct than most of their scheming brethren, but what they lack in guile they make up for in persistence and numbers.

If a mezzoloth’s after ya, just pay it off with whatever’s in your pack. While it’s rooting around looking for a good deal, you hightail it, Chief!

—Morte

Mezzoloths typically form mercenary bands with others of their kind. These forces serve more powerful yugoloths, other fiends, sinister mages, or anyone who provides them with tempting rewards. Mezzoloths obediently adhere to the bargains they strike, potentially serving their patrons for centuries, but once those terms expire, yesterday’s client could become today’s target. Roll on or choose a result from the Mezzoloth Payments table to inspire a mezzoloth’s price for its services.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmMezzolothPayme rollable classes="caption-top"]

Mimic.name: 拟身怪
Mimic.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.qjvx39o6rp1vuu59 caption=false classes="top-frame"]

伪装成不起眼物件的变形异兽

栖息地： 幽暗地域，城市； 宝藏： 任意

拟身怪在平常形态下如同游荡的胃袋，圆鼓鼓的身体上布满异星眼眸和牙齿。它们能够改变颜色、纹理、尺寸，以复制与它们大小相近的静物。拟身怪利用外形作为伪装和诱饵。一旦受害者接近，拟身怪就会发起攻击，用满是粘液的伪足和利齿猛烈攻击。吃掉猎物以后，拟身怪就会换个位置，改变形态，等待下一顿餐食。

使用以下列表作为拟身怪外形的灵感：

祭坛

钟

巨石

大锅

椅子

枝形吊灯

宝箱

婴儿床

门

地垫

巨大宝石

墓碑

落叶堆

酒桶

梯子

讲桌

人体模型

镜子

方尖碑

超大蛋糕

摇杆控制板

骨头堆

盆栽

书山

石棺

雕塑

船舵

标识

石笋

树桩

桌子

挂毯

动物标本

王座

修剪过的植株

武器架

Mind Flayers.name: 夺心魔
Mind Flayers.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Z8RIYO3Rb882rc4U caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Brain-Eating Underdark Tyrants

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Arcana

Scattered survivors of a world-ruining, multiversal empire, mind flayers lurk in secret conclaves hidden deep within Material Plane worlds. Within their alien sanctuaries, these wicked masterminds—also known as illithids—reshape the Underdark and its inhabitants to serve their unfathomable whims. Mind flayers are feared for their psionic powers, which allow them to stun and control other creatures, and for their horrific method of feeding: using their four slimy tentacles to extract the brains of their victims.

Mind flayers are infamous plotters and manipulators, concocting plans that reach beyond their subterranean realms. Aside from using their psionic powers to control others, mind flayers often experiment with their own bizarre life cycles, implanting other creatures with illithid young to create unnatural servants. Creatures such as grimlocks and intellect devourers result from mind flayers’ biological tampering, while other Underdark-dwelling monsters—including kuo-toa, quaggoths, and troglodytes—often serve illithid masters. Githyanki and githzerai have a long adversarial history with mind flayers and bear the scars of illithid manipulation.

Mind Flayer Colonies.name: 夺心魔族群
Mind Flayer Colonies.text:
夺心魔会单独行动，也有夺心魔会组成隐秘的阴谋组织，还有些夺心魔会参与到横跨世界的灵吸怪阴谋集团之中。当集体行动时，夺心魔会在主脑的组织下——一个具有恐怖灵能力量的巨型脑状生物——执行诡异的计划。如果缺少这样一个领导者，夺心魔群体将会陷入自我毁灭倾向的争执中。掷一次夺心魔阴谋表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发灵吸怪集团的阴谋。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmMindFlayerMach rollable classes="caption-top"]

Mind Flayer.name: 夺心魔
Mind Flayer.text: 一只夺心魔对大脑的渴求仅次于其对统治权的渴求，而它会欣然接受任何可以同时满足这两个欲望的计划。

Mind Flayer Arcanist.name: 夺心魔奥术师
Mind Flayer Arcanist.text: 夺心魔奥术师使用魔法加强了它们的灵能能力。其他的夺心魔会厌恶、会恐惧承受了此般实验的异类。

Minotaur of Baphomet.name: 巴弗灭的牛头人
Minotaur of Baphomet.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.lVEnVGdlk0boQ2zR caption=false classes="top-frame"]

兽之恶魔领主的狂战士

栖息地： 幽暗地域； 宝藏： 武具

兽之恶魔领主巴弗灭，声称自己创造了牛头人，并要求它们崇拜自己。尽管大部分牛头人都不受恶魔领主的束缚自由生活着，却还是有一些牛头人选择侍奉这位恶魔领主，而他们被称为“”巴弗灭的牛头人”。比起其他同族，这些野兽与那位庞大、长着角冠的恶魔领主更为相似，它们以这一邪恶不朽者的名义大肆破坏。在很少见的情况下，被施法者或者恶意神祇诅咒的非牛头人生物可能会转变为这类怪物。

巴弗灭的牛头人常常居住在迷宫之中，引领同伴前往隐秘的目的地，并潜伏追踪在入侵者周围。骰一次牛头人迷宫表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发牛头人的居所。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmMinotaurMazes0 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Modrons.name: 魔冢
Modrons.text:
Mechanized Caretakers of Multiversal Law

Habitat: Planar (Mechanus); Treasure: None

Beings of magic and machinery, modrons embody absolute law. These inhabitants of the clockwork plane of Mechanus tend to the incredible mechanisms of their orderly home and oppose chaotic forces across the multiverse.

Modrons are parts of a vast hierarchy, spanning from quirky monodrones to the leader of their kind, the godlike Primus. Every modron carries out tasks assigned to it by higher-ranking modrons, doing so without question. Generally, modrons communicate only with other modrons of their own rank or the ranks immediately above and below them. Those more than one rank away tend to be either too advanced or too simple for them to understand.

The guide swore “beep boop” meant “hello, friend.” I don’t know why they’re after us!

—A planar explorer learning
modrons have no sense of humor

Modrons excel at tasks that require patience and precision, but they have little understanding of nonliteral concepts such as art or humor. They have no egos; they have only their work and the certainty that multiversal law depends on their efficacy.

In rare cases, a modron goes rogue and develops its own will. In these cases, other modrons are sent to recover or destroy their malfunctioning kin.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.WykIOuhgQjo87lN1 caption=false classes="top-frame"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.tYyUvYZLyr5C7u3k caption=false classes="right-corner-frame"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.lNfr64YOHdeqMXn0 caption=false classes="corner-frame"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.4VYbWc8f1lZLMsrT caption=false]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.rteWKEN08dVe23Gz caption=false classes="corner-frame"]

Modron Marches.name: 魔冢行军
Modron Marches.text:
无论是为守序神祇服务或是作为魔冢大行军的一份子，魔冢会从机械境出发，将它们的法理传播至其他存在位面。掷一次魔冢行动表或从中选择一个结果，以此启发是什么样的行动促使一群魔冢踏入其他界域。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmModronOperatio rollable classes="caption-top"]

Modron Monodrone.name: 魔冢·单元冢
Modron Monodrone.text: 作为数量最多的魔冢，单元冢一次只能执行一项简单的任务。它们相信听到的任何没有逻辑上或数学上的错误的事情。当面临突发状况时，它们会迅速地向二元冢寻求帮助。

Modron Duodrone.name: 魔冢·二元冢
Modron Duodrone.text: 二元冢可以同时执行两项任务并通常负责监管单元冢的工作小组。比起单元冢，它们对陌生人的怀疑程度略高一些。

Modron Tridrone.name: 魔冢·三元冢
Modron Tridrone.text: 三元冢监管着低阶魔冢，并在战斗中统领着它们。对于任何非魔冢存在提供的数据，它们都抱有疑心。

Modron Quadrone.name: 魔冢·四元冢
Modron Quadrone.text: 四元冢是最好相处的一类魔冢——也是最容易离群的一类。

Modron Pentadrone.name: 魔冢·五元冢
Modron Pentadrone.text: 五元冢监管并保护着低阶魔冢的先遣队。进行决策时，它们会迅速召集其他魔冢并举行冗长的会议。

Mummies.name: 木乃伊
Mummies.text:
Deathless Ancients with Ageless Ambitions

Habitat: Desert, Swamp; Treasure: Relics

Mysterious rites and mighty faith can tie spirits to their corpses, binding them to their remains for all time. Should their resting places be violated, these beings, known as mummies, reanimate their deteriorating bodies to restore the sanctity of their tombs and punish those who disturbed their rest.

Mummies pursue those who offend them, typically mortals who desecrate their resting places, steal their burial treasures, or defile sites tied to their faith. With undying rage, these ancient corpses go to extreme lengths to avenge themselves and restore what they need to find peace.

Rule 7: Before opening a sarcophagus, light a torch.

—X the Mystic’s Rules of Dungeon Survival

A mummy might look frail, but its body possesses supernatural strength, and its gaze can strike fear in the bravest hearts. Those who escape a mummy’s grasp might find themselves subject to a terrible curse. Victims of a mummy’s curse gradually wither, their bodies rotting away until they’re reduced to dust. This curse can be healed only by the Remove Curse spell or similar magic.

Mummy.name: 木乃伊
Mummy.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.RpLC6YcfXjegqWR0 caption=false classes="right two lift-1 top-frame"]

Common mummies are the remains of priests, nobles, or champions of faith that underwent magical burial rites. Some are preserved through processes using linen wrappings or clay, but others are preserved by peat bogs, ice, magic, or other means.

Roll on or choose a result from the Mummy Resurrections table to determine why a mummy has returned from the dead.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmMummyResurrect rollable classes="caption-top clear-both"]

Mummy Lord.name: 木乃伊领主
Mummy Lord.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.UO8J2nYV0byyjqUF caption=false classes="top-frame"]

总有贪生者不顾一切，哪怕与邪神交易也在所不惜。他们将自己的心脏献祭给了邪恶之力以求战胜死亡，最终他们获得了被诅咒的永生，其思想与灵魂束缚在了一具干枯的尸体之上。这些被称为木乃伊领主的存在就此摆脱了凡性的困扰，得以跨越岁月去追求所望。大多数木乃伊领主都徘徊在昔日统治的古代宫殿或者寺庙的废墟之中。他们的古老信仰和与死亡力量的联系赋予了他们可怕魔法，得以用之传播毁灭，或者复生亡灵仆从。

这张卷轴上记录了一个邪恶仪式，用以复活一位安卡霍特普之子。我想烧了它，但就是没法去点着这张羊皮纸。对不起，不是我不想……而是我无法控制自己去毁掉它。

—伊苏，穆哈城的高阶祭司

大多数木乃伊领主都徘徊在昔日统治的古代宫殿或者寺庙的废墟之中。他们的古老信仰和与死亡力量的联系赋予了他们可怕魔法，得以用之传播毁灭，或者复生亡灵仆从。

木乃伊领主的心脏是其不死契约的凭证。木乃伊领主不会把心脏放在身体里，而是会把心脏摘出并藏匿起来。只要其心脏没有被烧毁，无论遭逢什么劫难，木乃伊领主都可以无限次死而复生。

木乃伊领主一般都痴迷于某种永恒的追求。掷一次木乃伊领主阴谋表，或从中选择一个结果，以此作为灵感来决定木乃伊领主在谋划着何种古老大计。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmMummyLordPlots rollable classes="caption-top"]

Mummy Lord Lairs.name: 木乃伊领主巢穴
Mummy Lord Lairs.text:
Mummy lords typically lurk in the ruins of places they dwelled in life. Such sites have forbidding reputations, or they might be lost and forgotten.

The region containing a mummy lord’s lair is warped by its presence, creating the following effects:

Cursed Fate. Whenever a creature other than the mummy or one of its allies casts a Divination spell while within 1 mile of the lair, the creature makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast the spell is wasted, but any resources used to cast it aren’t expended.

Soul Drain. Creatures within 1 mile of the lair have Disadvantage on Death Saving Throws.

If the mummy lord is destroyed or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately. The effects resume if the mummy lord gains a new body (see its Undead Restoration trait).

Myconids.name: 蕈人
Myconids.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.6r6AhxT2Rvh4Qes1 classes="top-frame hike-1"]

孢子的养护者

栖息地： 幽暗地域； 宝藏：任意

蕈人居住于长满霉菌和蘑菇的幽暗地域偏远地区。这些行走的蕈类生物照料着它们的庇护所，避免卷入其他生物的纷争。蕈人有专门用于交流的孢子，专门用来警告彼此危险的孢子，也有专门用以自卫的孢子。当蕈人们遭遇其他生灵时，他们会释放心灵链接孢子，让附近的生物得以通过心灵感应来交流思想。然而，蕈人的真正目的对大多数非蕈类生物而言依然是个谜。

Myconid Sprout.name: 蕈人幼体
Myconid Sprout.text: 蕈人幼体会照料它们的蕈地家园并警惕冒犯者。

Myconid Adult.name: 蕈人成体
Myconid Adult.text: 蕈人成体会抵御入侵者，保卫自己的领地和其他蕈人。

Myconid Spore Servant.name: 蕈人孢子奴仆
Myconid Spore Servant.text: 孢子奴仆是被蕈人王的孢子蔓生和再次活化的尸体。这些被蕈类感染的尸体是蕈人王意志的延伸，并服从王的一切指令。

Myconid Sovereign.name: 蕈人王
Myconid Sovereign.text: 蕈人王形如高大的蕈人成体，身上长满了精致复杂的蕈类。它们指挥着较小的亲族，并负责管理庞大真菌群的健康和生长。

Nalfeshnee.name: 判魂魔
Nalfeshnee.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.y3vTb0mZXLuMz3ny caption=false classes="nalfesh-cut corner-frame"]

恐惧与绝望并存的恶魔

栖息地： 异界（无底深渊）；宝藏： 圣物

判魂魔们渴望统治它们所遇到的一切。这些恶魔体型庞大，外形怪异，有着畸形的兽类特质与食人魔般的体格。通过蛮力与狡诈，判魂魔们迫使邪教徒与弱小的恶魔在无尽的深渊战场与物质位面的阴谋中为其服务。

血战——魔鬼与恶魔间无尽的纷争——有助于确保多元宇宙平衡。有时会有人介入其中，但切勿自欺欺人地认为两害相权取其轻。我可不会为躲过魔鬼鞭打而对恶魔感激涕零。

—魔邓肯

许多判魂魔认为自己是未来的恶魔领主，试着征服一片自己的领域。它们经常使用邪魔魔法或深渊盟友的承诺引诱雄心勃勃的凡人签订毁灭性的契约。如果它们失去了耐心，它们会召唤出深渊之景与其他梦魇恐吓他人屈服。

Night Hag.name: 夜鬼婆
Night Hag.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.oXoBau7WxO0RzgLW caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Hag of Nightmare and Corruption

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes); Treasure: Arcana

Night hags seek mortals to torment and turn to evil. By day, night hags use supernatural deceptions to plague their victims, shape-shifting to pose as other creatures and make their targets believe the world has turned against them. By night, these hags reinforce their tortures with terrifying dreams. Once they force their targets to desperate limits, night hags claim their victims’ tormented spirits, capturing them in sinister traps called soul bags. The hags then slip between planes of existence to barter stolen souls to vile magic-users and fiendish entities.

Night hags maintain networks of nefarious customers and collect rumors from across the Lower Planes. These hags might part with their secrets in exchange for magic items and other wicked prices.

Nightmare.name: 梦魇
Nightmare.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.io5irN86jaOAVv8C caption=false classes="top-frame hike-1"]

下层位面的恐怖战马

栖息地：异界（下层位面）； 宝藏： 无

梦魇形似拥有烈焰鬃毛、燃火马蹄和阴燃双目的马匹。它们恐吓弱小的生物，并常与下层位面的住民结盟以实施恶行。这些超自然的马匹天生能够在以太位面和物质位面之间穿行，且许多个体都知晓前往下层位面、堕影冥界和其他险恶领域的传送门位置。

梦魇的速度、耐久力以及在存在位面间驰骋的能力令其成为了恶徒们垂涎的坐骑。掷一次梦魇骑手表，或从中选择一个结果，以此来为什么存在可能雇佣一只梦魇坐骑提供灵感。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmNightmareRider rollable classes="caption-top"]

Nobles.name: 贵族
Nobles.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.4YU2adNDQs5O2PRC caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Royals and Rich Folk

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Individual

Nobles encompass a variety of people with social influence. They might be rulers, wealthy merchants, callous bureaucrats, or the idle elite.

Noble.name: 贵族
Noble.text: 贵族在社会地位上的优势，使其能获得比普通人更高的教育和训练，它们在商业和政治领域经验丰富，往往亦是谈判领域的高手。

Noble Prodigy.name: 贵血天骄
Noble Prodigy.text: 贵血天骄的血脉可追溯至某位传奇英雄、某位半神、某条巨龙，以及其它类型的先祖；天骄们从这些先祖身上继承了魔法之力。不过在某些贵族家族中，天骄们的魔法能力之源却是不可告人的家族隐秘。

Nothic.name: 诺斯怪
Nothic.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ChAyaVnq72w7NgMq caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Witness to the Weird

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Arcana

Consumed by their thirst for forbidden knowledge, nothics are cursed lore seekers transformed by secrets never meant to be known. The bodies of these former scholars are warped into otherworldly shapes, each with a head dominated by a gigantic, unblinking eye. Nothics remember nothing of their past lives and care only for their endless pursuit of hidden mysteries and uncanny truths. They seek revelations amid the rubble of forgotten ruins, and they use their supernatural sight to pierce magical deceptions, rot the flesh of enemies, and steal the secrets of those who interrupt their investigations.

Deeper. Deeper and Deeper. Deeper and creeper. Creeping they come. Up from the place that isn’t a place. They come to feed. Feed on what I know. So I hide. I hide away. Away in the secret dark. Secret and dark, like all that I know I shouldn’t know!

—Scratches in Shadowdusk Hold

Some nothics seek to end the curse that warped them into their bizarre forms, but many are unaware of—or uninterested in—their transformation.

Nycaloth.name: 征伐罗斯魔
Nycaloth.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.1E1aObbPaUOfwSRx caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Yugoloth of Strategy and Strife

Habitat: Planar (Gehenna); Treasure: Armaments

Fiendish warmongers, nycaloths relish combat and conquest. These tremendous winged yugoloths teleport around battlefields and into the air to bewilder their foes and attack with constantly shifting, Gehenna-forged axes—mercurial weapons similar to those favored by many yugoloths.

Nycaloths might command groups of mezzoloths and make pacts to serve arcanaloths, ultroloths, fiendish warlords, or wicked mortals. So long as they can indulge their bloodlust, most nycaloths are willing to obey more powerful or cunning creatures. Some even serve competent leaders past the terms of their agreements to achieve long-pursued victories. But masters that lead nycaloths to defeat should fear these proud yugoloths’ retribution.

Nycaloths and other yugoloths frequently serve as mercenary forces in extraplanar conflicts that spill onto the Material Plane. Roll on or choose a result from the Yugoloth Incursions table to inspire the plans of a yugoloth war band.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmYugolothIncurs rollable classes="caption-top"]

Ochre Jelly.name: 赭果冻
Ochre Jelly.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.4uqOkZMhpLl8mSoG caption=false classes="top-frame"]

累乘增生的阿米巴猎手

栖息地： 幽暗地域； 宝藏： 无

赭果冻是一种巨大的黄偏棕色阿米巴生物，其能消化一切有机的生物。它们不知疲倦的巡猎，搜寻那些比自己更小的生物，将其包裹，死死压制在地上或是路径周遭的障碍物上。一旦这群酸蚀性的粘液怪物彻底覆盖了它们的猎物，就会开始消化那些猎物的血肉、毛发、皮鳞，直到只剩下受害者的衣物、装备、鞣制皮革、以及骨头。

如果被闪电所伤，或是被挥砍武器所伤，赭果冻会一分为二，以两个小号赭果冻的组合攻击继续去吃他们的敌人——不过在这一战结束后，两只果冻会分道扬镳，分别踏上自己的狩猎之旅，而两者未来都会重新长回原来的大小。

赭果冻无法消化的部分会被留在原地。投掷下方的赭果冻厨余垃圾表或从表中选择一项来作为其残留物的灵感。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmOchreJellyLeft rollable classes="caption-top"]

Ogres.name: 食人魔
Ogres.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.2mR1ZSs0KncdugME caption=false classes="right three lift-50 top-frame"]

Raging Hulks and Hoarders

Habitat: Arctic, Desert, Forest, Grassland, Hill, Mountain, Swamp, Underdark; Treasure: Armaments

Ogres are selfish raiders and hulking gluttons spawned of hateful supernatural forces. From dismal ruins and bleak hinterlands, they raid vulnerable communities and ambush travelers. Ogres covet food and treasure, and they spitefully destroy art, books, clockwork devices, and other delicate or lovingly made things. Occasionally they kidnap victims to eat later or, more rarely, performers who catch their interest.

Ogres trace their origins to wrathful deities such as Erythnul, Takhisis, and Vaprak. They magically emerge from the earth of lands corrupted by evil gods, sinister magic, or ancient curses. Some bear evidence of the places that spawned them, sporting rocky calluses, mossy growths, or frozen scars.

Ogre.name: 食人魔
Ogre.text: 食人魔是身高10尺的蛮人，凌虐敌人，随心所欲地掠夺各种战利品。其他邪恶势力会许以食物，财富和让其参战的承诺来和食人魔劫掠者们结盟。

Ogrillon Ogre.name: 半食人魔
Ogrillon Ogre.text: 半食人魔是由被邪秽的魔法或愤怒神明的意志所诅咒的类人生物变来的。它的外貌与原来的长相相似，但是身高会长到超过8尺，并且长出食人魔般的外表特征。半食人魔体内不断翻涌着超自然的狂怒，它们可能会挣扎着控制这种愤怒，抑或故意朝其他动物发泄出去。

Oni.name: 恶鬼
Oni.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.FXpnC3DxL8Qri1PC caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Wickedness Drawn to the Wicked

Habitat: Forest, Urban; Treasure: Armaments

Oni are elusive entities that inhabit dark forests and other wildernesses. By shape-shifting into the form of an innocent or moving invisibly, oni encroach on communities and lonely roads. They frequently harass people of faith, testing the limits of their piousness, or torment selfish people, punishing them for their wickedness. Wise communities often have guardian statues, annual rituals, or local superstitions meant to keep oni at bay. In rare cases, an oni might gradually befriend such communities and protect them from other threats for generations.

Oni torment villages that don’t pay them or other supernatural forces respect. Roll on or choose a result from the Oni Troubles table to inspire how an oni menaces such communities.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmOniTroubles000 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Otyugh.name: 食腐兽
Otyugh.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.QHqanb0qIx1v1bPB caption=false classes="top-frame"]

垃圾堆中的老饕

栖息地： 幽暗地域；宝藏： 任意

食腐兽为食而生——越恶心的食物越受其亲睐。它们将所有触手可及且非其族类的生物视为其无尽饕餮生涯中的一餐。它们盘踞于垃圾场、下水道、受污染的废墟，和诸如此类的污浊深渊之中，贪婪地吞食垃圾、腐尸及任何可以被触须塞入其滔天巨口中的东西。有些人会通过投喂垃圾来招募食腐兽作为他们的守卫，尽管它们令人作呕，但足够警觉。

食腐兽经常将自己埋在垃圾堆下，通过长有眼球的茎须观察周围的情况。它们会利用亮闪闪的垃圾和心灵感应来引诱生物靠近，随即用其带刺的触须和污秽巨口发起攻击。掷一次食腐兽诱饵表，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定食腐兽如何引诱猎物靠近。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmOtyughLures000 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Owlbears.name: 枭熊
Owlbears.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.TOwStGiHOSOEdoD3 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 bottom-frame"]

Magically Perfected Predators

Habitat: Forest; Treasure: None

Created long ago by misguided mages, owlbears combine keen avian eyes, thick feathers, and a tearing beak with a mighty bearlike frame. Despite their magical origins, owlbears have propagated and spread to wildernesses across the multiverse.

Owlbears dwell in distinctive dens. Roll on or choose a result from the Owlbear Den Features table to inspire an owlbear den’s noteworthy traits.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmOwlbearDenFeat rollable classes="caption-top"]

Owlbear.name: 枭熊
Owlbear.text: 枭熊是执着的猎人，它会为了猎物追踪数英里，极少放弃狩猎。

Primeval Owlbear.name: 原初枭熊
Primeval Owlbear.text: 充满魔法的古老的森林和妖精荒野中可以诞生特别巨大且凶猛的枭熊。这些原初种可以飞行——虽然飞行能力较差——并发出雷鸣般的戾啸震慑众敌，啸声甚至能将敌人撕裂。

Pegasus.name: 天马
Pegasus.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.YYBp4ZUoEuUrbBaD caption=false classes="top-frame"]

行踪难测的有翼神骑

天马是吾等造物主科瑞隆的珍爱坐骑。得见天马已是天赐之福，而能骑乘天马，则更证明为诸神的宠爱。

—悠兰德，塞勒涅女王 Yolande, Queen of Celene

栖息地： 森林，草原，丘陵，异界（上层位面）；宝藏： 无

天马是具有智慧且高贵的有翼骏马，它们威严神秘，而又行踪难测。它们大多会避开其他生物，更喜欢栖身于诗情画意的牧场或浮空岛屿之上，或者干脆栖身于其他存在位面之中。部分天马会效忠于妖精荒野和上层位面的神祇，协助有需要的英雄。在极少数情况下，天马可能会与品行高尚之人结下友谊，成为他们的伙伴与坐骑。

由于邪恶势力的爪牙会猎捕天马，因此这些有翼骏马会在见到陌生人的第一时间就逃跑。掷一次天马献礼表格，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定表露善意的方式。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmPegasusOfferin rollable classes="caption-top"]

Performers.name: 演艺者
Performers.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.9FgQv3Vih1Iy20qH caption=false classes="top-frame"]

歌舞弹唱，样样精通

栖息地：任意； 宝藏：器具，个体

欢迎！诸位先生！诸位女士！欢迎！诸位高个子！诸位矮个子！欢迎！诸位天使！诸位邪魔！欢迎！来自五湖四海的顾客们！欢迎来到——嘉年华！

—拉客人廷达

演艺者们遍及四海，从皇室的宫廷到乡下的广场。这些技艺精湛的艺人磨练才华，取悦观众。一些演艺者不断远行，向他人分享故事、表演魔术；另一些演艺者则在大国的剧院和舞台上常驻，为自己培植名望，赢得赞助。无论如何，演艺者们大多都会精进自己业内的独门秘技以及华丽的魔法，意在给观众们带来难以忘怀的观演体验。

使用下列艺人职能与角色以为冒险当中出现的演艺者提供灵感：

杂演员Acrobat

演员Actor

空中飞人Aerialist

驯兽师Animal trainer

运动员Athlete

滑稽演员Burlesque artist

街头艺人Busker

马戏团员Circus performer

喜剧演员Comedian

柔体杂技演员Contortionist

舞者Dancer

危险特技演员Daredevil

弄臣Jester

杂耍艺人Juggler

魔术师Magician

催眠师Mentalist

哑剧演员Mime

吟游歌者Minstrel

殡葬人员Mourner

口述史学家Oral historian

诗人Poet

傀儡师Puppeteer

仪礼师Ritualist

武打演员Stage fighter

说书人Storyteller

喉音歌手Throat singer

传信人Town crier

特技骑手Trick rider

声乐家Vocalist

摔跤手Wrestler

Performer.name: 演艺者
Performer.text: 常见的演艺者包括旅行的说书人、酒馆中的音乐家、当地活跃的艺人、以及资深艺人麾下的合唱团员。这些演艺者们可能是自学成才，也有可能是从小就接受专业的训练。大多数演艺者都拥有良好的声望以及两三门熟练的乐器，或两三项看家的本领。

Performer Maestro.name: 演艺尊师
Performer Maestro.text: 演艺尊师是声名显赫的顶级演艺者。它们也许是剧院的招牌演员、令人惊叹的危险特技演员、甚至是精通如何应对皇室成员喜怒无常的心情的弄臣。一些演艺尊师会向徒弟传授自己的技艺，而另一些则会对此严防死守，生怕别人偷师。

Performer Legend.name: 演艺传奇
Performer Legend.text: 演艺传奇名扬海内外，驰名于整片大陆，甚至整个世界。它们的声望可以助其踏入社会顶流，或是反过来利用表演来操弄观众。演艺传奇通常都有独属于自己的某种特征或是天赋，例如独特的声音、非凡的运动能力、极具特色的穿衣风格。演艺传奇也经常和其它演艺者、警卫、或者贵族金主一并旅行。

Peryton.name: 鹿鹰
Peryton.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.JvzZcF96Scj9ijjM classes="top-frame"]

有翼狩心者

栖息地：丘陵，山地；宝藏： 武备

鹿鹰是恐怖的猎食者，它们喜好猎杀类人生物，尤其是人类和精灵，胜过其他任何。鹿鹰生着强壮的鸟类身躯和带有獠牙的雄鹿头，它们偏好自天空俯冲攻击旅行者。诡异的是，其投下的影子轮廓好似人影。由于这超自然的怪象，人们相信鹿鹰是被诅咒的人类或精灵，亦或者鹿鹰以恶人尸体为食的食腐鸟。

鹿鹰会掏出猎物的心脏，将这些器官带回它们的巢穴。这也引发了许多围绕鹿鹰的迷信。掷一次鹿鹰迷信表，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定鹿鹰偷取心脏的理由。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmPerytonSuperst rollable classes="caption-top"]

Phase Spider.name: 相位蜘蛛
Phase Spider.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.5GjKqIVAd9aEf8gm caption=false classes="right two lift-50 left-frame"]

Plane-Shifting Arachnid Ambusher

Habitat: Desert, Forest, Grassland, Hill, Planar (Ethereal Plane), Underdark, Urban; Treasure: Any

Phase spiders appear out of nowhere to attack, then vanish just as swiftly. These horse-size, magical arachnids are endemic to the Ethereal Plane. From vaporous lairs, they peer through the Border Ethereal into the Material Plane. When they detect prey, phase spiders draw close and then shift or “phase” to the Material Plane to attack. They shift between planes of existence and attack from unexpected directions until they overcome their prey or are forced to retreat.

Some sages say you unknowingly occupy the same ethereally coterminous point as a phase spider an average of four times each year.

—Marcus Wands, doubtful authority

Phase spiders are more intelligent than mundane spiders, but most are cowards. They usually flee if they’re outnumbered by creatures capable of seeing them on the Ethereal Plane or pursuing them there. They make exceptions for ghosts and similar spirits, which phase spiders gain sustenance from and pursue as favored prey.

Piercer.name: 石锥怪
Piercer.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.FfGvhR6ynCKUx5zn caption=false classes="right two lift-50 cradle-frame"]

Aberrant Counterfeit Stalactite

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Individual

Piercers resemble stalactites, but each has a toothy maw and a single eye. They hang from cavern ceilings along routes frequented by denizens of the Underdark. Piercers might lurk for months at a time, waiting for any creature of their approximate size to pass underneath. When potential meals move below, piercers release their grip and plummet, intent on impaling prey in a single strike. If they’re successful, piercers consume their meals and then slowly climb to a new ambush position. If they miss or fail to slay their targets, piercers attempt to squirm away, but they’re easily dispatched by creatures aware of their presence.

Piercers are the larval form of ropers. Young piercers seek to move as far from ropers as they can to avoid ropers’ undiscerning hunger. Many piercers migrate vast distances through the Underdark, often to caverns or buried ruins near the surface.

Rule 8: Never trust a stalactite.

—X the Mystic’s Rules of Dungeon Survival

Pirates.name: 海盗
Pirates.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.KNf5HGOw6yOuGCCC caption=false classes="top-frame"]

劫掠者，觅宝人

栖息地：任意；宝藏： 个体，器具

“海盗”一词泛指各类海员，包括于海上漫游的恶匪，寻猎船只的私掠船，被诅咒的宝藏猎人，以及其它意图在海上寻得财富与名誉之人。

海盗在冒险中可以是盟友，可以是敌人，可以是乱入者，甚至可以亦敌亦友。它们是商船和沿海社群的灾祸，却也熟知海底的秘密，并知晓如何躲避水中的危险。某些海盗甚至将目光从海浪之上移开，转而使用飞艇、魔法船、跨位面载具、甚至是更加诡异的载具，在不可思议的领域中探索，劫掠。

Pirate.name: 海盗
Pirate.text: 海盗们是称职的战士，亦是精于航海与维护船只的娴熟海员。一些海盗忠诚地遵从船长的命令，而另一些轻视其职责，自私自利、盲目迷信、或是争权夺利。

Pirate Captain.name: 海盗船长
Pirate Captain.text: 海盗船长号令着手下的众多船员，为其指明目的与方向。海盗船长们会为自己营造戏剧般的恐怖形象，将自己描绘成比凡人更可怕的存在，以此吓退敌人，威慑船员们保持忠诚，并吸引更对追随者加入到他们的旗帜之下。许多海盗船长都有专属的绰号，其灵感来自于自己身上标志性的特征和惯用的手段。

Pirate Admiral.name: 海盗将军
Pirate Admiral.text: 海盗将军指挥着整支海盗舰队。它们的行动胆大包天，挑战沿海国家的海军、追猎传奇海洋生物、甚至建立属于自己的海盗王国都算是家常便饭。海盗将军的宝藏可能就存在自己休整的据点之中，亦可能只留着通往藏宝处的地图。一些海盗将军还会跟海洋神灵、水下住民、甚至是海怪结盟，与其爪牙一同行劫掠之事。

Pirate Flags.name: 海盗旗
Pirate Flags.text:
为了震惧对手，散布威名，海盗们会挂上独特的旗帜。掷两次海盗旗表，或从中选择两个结果，以此启发并决定一伙海盗们所使用的旗子是什么样子。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmPirateFlags000 rollable classes="caption-top"]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmPirateFlagsAcc rollable classes="caption-top"]

Pit Fiend.name: 深狱炼魔
Pit Fiend.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.linPUetDjunimRol caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Devil of Domination

Habitat: Planar (Nine Hells); Treasure: Relics

Masterminds of the Nine Hells and generals of infernal legions, pit fiends seek conquests across the planes of existence. More than warmongers, these diabolical tyrants concoct intricate plots that play out among fiendish battlefields, infernal politics, and mortal conspiracies.

Pit fiends are the nobility of the Nine Hells, and many rule Lower Planar fiefdoms, doomed mortal worlds, and other infernal redoubts. Most serve archdevils of the Nine Hells as they pursue their own ambitions. Ranks of lesser devils obey pit fiends, but these cunning tyrants remain on guard against betrayal from their servants.

Smoldering with the evil of the Nine Hells, pit fiends strike fear in creatures with their mere presence. Despite their size and incredible physical and magical might, pit fiends are as likely to try to corrupt foes as they are to destroy them outright. Pit fiends’ arrogance can lead them to underestimate mortal foes—a failing that can lead to their downfall.

Pixies.name: 皮克精
Pixies.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.RUSrIVIPunVpyhM9 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 cradle-frame"]

Friends of the Forest

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Feywild); Treasure: Arcana

Barely a foot tall, pixies resemble diminutive elves with gossamer wings. They invisibly observe those who enter their wooded homes, revealing themselves to those with friendly intentions. Those who are unfriendly become the targets of pixies’ pranks.

Pixie.name: 皮克精
Pixie.text: 皮克精整天都在嬉戏玩耍或是四处探险，不过他们极尽可能地避免与其他生物的直接接触。

Pixie Wonderbringer.name: 皮克妙妙精
Pixie Wonderbringer.text: 皮克妙妙精是一群充满活力的艺术家，他们会用自己的魔法来守护荒野——前提是有这个必要。

Planetar.name: 星天神使
Planetar.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.94C2BuDrSZuaTQQU caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Righteously Wrathful Angelic Warrior

Habitat: Planar (Upper Planes); Treasure: Relics

Planetars deliver the punishment of righteous gods. These angels innately know truth from lies, and they use magic and blessed weapons to protect the just and root out wickedness across the Multiverse.

These angels act where they can against overwhelming evil, but to avoid the attention of the Lower Planes, they prefer to let mortals attend to affairs on the Material Plane. Planetars often choose mortal champions to oppose threats they’re loath to face directly, involving themselves only if necessary. Roll on or choose a result from the Planetar Quests table to inspire what evil a planetar might recruit heroes to thwart.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmPlanetarQuests rollable classes="caption-top clear-both"]

Poltergeist.name: 骚灵
Poltergeist.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.h7JFF6OlvwbDdP98 caption=false classes="top-frame"]

Malevolent or Mischievous Spirit

Habitat: Underdark, Urban; Treasure: Any

Poltergeists are spirits that confuse and torment the living. While typically not visible, they sometimes appear as faded images of whoever they were in life. Some poltergeists don’t realize they’re dead and go through the motions of their past lives. Others are malicious beings or embodiments of fractured psyches that sow discord where they haunt.

Poltergeists telekinetically move objects in the places they lurk. Roll on or choose a result from the Poltergeist Activities table to inspire how a poltergeist menaces the living.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmPoltergeistAct rollable classes="caption-top"]

Priests.name: 祭司
Priests.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.kvVlVNDI70a1T7GF caption=false classes="top-frame"]

裁量圣旨，审断凡尘

栖息地： 任意；宝藏： 个体，圣物

牧师驾驭信仰之力，于尘世中行施奇迹。这些宗教信徒的类型和其所信仰的对象那般多样。一些祭司服从于其所信仰的神祇及其仆从，而另一些祭司则践行着古老的信条。信仰引领着祭司们的行动，为它们的魔法之力指引方向，让祭司们依照自己所属的意识形态塑造这个世界。

掷一次祭司身份表，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定这名牧师属于什么样的类型。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmPriestRoles000 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Priest Acolyte.name: 侍祭僧侣
Priest Acolyte.text: 侍祭僧侣信仰坚定，但却尚未掌握高深的魔法技能。一些侍祭僧侣也许是宗教组织中的学生，或是狂热的圣战军士兵。而另一些侍祭僧侣则可能是小型社群内的信仰领袖，或是流浪的朝圣者。

Priest.name: 祭司
Priest.text:
耀之主啊，求祢照亮我的时日。以圣灵之火燃起我的灵魂，以神圣之思启迪我的作为。求祢驱散我途中的阴翳，容我步履坚定，行在祢永恒不灭的荣光之中。

—Morning prayer to Pelor

祭司们自信仰中汲取奇迹，疗愈需要帮助者，惩戒胆敢残害者。它们能引导信仰之力，将其化作法术；亦能将神圣威能注入武器，斩尽众敌。

Archpriest.name: 大祭司
Archpriest.text: 大祭司与神性存在密切联结，掌握诸多玄秘的真理。大祭司是神圣意志与其它超自然伟力的“中转站“，能够依靠魔法调动此等力量，创造奇迹，以信仰之名降下恩慈——以及神罚。一些大祭司宣称其是神祇的代言人，吸引了大量的追随者；另一些大祭司则追求个人的精神修行，远远超越凡人的眼界。

Pseudodragon.name: 伪龙
Pseudodragon.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.xVzFnhROLdOxJHtZ caption=false classes="right two lift-50 left-frame"]

Fickle, Pint-Sized Dragon

Habitat: Coastal, Desert, Forest, Hill, Mountain, Urban; Treasure: Arcana

Pseudodragons dwell in scenic wildernesses, preferably where life is easy and prey is small and slow. There they behave like contented wyrms, creating tiny lairs amid ancient trees and rugged cliffs. They fill these lairs with shiny rocks, colorful shells, and unattended treasures that catch their attention, and they guard these hoards fiercely.

If you want to keep a pseudodragon happy, get used to thinking of yourself as its familiar.

—Jallarzi, pseudodragon’s companion

Pseudodragons grow to the size of large house cats, and most have red-brown scales. Some have scales with other hues or patterns—markings distinct from those of their larger draconic cousins.

Many magic-users attempt to befriend pseudodragons, hoping to enlist them as familiars. The creatures’ intellect and resistance to magic make them excellent companions, and they’re considered status symbols in some spellcasting circles.

Many pseudodragons prefer the finer things in life. These diminutive dragons might be inclined to aid those who ply them with treats. Contrariwise, mages who don’t properly pamper their pseudodragon familiars might be abandoned without warning. Roll on or choose an option from the Pseudodragon Treats table to inspire a pseudodragon’s taste in gifts.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmPseudodragonTr rollable classes="caption-top"]

Purple Worm.name: 紫虫
Purple Worm.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.LcVzSWRg2WM1xff9 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 corner-frame"]

What Gnaws the Roots of the World

Habitat: Desert, Underdark; Treasure: None

Titanic purple worms burrow through the earth and sand. Ever ravenous, they devour smaller creatures and ravage entire communities in their aimless burrowing.

Purple worms alone are bad enough, but the blasted monsters have a knack for unearthing things that are even worse!

—Morrikan d’Kundarak

Quaggoths.name: 幽邃熊怪
Quaggoths.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.y16yy3Lsh3SW1Nlv caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-corner-frame"]

Unpredictable Subterranean Stalkers

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: None

Beastly hunters endemic to subterranean depths, quaggoths scrape harsh existences from the Underdark. While they can survive on bitter lichens and toxic fungi, they viciously attack anything they can make a meal of, from giant spiders to explorers. Quaggoths sometimes serve as muscle for Underdark-dwelling villains.

Quaggoths frequently collect in small bands led by the most fearsome group member. These bands are proud and quick to hold grudges. Anyone who harms a quaggoth—or who is suspected of doing so—earns the enmity of that quaggoth’s band regardless of reason or fault. These grudges sometimes extend to whole communities rather than individuals. Generations of quaggoths might seek revenge against a settlement’s inhabitants for decades-old slights. Only the leader of a quaggoth band can demand that a grudge ends.

Quaggoth.name: 幽邃熊怪
Quaggoth.text: 对于幽邃熊怪来说，每场战斗都决定着生死。幽邃熊怪战斗充满了狂野的怒火，为了生存不择手段。

Quaggoth Thonot.name: 幽邃熊怪脑头
Quaggoth Thonot.text: 幽邃熊怪脑头拥有灵能的力量，它们将这一力量用作战斗中的锋刃，还能用其强迫其他幽邃熊怪为它效命。

Quasit.name: 小恶魔
Quasit.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.wzh8CYym8MMHjrxG caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Demon of Discord and Disorder

Habitat: Planar (Abyss); Treasure: None

Tirelessly destructive, quasits sow discord through nasty pranks, sabotage, and ambushes. These tiny demons use chaos and violence to terrorize others. By shape-shifting into harmless but ill-omened creatures or by turning invisible, quasits sneak into places where they spy for villainous masters or set vicious traps. Quasits delight in hiding in dark places and—when least expected—bursting forth to slash foes with their poisoned claws.

A thing doesn’t need to be big to be gut-flippingly dreadful. Just think of all the folks who’re squeamish around spiders. Now imagine a spider as big as a cat and that wants to steal your tongue.

—Otto the Bard

Quasits are usually overlooked and underestimated by other demons. This drives them to prove themselves through cruel acts or by seeking paths to the Material Plane. Among mortals, quasits sow senseless chaos, and they might find kindred evil spirits among violent cultists and magic-users.

Rakshasa.name: 罗刹
Rakshasa.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.5erdJ1RbJTkmlmP1 caption=false classes="top-frame hike-3"]

觊觎权柄与血肉的诡诈奸徒

栖息地： 异界（九层地狱），城市；宝藏： 圣物

精通操弄之道的罗刹潜入社群，篡夺权柄。它们掩饰自身真貌，绑架猎物，沉溺于无尽的血肉渴求。

罗刹可抵御一定程度的魔法。但传说也曾记载受祝福的勇士使用弩矢、飞箭、或类似武器将其斩杀。

罗刹的外形融合类人的身躯以及动物与怪物的特征。所有罗刹都有一种体貌上的怪异特征，当它们进行魔法伪装时，这个怪异特征依旧会保留，比如手掌的位置是原本人类手背的位置。

Red Dragons.name: 红龙
Red Dragons.text:
贪婪与浩劫之龙

栖息地： 丘陵，山脉；宝藏： 任意

红龙掠取所欲，焚烬挡道之物。这一色彩龙族欲壑难填——一时餍足只会令其渴望更多：更多的魔法、更多的领地、更多的宝藏、以及一切勾起其残虐野望之物。

红龙巢踞险崖与火山之间。它们在巢穴之内收拢宝藏，守护宝山。许多红龙都对其宝山的内容和收藏品的位置了如指掌，一旦有什么东西不见了，红龙便会大发雷霆——它们会永不止息地追猎失物，直到把窃贼烧成渣滓、把财宝悉数夺还。

红龙自诩诸龙之首，故亦为芸芸众生之极。对于红龙而言，掠夺与征服乃天赋权柄——能给予一件珍宝的最大殊荣，便是将其纳入宝库。同样的，其他生灵亦应为自己能给巨龙殿下服务而感到无上荣幸。

Red Dragon Wyrmling.name: 红龙雏龙
Red Dragon Wyrmling.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.fp4ZFtGRPwpBPTSm caption=false classes="right two lift-1"]

Red dragon wyrmlings are born destroyers. From a young age, they delight in igniting objects and creatures alike. They sometimes restrain themselves from scorching creatures to instead bully others into following their orders and bringing them gifts.

Young Red Dragon.name: 青年红龙
Young Red Dragon.text: 青年红龙是红龙族群中最难以捉摸的。它们寻找着富含宝藏的领地以及潜在的手下，而红龙在实现目的的过程中绝不吝动武：劫掠，焚烧，屠杀，这都是红龙的手段。一旦红龙站稳脚跟，巩固统治，它们的恐怖统治就可绵延数个世纪——只有在其建立统治的过程中出现显著的抵抗才能阻止这种未来。

Adult Red Dragon.name: 成年红龙
Adult Red Dragon.text:
成年红龙是宣称有广袤土地的暴君，它们可能指挥着仆从大军，或是掌握了某种魔法性的资源。红龙很少在意更小的生物所宣称的国家与领地，还可能将整座城市都视为属于自己的领土。大多数红龙都很难被称之为合格的统治者，它们会耽于享乐，收集宝藏，或是聚焦与其巢穴之间的魔法联系长达数十载之久。然而，一旦红龙重新审视其领土，并看到了它不喜欢的某些东西————龙炎便会涤净其上的一切事物。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.mEoZUZRxAsIRU1Ql classes="top-frame"]

Ancient Red Dragon.name: 远古红龙
Ancient Red Dragon.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.l3W8M9VsCN1YmF3v caption=false classes="right three lift-1 right-cradle-frame"]

Ancient red dragons number among the most feared and destructive beings in the multiverse. Few can withstand the wrath of an ancient red dragon that turns its mind toward devastation. These dragons’ greed matches their ruinous potential, and they collect vast hoards studded with storied treasures and magic items. Their lairs frequently tap into volcanic depths and might pierce other planes of existence, bringing servants from the Elemental Plane of Fire or the Lower Planes into their service.

Red Dragon Lairs.name: 红龙巢穴
Red Dragon Lairs.text:
Red dragons make their lairs in smoldering, unapproachable places such as volcanic mountains, burning wastelands, and ruins they’ve stolen from other creatures.

The region containing an adult or ancient red dragon’s lair is warped by its presence, creating the following effects:

Burning Heat. The area within 1 mile of the lair is an area of extreme heat. A burning creature or object takes an additional 1d4 Fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Smoldering Haze. The area within 1 mile of the lair is Lightly Obscured with clouds of ash. Whenever a creature other than the dragon or one of its allies finishes a Long Rest in that area, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the Poisoned condition for 1 hour.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Remorhazes.name: 百足魔兽
Remorhazes.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.09hey3RgCdxHsYrw caption=false classes="right three lift-1"]

Super-Heated Arctic Arthropods

Habitat: Arctic; Treasure: None

Remorhazes are centipede-like terrors that burrow through snow and ice to ambush smaller creatures that trespass in their frozen territories.

Young Remorhaz.name: 青年百足魔兽
Young Remorhaz.text: 青年百足魔兽会烧焦并吞食任何它们能追上且制服的生物。

Remorhaz.name: 百足魔兽
Remorhaz.text: 百足魔兽是专注于伏击的捕食者。它们咬住猎物，困于自己的极热之躯，然后将其整个吞下。百足魔兽可以尽可能的吃下大量食物，然后好几个月都不进食。

Revenants.name: 还魂鬼
Revenants.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.g3tWf21ZrLjTHiIk classes="right three lift-50"]

Vengeance from beyond the Grave

Habitat: Forest, Swamp, Urban; Treasure: Any

Wrathful spirits bent on revenge, revenants possess corpses and other materials, using them to seek justice or vent their rage on those who wronged them. Revenants refuse to rest until those they seek to punish are no more. If their bodies are destroyed, revenants claim new forms and continue their ruthless quests.

Revenant.name: 还魂鬼
Revenant.text: 还魂鬼会附身其生前的遗体，驾驭自己的尸身，追猎那些害死它们的人。如果这具尸身被摧毁了，还魂鬼亦能附身并操控新的尸体，这些新的尸体会逐渐化成类似这一还魂鬼的生前相貌的姿态。

Graveyard Revenant.name: 还魂尸山
Graveyard Revenant.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.cspuHQxRqtMYdMEB caption=false classes="right two clear-both lift-1 top-frame"]

Graveyard revenants possess dozens of bodies that combine to form grotesque masses. They take revenge on those responsible for mass deaths or institutions that callously ruin lives.

Haunting Revenant.name: 还魂巨构
Haunting Revenant.text:
还魂巨构是附身了废墟或是其他被遗忘之地的还魂鬼，这些被附身之地通常与还魂鬼的死因有关。典型的还魂巨构身地包括被遗弃的废楼、失事的船只、甚至是一整座垃圾场。这些还魂鬼们就这样潜伏在光天化日之下，等待敌人靠近——随后将其一口“吃”下，困在其内部。进入还魂巨构之内者通常还不得不要跟活化家具或是其他更加令人不安的恐怖显化作战。

还魂巨构所在之地通常很快就会变得恶名远扬。

Roc.name: 鹏鸟
Roc.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.UlwT2h1iG128STAh caption=false classes="top-frame"]

大到难以想象的巨鸟

栖息地： 寒带，海岸，荒漠，丘陵，山地；宝藏： 任意

鹏鸟体型巨大，在广袤的领土上捕食，它们能用爪子抓走整只大象、整条鲸鱼或是整辆马车。然后，鹏鸟会把猎物带回遥远的巢穴，这段行程长达数百里，将耗费几天时间。

鹏鸟在偏远的高地筑巢，巢穴中散落着宝藏和未吃完的猎物。掷一次鹏鸟巢穴遗物表，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定其巢穴中有什么。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmRocNestRemnant rollable classes="caption-top"]

Roper.name: 石绳怪
Roper.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.EK2vLUwfHD2audVu caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Tentacled Subterranean Trapper

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Any

Camouflaged as rock formations, ropers are aberrant ambushers that lurk in wait for smaller creatures. These bizarre subterranean hunters extend their rubbery tentacles to explore and prod their surroundings, often reaching beyond their fields of vision. Should they encounter prey, these limbs ensnare victims and drag them close to ropers’ toothy maws. If these tentacles are severed, ropers rapidly grow replacements.

Rule 9: Never trust a stalagmite.

—X the Mystic’s Rules of Dungeon Survival

Ropers can move, albeit slowly. Crawling on the sticky cilia that cover their undersides, ropers can climb walls and suspend themselves from ceilings. These hunters often position themselves in unexpected or treacherous locations, using their surroundings to weaken their prey. Roll on or choose a result from the Roper Hazards table to inspire what dangers ropers employ when ambushing prey.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmRoperHazards00 rollable classes="caption-top"]

*See the Dungeon Master’s Guide.

Rust Monster.name: 锈蚀怪
Rust Monster.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.EFYpwumOB2uFkNpq caption=false classes="top-frame"]

装备的腐蚀性清道夫

栖息地： 幽暗地域； 宝藏： 无

锈蚀怪是一种形似甲虫的清道夫，它们在幽暗地域中游荡，寻找一切含铁金属——无论是天然矿脉、地下建筑还是生物的装备——一经发现，它们就蜂拥而至、大快朵颐。锈蚀怪利用其羽状触角将钢铁等金属腐蚀成锈渣。它们的下颚可以轻易咬穿这种锈蚀金属。锈蚀怪通常会忽视没有金属装备的生物，但是受到攻击时它们也会自卫。

Sahuagin.name: 鲨华鱼人
Sahuagin.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ChnP9rhaSGfwJDAI classes="top-frame"]

波涛之下的劫掠者

栖息地：海岸，水下； 宝藏： 任意

鲨华鱼人是捕猎水上与水底生物的邪魔般的恐怖存在。鲨华鱼人是无情的劫掠者，被沿海社区的居民们称为“海魔鬼”。它们会洗劫船只、渔村与海底社区，满足它们的嗜血欲望，夺取财宝，并向它们的凶残神祇—鲨鱼之神瑟寇拉Sekolah献祭。

鲨华鱼人不断地对任何居住在其领地附近的族群发动战争。人鱼与其他水生族裔在这些攻击中首当其冲，但鲨华鱼人也会猎杀那些在海魔鬼宣称的水域中航行或游泳的空气呼吸者。鲨华鱼人通常与鲨鱼一起发动攻击，它们可以通过心灵感应命令鲨鱼。

Sahuagin Warrior.name: 鲨华武者
Sahuagin Warrior.text:
鲨华武者是以带蹼的利爪撕扯敌人的暴戾斗士。一旦鲨华鱼人见到血，直至它们或它们的敌人死去为止它们都不会停止战斗。

当一个鲨华鱼人向你袭来时，在它咬住你之前，它看起来都不像个活物。然后，那东西的漆黑眼睛变为如同地狱之火的红色，海浪翻涌起猩红的泡沫，而后——惨嚎声起。

—提古兰·玛伦林德，《一位幸存者的回忆录》

Sahuagin Priest.name: 鲨华祭司
Sahuagin Priest.text: 鲨华祭司服从瑟寇拉或其他邪魔主子的意志。它们指挥和支援着其他的鲨华鱼人，并且它们将每一个在战斗中倒下的参战者——无论是敌人还是盟友——都视为一场对它们凶残神祇的献祭。

Sahuagin Baron.name: 鲨华男爵
Sahuagin Baron.text: 在大战之际，瑟寇拉会给那些极其残忍的鲨华武者赐福，使其体型增长并长出额外一对手臂，将他们转变为鲨华男爵。这份恩赐使受赐者们在同类中的地位提升，成为勇士或领导者。鲨华男爵的血液中充满了亵渎的魔法，能够灼烧敌人，并使其成为其他邪魔无法抗拒的目标。

Salamanders.name: 火蜥蜴
Salamanders.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.f99txppWcLdPBoXx classes="top-frame"]

炼狱的蛇身艺术家

栖息地： 异界（火元素位面），幽暗地域；宝藏： 武备

The salamanders of the Elemental Plane of Fire delight in meeting visitors from other realms. For them, every stranger is a potential addition to their fiery artistry. Don’t fall for their flattery, no matter how beautifully they say you’ll burn.

—Filiag Highthumbs, Planes and Travel

火蜥蜴是火元素位面的蛇形住民。它们相信火焰能够展示万物最纯粹的形态，并且热衷于灼烧和熔化各种东西，它们在吞噬各种可燃物的烈焰中看到了刹那的美感和惊人的细微差异，无论那烈焰的灼烧之物是远古森林、艺术杰作还是活物。对于火蜥蜴来说，那些不能承受其烈焰的一切，不过是伪装成了其他模样的灰烬。它们仅对极少数的生物怀有恶意，但它们认为，相比起用火焰带来痛苦和损失，创造非凡的烈焰显然更为重要。

火蜥蜴一般喜欢居住于火元素位面，它们喜欢在火焰中创造奇特而又短暂的艺术。有些火蜥蜴会旅行到其他存在位面和世界去体验异域的火焰，或者去创造规模空前的熊熊大火。

Salamander Fire Snake.name: 火蜥蜴火蛇
Salamander Fire Snake.text: 幼年的火蜥蜴会从直径两英尺的灼热的卵中出生。这些蛇形生物被叫做火蛇，它们会在火元素位面和其他炙热的地方穿行。在吞噬了合适的燃料并将自己暴露在极端炽热的环境中之后，火蛇就会成长为火蜥蜴。

Salamander.name: 火蜥蜴
Salamander.text: 绝大部分火蜥蜴都是傲慢而又富有好奇的生物，它们想要创造出富有艺术感的烈焰，或是想要烧毁从未被烧过的东西。它们会在尝试弄清楚陌生人是如何燃烧的之前，殷切地向他们解释自己的成果。火蜥蜴会散发出强烈的热量，这些热能是由它们燃着烈焰的武器所散发出的。

Salamander Inferno Master.name: 火蜥蜴炎狱之主
Salamander Inferno Master.text: 火蜥蜴炎狱之主是远古的烈焰鉴赏专家，它们经常居住于一些具有独特的灼烧特性的地方。它们会聚集一群学徒，让其在协助各自的导师完成伟大作品的同时研习火焰技艺。炎狱之主怀揣着野心勃勃的目标，例如引发大规模的火山喷发，开启通往炙热位面的传送门，摧毁神器，或是焚毁某个存在在多元宇宙中的所有实体。

Satyrs.name: 半羊人
Satyrs.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.1R1PeajnI19Ps1W5 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-corner-frame"]

Horned and Hoofed Revelers

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Feywild); Treasure: Implements

Satyrs embody the untamed joys of the wilderness. They indulge in sprees of merrymaking—eating, drinking, performing, fighting, and frolicking.

Satyr.name: 半羊人
Satyr.text: 半羊人们乐在一切之中！包括互相比试来彰显力量、驱逐派对的不速之客、以及守卫妖精们的各个领域。

Satyr Revelmaster.name: 半羊人欢庆之主
Satyr Revelmaster.text: 半羊人的欢庆之主可以用魔法音乐来改变其他生物的心情——他们可以借此维持欢庆的热度，也同样可以用此抵御外敌。

Scarecrow.name: 稻草人
Scarecrow.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ZpgJ197N4c52EJwc caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-cradle-frame"]

Servant of Superstition

Habitat: Grassland; Treasure: None

Spirits of vengeance bound to crude frames, scarecrows arise from folk magic, the prayers of desperate commoners, or possession by spirits that died with violent work left undone. Scarecrows might serve those who created them or might defend a place, family, or community from threats—whether physical or to their way of life.

Although scarecrows take their name from rural effigies, they might take varied patchwork forms. Roll on or choose a result from the Scarecrow Frames table to inspire a scarecrow’s appearance.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmScarecrowFrame rollable classes="caption-top"]

Scouts.name: 斥候
Scouts.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.hQBByzCzRi7kgiy6 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 bottom-corner-frame"]

Watchers and Wanderers

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Implements, Individual

Scouts are warriors of the wilderness, trained in hunting and tracking. They might be explorers or trappers, or they could perform more martial roles as archers, bounty hunters, or outriders.

Scout.name: 斥候
Scout.text: 斥候是敏锐的弓箭手，时刻警惕着周围的环境。它们通常对某几个地区的环境特别熟悉，例如其中有哪些生物、有着哪些地标、又有着什么样的危险。

Scout Captain.name: 斥候队长
Scout Captain.text: 斥候队长是经验丰富的探险家与神射手。它们可能率领众多斥候同行，或是独自一人在野外游荡数月时间。

Sea Hag.name: 海鬼婆
Sea Hag.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.GP4AhphHhR3fYVNq caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Hag of Despair and the Dismal Deep

Habitat: Coastal, Underwater; Treasure: Arcana

Sea hags loathe peace and beauty. Bitter, jealous creatures, they spread chaos and undermine joy however they can, undertaking elaborate deceptions to sow discord for its own sake. The hags’ true forms are supernaturally vile, and their baleful gazes can strike down creatures frightened by their appearance.

Sea hags cloak themselves in illusions to work their schemes. Roll on or choose a result from the Sea Hag Disguises table to inspire a sea hag’s illusion and how they might use it to wreak chaos and destruction.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmSeaHagDisguise rollable classes="caption-top"]

Shadow.name: 幽影
Shadow.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.XDwJAYzWaR0Y597R caption=false classes="top-frame"]

无形无迹，有影摄魂

栖息地： 异界（堕影冥界），幽暗地域，城市 宝藏： 无

幽影正如其名，是一种没有实体，以生命为食的亡灵。它们嫉恨生者的潜力与活力。

幽影一般会潜伏在黑暗、偏僻的角落，通常是些对它们生前有意义的地方，或者是与死亡、邪恶等魔法有关的所在，又或者堕影冥界。被其所害者会化作新的幽影，捕食更多的生灵。

幽影就像是他们生前形貌的剪影，或者带有些威胁性的变形。掷一次幽影形态表，或从中选择一个结果，以此作为灵感来决定幽影的具体形貌。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmShadowShapes00 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Shadow Demon.name: 幽影恶魔
Shadow Demon.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.3RvKQoYDrkkcPQMC caption=false classes="right two lift-1 top-frame"]

Vestige of Evil

Habitat: Planar (Abyss); Treasure: None

Shadow demons form when exceptionally wicked demons are destroyed and prevented from reconstituting their physical forms in the Abyss. This might occur due to divine intervention, when a demon is destroyed in the Abyss, or under more unusual circumstances. Shadow demons are the incorporeal remnants of these destroyed demons’ evil. They usually vaguely resemble their former shapes, but some take purposefully deceptive shapes. Many lurk in dark places or venture out only at night to hide their true forms from those they manipulate.

There are three rules to endings. First, good always wins. Second, evil always returns. Third, the first rule isn’t always true.

—Tarsheva Longreach, planar traveler

Shadow demons seek ways to regain their former might and take revenge on those who destroyed them. They often ingratiate themselves with more powerful demons or mortal spellcasters, bargaining with and coercing others into restoring them to power. Many try to claim or corrupt souls to restore their fiendish forms, while some shadow demons seek wicked relics or nexuses of profane magic. It typically takes shadow demons centuries to recover their demonic power, if they ever do.

Particularly powerful demons might return as multiple shadow demons after being defeated. These fiendish entities each think they’re the true manifestation of their past self and hunt one another to recover their power.

In rare cases, Fiends other than demons might adopt forms similar to shadow demons.

Shadow Dragons.name: 幽影龙
Shadow Dragons.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.DiNJXL3QE1xGtLza classes="top-frame"]

黯影蚀身之龙

栖息地： 异界（堕影冥界），幽暗地域； 宝藏： 任意

幽影龙徘徊于被遗忘所掩埋的无光之地。这些巨龙也许曾经是其它类型的龙族，但源自位面之力、负能量、罪恶魔法的浸染已经抹去了其昔日的的色彩与光泽。幽影龙原先的吐息武器被晦暗的病痛之风所取代，削去其所接触到的一切生命。被幽影龙之吐息所杀的生物会作为顺应巨龙意志而行动的幽影复生。

幽影龙通常栖息于幽暗地域，尤其是那些与堕影冥界以及其它晦暗之域所关联的地区。有时，幽影龙匿于黑暗之中，力所能及的腐化其转变为幽影龙之前的时候所喜好的那些区域。过度生长的沼泽、阴沉死寂的沙漠、被尘灰阻塞的火山，这样的地区都是天然的幽影龙巢穴。

幽影龙也会像许多其它龙族一样收集宝藏。不过它们的品味往往充满病态——从早已覆灭的帝国遗留下的钱币，到其受害者遗留下的颅骨。

Shadow Dragon Lairs.name: 幽影龙巢穴
Shadow Dragon Lairs.text:
Shadow dragons lair in places of darkness and despair, such as accursed ruins, the depths of the Underdark, or the Shadowfell.

The region around a shadow dragon’s lair is twisted by its presence, creating the following effects:

If ye truly be adventurers of lore, seek the great shadowy wyrm who lairs beneath the Peaks of Thunder and return in triumph bearing aloft her fabled Eye of Shadow.

—Challenge tempting victims to the lair of the shadow dragon Aurgloroasa

Negative Energy Suffusion. Whenever a creature within 1 mile of the lair regains Hit Points from a spell, it subtracts 1d10 from the number of Hit Points regained.

Stifling Shadows. Within 1 mile of the lair, effects that normally create Bright Light instead create Dim Light, and creatures there have Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Shambling Mound.name: 蔓生怪
Shambling Mound.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.xelRs4wS7PEbu4BZ caption=false classes="top-frame"]

原力具现

栖息地： 森林，沼泽；宝藏： 无

蔓生怪，亦被称为蹒跚者，是荒野顽强生命力的化身，只知吞噬和生长。这些聚集的植物团块可高出人类半个身子，有粗壮的肢体形态，模糊的脑袋。它们游荡于沼泽与灌木林，将触及的生物捕食吞噬，并将猎物埋入自身躯体，化作养分。

怪异的环境条件可能会催生蔓生怪，将植被化作具有低等智慧的巨怪。这些异变可能源自魔法雷击、大自然的自我防御，或是德鲁伊诅咒。掷一次蔓生怪培植表，或从中选择一个结果，以塑造蔓生怪的起源与特性。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmShamblingMound rollable classes="caption-top"]

Shield Guardian.name: 盾卫
Shield Guardian.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.DEiSR21ub4SNlIbl caption=false classes="right two lift-1 top-frame"]

Device-Controlled Magical Bodyguard

Habitat: Urban; Treasure: None

An intimidating magical automaton, a shield guardian obeys its master’s commands and protects its master from danger. When such a guardian is created, the magic that animates it is intertwined with a bonded command amulet. Any creature that has a shield guardian’s command amulet can control that Construct and, in the case of magic-users, imbue it with a spell to unleash under predetermined circumstances. Yet a shield guardian’s primary goal is to protect its master. It escorts whoever bears its command amulet and intercedes between the bearer and any threat. Although it isn’t mindless, a shield guardian has no sense of self preservation and will sacrifice itself to protect its master.

Shield guardians are typically constructed of steel, stone, and wood in the shape of watchful soldiers. More fanciful designs exist, reflecting the tastes of their creators. Given their resilience, it’s common for shield guardians to eventually serve creatures other than their creators. A shield guardian’s command amulet might be passed down through a magic-using society or family for generations.

Silver Dragons.name: 银龙
Silver Dragons.text:
英勇与公义之龙

栖息地： 山地，城市； 宝藏：奥秘

银龙们致力于维护和平并鼓励善举。它们以身作则，警惕着邪恶的渗透。

银龙通常栖息于雪山之间，不过亦有一些银龙因为志向和亲和力而选择居住在繁华都会之中——它们幻形成类人，与凡人为伍。受银龙青睐的盟友包括艺术家、历史学者、骑士、甚至是了解历史并意欲创造更好的未来的谦逊领导人。

银龙受传说故事里的英雄们激励，立下远大的志向。许多银龙在收集宝藏时亦有这方面的偏好，例如喜欢收集历史事物、古老的艺术品、以及知名勇者的装备。

Silver Dragon Wyrmling.name: 银龙雏龙
Silver Dragon Wyrmling.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.lqHwLScYUg3Usyeg caption=false classes="right two lift-1 hike-1"]

Silver dragon wyrmlings typically live with one or more parents or mentors, learning much about the world and its past before living on their own.

Young Silver Dragon.name: 青年银龙
Young Silver Dragon.text: 青年银龙通常与更年长的金属龙或是英雄楷模关联密切，并帮助那些志向远大者实现其愿景。青年银龙亦可作为此等善行者的信使或代表出面。

Adult Silver Dragon.name: 成年银龙
Adult Silver Dragon.text:
成年银龙喜欢在众多的族群之中安心生活。银龙并不喜欢操弄政治，但亦会支持理想远大之人、推广教育普及者、鼓舞人心的体育赛事和节日，以及恢复利国利民的福利措施。银龙的身边往往有着许多志同道合的盟友，它们共同守望警戒着暗处的威胁。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.6qK1aHrnI99IUb07 classes="hike-1 top-frame"]

Ancient Silver Dragon.name: 远古银龙
Ancient Silver Dragon.text:
远古银龙追求世界级的改变。银龙捍卫自己的社群与盟友，鼓励它们实现传奇伟业。一些银龙将目光投向其它的世界与位面，建立跨越位面的联盟，打击横跨诸界的威胁。银龙也许在许多社会中都有伪装身份，并和英勇之人或组织缔结世代相传的友谊。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.GaZRvmKCdfjvnlTw classes="top-frame"]

Silver Dragon Lairs.name: 银龙巢穴
Silver Dragon Lairs.text:
Silver dragons typically lair in picturesque mountain retreats or on sculpted cloud “islands.”

The region containing an adult or ancient silver dragon’s lair is changed by its magic, creating the following effects:

Gentle Gusts. Winds buoy creatures that fall within 1 mile of the lair. Such creatures descend at a rate of 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling.

Sun and Storms. While in its lair, the dragon can cast Control Weather, requiring no Material components and using the same spellcasting ability as its Spellcasting action.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Skeletons.name: 骷髅
Skeletons.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.HLWqOiQIe0JYK47X classes="top-frame"]

恶生白骨/em>

栖息地： 异界（堕影冥界），幽暗地域，城市 宝藏： 无

各种死灵法师和恶灵都会唤起骷髅。这些骷髅有的来自远古遗骸，有的则是怀揣恶意的新鲜白骨，但都会为了召唤者的目标劳作不休，通常会担任守护者、士兵或劳工的职责。也有些骷髅被复活时没有任何指令，不过这是极少数情况了。掷一次骷髅默剧表，或从中选择一个结果，以此作为灵感来决定这种未接收指令的骷髅的行为。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmSkeletonPantom rollable classes="caption-top"]

Skeleton.name: 骷髅
Skeleton.text: 骷髅，是类人生物骸骨的复生，仍然穿戴着其生前的装备。对比起同样蹒跚的丧尸，骷髅更为敏捷。虽然它们并没有自己制定计划的能力，但同样会避免一些明显的障碍物或者自灭行为。

Warhorse Skeleton.name: 骷髅战马
Warhorse Skeleton.text: 骷髅战马是一种忠诚的超自然战马，依然穿戴着生前马甲的残骸。通常由其生前骑手的尸体所驾驭。

Minotaur Skeleton.name: 骷髅牛头人
Minotaur Skeleton.text: 骷髅牛头人是复生的牛头人骸骨，或者是用多种生物骸骨拼合成了类似牛头人的形状。这些骷髅巨怪有着更快的速度和更大的力量。其角和巨斧都是对活物的威胁。

Flaming Skeleton.name: 燃火骷髅
Flaming Skeleton.text: 燃火骷髅满溢着死灵能量，并形成了燃烧的火焰。这份魔法能量还赋予了它们更炽烈的攻击，以及足以指挥次级亡灵的高等智能。

Slaadi.name: 史拉蟾
Slaadi.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.GEsmsBncwCghRgy1 classes="right two lift-50 cradle-frame"]

Chaos-Spawned Hordes of Limbo

Habitat: Planar (Limbo); Treasure: Any

Unpredictable slaadi devour and multiply across the Ever-Changing Chaos of Limbo. These toad-like, extraplanar beings embody the endless potentiality of their home plane of existence. While slaadi aren’t inherently evil, their impulses are wild and often destructive. Many are driven to propagate through supernatural processes. Unfortunately, these processes typically are fatal for other creatures.

Slaadi have no formal society. Rather, strong slaadi dominate weaker ones. Blue and red slaadi rampage across Limbo and spill into other worlds at the direction of green slaadi. More powerful slaadi have connections to the Spawning Stone, a source of chaotic magic from which the first slaadi originated. The Spawning Stone is hidden deep within Limbo, and legends tie its origins to the modron overlord Primus or the ruinous slaad lords, such as Ssendam, the golden amoeboid terror, and Ygorl, the winged skeleton. These slaad lords and others plot to spread slaadi across the multiverse.

Slaad Control Gems

A slaad born from the Spawning Stone has a magical control gem embedded in its head. If a creature claims the gem, the slaad has the &Reference[Charmed] condition and obeys the gem’s bearer. The slaad ceases to be Charmed if it is harmed by the gem’s bearer or the bearer’s allies or if the gem is returned to the slaad. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration} spell cast on a slaad destroys the gem, and the slaad ceases to be Charmed.

One can obtain a slaad’s control gem using a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplImprisonme]{Imprisonment} spell. If the slaad fails its saving throw against Imprisonment, the caster gains the gem, and the slaad isn’t imprisoned. An Incapacitated slaad’s control gem can be removed by spending 1 minute and succeeding on a [[/check ability=wis skill=med dc=20 format=long]]. Failing this check deals [[/damage average 4d10 piercing]] damage to the slaad.

Slaad Tadpole.name: 史拉蟾蝌蚪
Slaad Tadpole.text:
要是史拉蟾打赢，故事完结。要是你打赢，还有千百只排着队等着一决雌雄。

—杰比尔·斯卢姆，混沌海位面的向导

史拉蟾蝌蚪是嗷嗷待哺的新生史拉蟾。它们从史拉红蟾植入活体宿主体内里的卵中孵化而成，但也在混沌海和其他混乱界域中大量出现。在大多数情况下，一条史拉蟾蝌蚪将在孵化后的2d12小时蜕变为史拉蓝蟾——如果其宿主有能力施展3环或以上的法术，则会蜕变为史拉绿蟾。

Red Slaad.name: 史拉红蟾
Red Slaad.text: 史拉红蟾在混沌海中泛滥成灾。在那里，它们互相搏斗，鸣叫，无休止地解体与重塑着由漂浮着的位面物质组成的岛屿。当遭遇了非史拉蟾的生物时，史拉红蟾会尝试与其玩耍，与其心灵沟通，或是将其吞噬。这些率性的冲动每时每刻都在变化。对于那些因史拉红蟾的爪击而被植入史拉蟾蝌蚪，或携带着其他史拉蟾诅咒的生物，史拉红蟾会本能地避免伤害它们。

Blue Slaad.name: 史拉蓝蟾
Blue Slaad.text: 史拉蓝蟾的数量与史拉红蟾相当，它们是肌肉虬结的残暴怪物，从其爪背延伸出恶毒的尖刀。这些利爪携带着一种名为混沌噬菌体的魔法性诅咒，可以将受害者转化为史拉红蟾或绿蟾。史拉蓝蟾总与史拉红蟾相伴且行为举止相近。它们天生就能通过各种征兆分辨出混沌噬菌体感染者，并且会避免去杀害已携带了混沌噬菌体或其他史拉蟾诅咒的生物。

Green Slaad.name: 史拉绿蟾
Green Slaad.text: 当史拉红蟾或蓝蟾的繁衍方式影响到某些能够施展3环或以上法术的生物时，史拉绿蟾便应运而生。史拉绿蟾比它们蓝色与红色的同胞要更加有智慧，它们经常带领着族裔们穿越传送门，前往那些被史拉灰蟾定为合适的类人群落大肆侵略。

Gray Slaad.name: 史拉灰蟾
Gray Slaad.text: 史拉绿蟾经由产卵石或史拉蟾领主而蜕变为史拉灰蟾。它们在位面之间探索，寻找接邻着位面通路的类人群落作为侵略目标。

Death Slaad.name: 史拉亡蟾
Death Slaad.text:
史拉蟾领主们将它们的混沌能量的一部分注入史拉灰蟾之中，由此创造出史拉亡蟾。当大群的史拉蟾蓄意行动时，往往是史拉亡蟾充当了背后的策划者。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.9SwmCCzeT5dNGnmw classes="bottom-frame"]

Solar.name: 炽天神使
Solar.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.YyczqMwvlhGVjR3p caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Angelic Protector of the Multiverse

Habitat: Planar (Upper Planes); Treasure: Any

Solars stand as the final line of defense between unspeakable evils and the order of the multiverse. They are the servants of just deities and ageless forces of good. Their interests span the planes, but they rarely intervene in conflicts on the worlds of the Material Plane. When they act, they lead vast angelic hosts and wield holy weapons capable of laying low the wickedest Fiends.

Solars can resurrect the dead and often use that power to enlist mortal aid. They bestow grand, new purposes on those they return to life. Solars don’t enforce these destinies, but they trust in the potential of mortals to achieve great things.

Spectator.name: 观察者眼魔
Spectator.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Vh8ZTTC3B3K32ZSR caption=false classes="right three lift-50 right-corner-frame"]

Magic-Bound Beholder-Kin

Habitat: Underdark; Treasure: Any

Invoking mysterious rites involving four beholder eyestalks, a spellcaster can mold aberrant dreams into a beholder-like guardian. Called a spectator, the being summoned by such a ritual resembles a beholder with five magical eyes—a central eye and four on stalks arrayed around the crown of the creature’s spherical body.

A spectator serves its conjurer for 101 years by guarding something of the spellcaster’s choice—typically a treasure or location. The spectator is a reliable guardian and allows only its summoner access to what it protects. A spectator might converse with other creatures, openly discussing its orders and the magic-user who conjured it, but it has no ambitions of its own and won’t abandon its post. Should an intruder ignore its warnings, a spectator attempts to drive away the intruder with its magical eye rays.

At the end of its service, a spectator might discorporate back into nothingness or wander away, seeking to learn more of the multiverse.

Specter.name: 恶灵
Specter.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.GmMDiRipXOs06cVL classes="top-frame"]

怨怒之精，索命之灵

栖息地： 幽暗地域，城市 宝藏： 无

恶灵是被黑暗和负面情绪所吸引，吸收生命力的无形灵体。这些满怀怨恨的灵体和他们的生前没有任何联系，只是为了品尝生命和人情而去汲取凡性的内蕴。

恶灵会去寻找有着邪恶生物存在的地点，依靠后者所激发的痛苦为食。你可以从恶灵作祟表格中选择一个或者随机一个结果来决定恶灵潜藏的地方。掷一次恶灵作祟表，或从中选择一个结果，以此作为灵感来决定恶灵潜藏在什么样的地方。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmSpecterHaunts0 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Sphinxes.name: 斯芬克斯
Sphinxes.text:
集秘者，守密人

栖息地：荒漠，异界（上层位面）； 宝藏： 奥秘

半似球兮半似盘，沧海明珠狼王坛。玄色鹅绒缀珍宝，素盈虚，亦不变。

—白羽山之谜

斯芬克斯守护着多元宇宙之秘。它们由贤人和探险家的精魂生成，深知真理的力量和保护其的重要性。斯芬克斯只与那些证明了自己聪慧或是通过品格考验——比如猜谜或是与危险的野兽战斗——的人分享自己的睿智。在其生命历程中，随着对宇宙奥秘的理解更加细致，斯芬克斯的形态可能会随之改变。

Sphinx of Wonder.name: 求索斯芬克斯
Sphinx of Wonder.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.0GZl0OiEE18W1wXA caption=false classes="top-frame"]

求索斯芬克斯羽毛鲜艳，体型与幼狮相仿。每当物质位面出现一个独特的想法，就会诞生一只求索斯芬克斯。每只求索斯芬克斯都着迷于某个特定类型的故事或是研究领域，尽其所能的学习有关该主题的知识。它额头上的独特印记代表着它所着迷的知识。有时，求索斯芬克斯会与凡人学者建立联系，帮助他们进行研究。

Sphinx of Secrets.name: 隐秘斯芬克斯
Sphinx of Secrets.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.LUT0zFu34iJ38ln9 caption=false classes="top-frame"]

隐秘斯芬克斯通常与有着强大魔法或知识的场所有关。这些不朽存在度过的岁月常常比这些场所更加悠久，它们会在继续自己研究的同时保护这些遗址。隐秘斯芬克斯极力守护着它们的住所和研究成果。

Sphinx of Lore.name: 晓谕斯芬克斯
Sphinx of Lore.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.6xQD6Wxg7CQLKlZM caption=false classes="right two lift-1 side-frame"]

Sphinxes of lore each know a great secret and protect it all costs. This truth might take the form of an ancient text, a magical puzzle, or a path to another world. These sphinxes might gain reputations as sages or oracles, but they typically dwell far from civilization.

Sphinx of Valor.name: 勇气斯芬克斯
Sphinx of Valor.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.Vw2EhCBu1TQI4C1R caption=false classes="right two lift-1"]

Sphinxes of valor guard world-changing or dangerous secrets—evidence of weird truths, deadly Artifacts, and things that shouldn’t exist. They inhabit hidden, magical sites and hold their duty above mortal life. If threatened, a sphinx of valor defends its charge with its supernaturally empowered roar and fierce strikes.

Sphinx Lairs.name: 斯芬克斯巢穴
Sphinx Lairs.text:
Sphinxes typically dwell in places that hold great knowledge or prophetic magic.

The region containing a sphinx of lore’s or sphinx of valor’s lair is altered by its presence, creating the following effects:

Distant Sight. While in its lair, the sphinx can cast Clairvoyance, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as its Spellcasting action. When cast this way, the spell’s range is 1 mile.

Infusion of Knowledge. Whenever the sphinx or one of its allies takes a Study action while within 1 mile of the lair, it adds 1d6 to any ability check it makes for that action.

If the sphinx dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Spies.name: 间谍
Spies.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.lcC54TvIR8emPcVl caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Infiltrators and Informants

Habitat: Any; Treasure: Implements, Individual

Spies gather information and disseminate lies, manipulating people to gain the results the spies’ patrons desire. They’re trained to manipulate, infiltrate, and—when necessary—escape in a hurry. Many adopt disguises, aliases, or code names to maintain anonymity. Roll on or choose a result from the Spy Personas table to inspire a spy’s disguise.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmSpyPersonas000 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Spy.name: 间谍
Spy.text: 间谍们使用魅力与欺骗来掩盖其真实意图。如果被迫加入战斗，他们会试图安静而直接地结束冲突。

Spy Master.name: 间谍大师
Spy Master.text: 间谍大师是情报领域经验丰富的顶尖人物，它们不会在行动时留下自己出现过的证据。

Spined Devil.name: 棘魔
Spined Devil.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.527Mp3A5JPvl5SFG caption=false classes="right two lift-50"]

Devil of Intrusion and Suspicion

Habitat: Planar (Nine Hells); Treasure: None

Spined devils, also known as spinagons, lurk in the shadows of the Lower Planes, seeking secrets for their infernal lords. They prefer to attack from the air, flinging wicked barbs while staying out of reach of foes. Spined devils collect information to gain leverage over mortals or to entice powerful devils. Roll on or choose a result from the Spined Devil Intelligence table to inspire what information a spined devil seeks or already possesses.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmSpinedDevilInt rollable classes="caption-top"]

Spirit Naga.name: 阴魂纳迦
Spirit Naga.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.40eKE22ybAx8jNEO caption=false classes="top-frame"]

铭刻怨念的恶毒蛇灵

栖息地： 异界（下层位面），幽暗地域；
宝藏： 奥秘

阴魂纳迦憎恶着世间与众生。这些怨毒的眼镜蛇类生物具有完美的记忆力，使它们铭记不朽的生命中所遭受的每一丝冒犯。它们蛰伏在阴湿而压抑的巢穴之中，为哪怕最微不足道的冒犯而策划着恶毒的报复。

阴魂纳迦觊觎着一切它们自认应得之物。它们的阴谋由毒药，恶咒，诅咒之物，或支配魔法编织而成，也促使它们成为了亵渎知识与邪恶启迪的源泉。其他恶人时常寻找阴魂纳迦作为它们的顾问或盟友。掷一次阴魂纳迦积怨表，或从中选择一个结果，以此启发并决定是什么成为了使阴魂纳迦去编织阴谋的动力。

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmSpiritNagaGrie rollable classes="caption-top"]

Sprite.name: 小仙灵
Sprite.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.QqJOHBJmDx4g36Jc caption=false classes="right two lift-50 corner-frame"]

Elusive Defender of Fey Realms

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Feywild); Treasure: Armaments

Sprites dwell in mystical forests touched by the magic of the Feywild, living peacefully with most other Fey and friends of nature. These foot-tall spirits of nature resemble elves with exaggerated, whimsical features and gossamer wings.

Sprites can sense the innate goodness or wickedness of other creatures. Those that enter their realms with good intentions might be treated to tiny feasts and celebrations. The wicked face nasty tricks and bold ambushes at the hands of invisible sprite defenders. These woodland guardians enchant the arrows of their tiny bows with charming magic that can pierce the heart of the fiercest foe.

Sprites oppose any creatures that seek to harm places of natural magic and beauty. This can put them into conflict with would-be settlers, monsters like ettercaps, and despoilers such as goblinoids and hags. They frequently aid other good creatures of the forest, including treants and unicorns, in defending their homes.

The tree had a wee village nestled in its boughs, I swear. Next thing I knew, I was lyin’ face-down in the dirt. My head was full of stars, an’ when I stood up an’ looked around, both the tree an’ the wee village were gone.

—Tale of Haravak the Ranger

Stirges.name: 蚊蝠
Stirges.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.OYjnSNrYwnfQZPH7 caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Notorious, Clinging Bloodsuckers

Habitat: Desert, Forest, Grassland, Hill, Mountain, Swamp, Underdark, Urban; Treasure: None

Stirges are bat-size vermin with dagger-length proboscises that attach to other creatures and drain life from them. Stirges are most active at night and hide in shadowy places during the day. If disturbed, they take flight and defend themselves. Roll on or choose a result from the Stirge Roosts table to inspire where stirges might lurk.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmStirgeRoosts00 rollable classes="caption-top"]

Stirge.name: 蚊蝠
Stirge.text: 单只蚊蝠通常只是个小麻烦，但如果它们吸附的速度快于受害者挣脱的速度，数只蚊蝠便可能致命。

Swarm of Stirges.name: 蚊蝠集群
Swarm of Stirges.text: 蚊蝠集群有时会在沼泽和幽暗地域洞窟中形成，吸干牲畜和其它无法逃脱的生物。

Stone Giant.name: 石巨人
Stone Giant.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.MlxbO3PHJOKevEku caption=false classes="top-frame"]

磐石大地之巨人

栖息地： 山地，幽暗地域； 宝藏： 武备

幽深的洞穴和山间的峡谷中，石巨人凝视着那充满力量的，坚韧的大地。石巨人拥有粗犷的外貌，皮肤上的纹路和色调与它们家园附近的岩石相似。这使得体型庞大的它们能够巧妙地融入石质环境中。

石巨人很少干涉其他生物——无论是体型较小的邻近族群，还是其他巨人族类。它们大多行动迟缓，宁可忍受艰难困苦，也要静待危机过去。但当它们被激怒时——尤其是当古老的奇迹之地或它们的家园遭受威胁时，石巨人能释放出山峦般的伟力，以山崩之势碾碎敌人。

石巨人常常沉迷于自然奇观之谜，如山峰的尖顶、水晶的构造或神秘的岩画。它们中的一些人对隐藏于大地之中的魔法和秘密了如指掌。那些被困于幽暗地域的石巨人，往往将地表世界及其居民视为由沉睡中的原始生物、奇异神灵或其他实体在梦中构想出来的幻象。

Stone Golem.name: 石魔像
Stone Golem.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.ae4V17gG0tiCQo34 caption=false classes="right three lift-1"]

Guardian of the Storied and Sacred

Habitat: Any; Treasure: None

Stone golems take varied forms, such as weathered carvings of ancient deities, lifelike sculptures of heroes, or any other shape their makers imagine. No matter their design or the rock from which they’re crafted, these golems are strengthened by the magic that animates them, allowing them to follow their creators’ orders for centuries.

Exercise discernment when deciding the golem’s appearance, as your creation is likely to long outlive its model.

—Manual of Stone Golems

Stone golems are typically created to protect places of significance to a group, such as a monument to an important event, a leader’s tomb, or a faith’s sanctuary. Roll on or choose a result from the Stone Golem Orders table to inspire the commands a stone golem follows.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmStoneGolemOrde rollable classes="caption-top"]

Storm Giant.name: 风暴巨人
Storm Giant.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.RLN95e3lJZwcPvvb caption=false classes="right two lift-50 cradle-frame"]

Giant of Seas and Skies

Habitat: Coastal, Underwater; Treasure: Armaments

Among the tallest giants, storm giants live amid extreme forces of nature. In palaces at the bottom of the sea and castles floating amid the clouds, they revel in the power of mighty storms. When angered, they can shape the weather and call down devastating lightning. More often, though, these giants watch the rise and fall of nations and interpret supernatural omens, interfering in the world only when they’re needed most.

Succubus.name: 魅魔
Succubus.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.1N0k6QtiF0WTNCbg caption=false classes="right two lift-50 top-frame"]

Life-Draining Seducer

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Urban;
Treasure: Implements

Succubi prey on mortals physically and exploit their waking desires. They relish corrupting virtuous souls and the pain an individual’s downfall can cause. Once their targets are at their lowest, succubi slay their victims with their essence-draining kiss.

Through fiendish rites, succubi can transform into incubi to manipulate their prey in dreams as well as the waking world. They can also change shape to torment their victims. These tempters can dominate Humanoids, but they usually do so to reinforce their manipulations or defend themselves rather than controlling others outright. Roll on or choose a result from the Succubus Temptations table to inspire how a succubus toys with its victims.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmSuccubusTempta rollable classes="caption-top"]

Tarrasque.name: 泰拉斯奎
Tarrasque.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.j3GbchJO8Ksa9lS8 caption=false classes="right three lift-1 right-cradle-frame"]

The Shape of Calamity

Habitat: Urban; Treasure: None

Among the most devastating creatures in existence, the tarrasque is an engine of catastrophe and a ruiner of nations. A terror of massive size and overwhelming might, this primeval destroyer survives from the earliest epochs of the Material Plane, when it served as a weapon of immortal forces. Since then, the tarrasque has slumbered in secret, rising every few ages to usher in eras of destruction.

The tarrasque is a bipedal, prehistoric Monstrosity that stands over seventy feet tall. Bristling with horns and spikes, its spiny carapace deflects harm and can reflect magical attacks.

The tarrasque is a creature of tireless rage. It lashes out at any creature that catches its attention, thrashing with claws and its mighty tail while swallowing smaller beings whole. It seems to take instinctual offense at the works of lesser beings, venting its rage at buildings, bridges, ships, and monuments. The larger a structure or foe is, the greater the tarrasque’s wrath.

It is a mystery what—if anything—calms the tarrasque, but eventually it returns to its slumber, leaving the world irrevocably changed. While the tarrasque might be halted by incredible opposition, its threat can never be wiped from the multiverse. Whenever the tarrasque is defeated, another tarrasque awakes somewhere else on the Material Plane.

Few things survive the tarrasque’s rampages, and reports of the monster’s devastation are often contradictory, incomplete, or beyond belief. In cases where it leaves no survivors, its calamities might initially be blamed on evil dragons or magical disasters, but the tarrasque frequently leaves behind some unmistakable indication of its passage. Roll on or choose a result from the Tarrasque Evidence table to inspire what marks the monster’s rampages.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.tables.RollTable.mmTarrasqueEvide rollable classes="caption-top"]

Thri-kreen.name: 螳螂人
Thri-kreen.text:
@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmArtHandouts000.JournalEntryPage.IS1f3lzcSPlee78r caption=false classes="right two lift-50 right-cradle-frame"]

Mantid Psychics and Scavengers

Habitat: Desert, Grassland; Treasure: Armaments

Thri-kreen are mantis-like wanderers who harness their innate camouflage and psychic abilities to survive. Different groups of thri-kreen have distinct carapaces, from the rocky shades of desert-dwellers to the vibrant hues of those living in verdant lands. While their language has a distinctly insectile quality, thri-kreen often use telepathy to communicate, and groups can rapidly share a wealth of detailed information without making a sound.
